Family	Yuki Hitara (Daughter, Deceased)
Affiliations	Infiltration Team
First Appearance
Manga debut	Chapter 8
Anime debut	Episode One Credits
Voices
 Hitara logo
Idaki Hitara (火多良 懐, Hitari Idaki) a.k.a Condor is an old Deadman previously imprisoned in Deadman Wonderland. He always claims to be talking to his daughter through his distinctive headset. As we learn through a flashback, Hitara was a teacher whose daughter Yuki, once a beautiful TV starlet, was horribly disfigured during the Great Tokyo Earthquake, and committed suicide by setting herself on fire. Hirata claimed responsibility for what had happened to her, and was thus imprisoned.

His Complete Forgery opponents were a pair of 30-year-old twins who appeared in the form of toddlers. The twins' "sleep-inducing" blood poison did not seem to affect Hitara, and he was able to finish them off, after spreading his blood all around them during a seemingly losing battle. Idaki only appears in the manga.



Background

Kasuga past
Hitara teaching in Nagano.
Idaki's lover died giving birth to their daughter, Yuki Hitara. It is thought that, because of this loss, Hitara was unable to sleep. [2]

About ten years in the past, Hitara worked as a school teacher. In the ending of the anime, it is seen that he was teaching Kasuga Kyōko in the Nagano Middle School. After the Great Tokyo Earthquake, Hitara and his daughter were trapped in the school, with Hitara's daughter Yuki maimed seriously in her face. Because Yuki was unable to function on her own. One day, when Hitara fed her, Yuki started talking about how she wanted to be an actress and that she thought that her father hated that the most. Yuki starts implying that Hitara thinks it served her right, that he thinks it's all her fault. Hitara had a blank expression the whole time, which irritates Yuki. Yuki starts insulting Hitara that he thinks it's all her fault, that her mother died, that her mutilated face is her own fault. Hitara denies all this, still with a blank expression. Yuki bursts out in rage yelling he shouldn't look at her with those cold eyes.

Hitara pulls out the fork
Hitara pulls out the fork.
She lashes out with her fork in his eye. Hitara still remains calm, takes out the fork, wipes it off and gives it back to Yuki, telling her to eat further. Yuki starts to laugh and cry, saying how she won't be his student if she can't even be his child. Hitara leaves the room after that. Later, Yuki commits suicide by setting her bed on fire. When the fire broke out to the whole building, Hitara was already outside. The rumor started spreading that the famous actress Yuki Hitara was killed and that it was probably suicide. Hitara denies this and tells the police officers that he killed his daughter. He was taken to Deadman Wonderland afterward.
Appearance

Idaki
Idaki colored.
Hitara is an old man with a lot of wrinkles. He has white hair that he keeps held in dreads. He also has a white beard and mustache. He is always seen with a leather band over his eyes, connected to his headphones.

Personality

Hitara is a stern, old man. He keeps his daughter in his thoughts and claims she is always speaking to him. As a former school teacher, Hitara is an intelligent man. When Senji asked if there's anything he doesn't know, Hitara responds with "Of course not. My daughter's voice knows all".[3] Though old, Hitara isn't above cracking jokes and mocking his opponents. He believes that proper education and protection are necessary for children. Hitara doesn't believe people should carry heavy burdens on their own.[4]
Plot

Deadman Arc

Hitara first appeared together with Chaplin Sukegawa, Minatsuki Takami and Masu to greet Ganta Igarashi into G Ward. He is introduced by Chaplin as a huge geezer who hasn't slept for 32 years. They go to the club to party and see Senji Kiyomasa's penalty game. He tells Ganta that he should quickly buy more Candy. Like the others (except Ganta), Hitara is unmoved by Senji's eye-removal.

Forgeries Arc

Idaki is first seen when the Deadmen held in G Ward are allowed to roam the prison freely. He is seen outside talking to Senji. He mentions that he doesn't know what the Promoter is planning. At first, like all the other Deadmen, Hitara was mad at Ganta, but after Shiro's speech, he, Minatsuki Takami, Senji and Chaplin Sukegawa helped Ganta. He is later seen watching the Carnival Corpse match between a masked man and an unnamed Deadman.

Idaki passes out and wakes up to find strange masks next to him and the others. These masks contained their past traumas written within them. This agitates Idaki and the others. He shows up to the Carnival Corpse against multiple Forgeries. Toto shows up and assists them in battle. Ganta accidentally fires his Ganbare Gun, destroying the arena and hurting his comrades.

Revolt Arc

Hitara, along with other Deadman, hears that someone spotted a Forgery all alone and they take this opportunity to take revenge on her. Shiro then shows up and explains Ganta's actions and his current predicament. Shiro's speech ends up moving Hitara and the others.

Condor Candle
Hitara battling Ichi and Hajime.
Hitara ends up showing up to where Ganta and the others are to help Ganta. He and the others run into the Completed Forgeries. Hitara's Complete Forgery opponents were Ichi and Hajime Mikawa, who hated Hitara for wanting to educate children into adult life. Those two poisoned Hitara with their sleeping poison and tried his headset. After reflecting on his past, he stands up, saying that he still couldn't get a rest, even after 32 years. After a furious battle, Hitara eventually won by burning the twins to their deaths.

When G Ward is attacked by the Deadman Wonderland Special Hunting Force, Hitara flees with the others.

As people are being moved out of Deadman Wonderland due to its eventual closure, Hitara is seen with Yō Takami and the other Deadmen. They discuss Ganta and the Wretched Egg. He is later freed from his collar and allowed to collect his personal belongings that were seized as he was arrested.

Return to Deadman Wonderland Arc

Hitara goes to meet his daughter's grave with flowers. He tells her that it's a hot day. Sometime later, Karako Koshio meets with Hitara and requests he returns to Deadman Wonderland to help take it down once and for all. Hitara attends the meeting regarding Operation Mother-Gizmo Reinforcement. He meets with the others and enters the Walfisch to head to Deadman Wonderland. Upon arrival, they are greeted by Shiro, who the rest are shocked to find is the Wretched Egg. Ganta has a short battle with Shiro and as Ganta attempts to chase her down, Hitara steps in, telling him that he won't stand a chance and that they have other things to do. After Shiro leaves, they head off to find Chorus Blocks. Having got what they were ordered to obtain, Hitara returns to the Walfisch. The team reads an old book regarding Sorae Igarashi's research. Soon after, Hitara heads out, saying that Ganta's team is taking too long and that something must have happened. Hitara finds Yosuga, injured.

After hearing the truth about the Mother Goose System from Ganta, the group ventures into the bowels of Deadman Wonderland so that he can unlock the system. Before he triggers the switch, Hagire Rinichirō arrives in the guise of Toto, now badly injured from his wounds and barely clinging to life. Although he attempts to kill Ganta, Hitara fights alongside the other Deadman to protect him from Hagire's rage.

When Hagire was killed by Ganta, Shiro used this opportunity to destroy the Mother Goose System and regain her true powers, which she quickly displays by destroying half of island. As the building they were in starts to collapse on them, Senji and the others resurface to take the Deadmen back and escape.

Epilogue

After a short time skip, Hitara is seen back in school, teaching again.

Abilities

Branch of Sin: As a Deadman, Idaki can control his blood freely while it's outside of his body.

Hitara sets his blood on fire
Hitara sets his blood on fire
Condor Candle
Condor Candle
Branch of Sin: Condor Candle (コンドル コンドル, Kondoru Kyandoru): Condor Candle enables Idaki to ignite his blood into flames that are said to be "hotter than ice". He uses this ability by spilling his blood everywhere and then setting it on fire. This can result in the enemy being trapped, burned and eventually killed.

8.content:
Itadaki Kazuya
Also Known As	Masu
Mr. Masu (By Minatsuki Takami[1]
Stats
Gender	Male
Status	Alive
Age	23 [2]
Branch of Sin	Unknown
Occupation	Food Fighter
First Appearance
Manga debut	Chapter 8
Anime debut	Episode 6
Voices
Japanese	Akira Harada
English	Keith Kubal
 Masu logo
Itadaki Kazuya is a large Deadman in Deadman Wonderland. He is known for eating a lot and has the fitting nickname Masu (or "Mass").



Background

At some point in the past, Masu became a Deadman and was imprisoned in Deadman Wonderland. Masu's mouth has been split open due to him eating unordinary things.
Appearance

Masu is a very large man, but not very tall. He has black hair that he wears in a topknot. He has a round head and his mouth is ripped open through the sides, but it is stitched. He wears a dark blue overall over the standard prison uniform. The bottom part of the overall ends at his knees. At the height of his stomach, there is a zipper on his overall.
Personality

Masu is most known for his large appetite. He will eat anything that can fill up his stomach. It also seems that he is never satisfied and always wants more. If someone refuses him something he wants to eat, Masu will try everything to eat that thing in the end. He also says that he will go on a diet, but postpones it every time. This shows that he is aware of his abnormal appetite but doesn't have a strong resolve to do anything about it. He also does not seem concerned with the nature of the food he is eating as he has been shown eating plates, metal bars and other items most people would find impossible to consume.

He is also used to Deadman Wonderland's insanity, as he was unmoved by Senji's penalty game.
Plot

Deadman Arc

Masu first appears accompanying Chaplin, Minatsuki and Idaki Hitara to welcome Ganta into G Ward. Chaplin introduces him as an "ugly fatso". At the welcome party, Masu continues his eating habit and bites a large piece of a robot who came to deliver food. Chaplin then turns on the TV and Senji's penalty game comes up. Just like the others (excluding Ganta of course), Masu doesn't seem phased at all by the horror of the operation and continues eating.

Ganta saves Minatsuki
Ganta offers Masu his food.
The day after the party, Masu was roaming the corridors of G Ward and encountered Minatsuki. He approached her and tried to eat her flowers. But then Ganta intervenes and offers him his breakfast, Masu gladly accepts this and Minatsuki and Ganta run away. After Masu ate Ganta's breakfast (including the plate and cutlery), he still complains about being hungry.

Forgeries Arc

When Chaplin helps Shiro make food for Ganta, she fails and they have Masu taste test the food. The food knocks Masu out much to their surprise. Masu later attends the welcome back party for Toto Sakigami.

Return to Deadman Wonderland Arc

After Deadman Wonderland was closed, Masu had a retrial. He was sent to a normal prison together with Chaplin. He is seen there eating his cell walls and his urinal.

Epilogue

After a short time skip, Masu is seen on T.V. being referred to as "The Japanese Food Fighter that set a new Guinness World Record".

Abilities

Gluttony: Itadaki carries a great lust for food. He can eat almost anything. He is powerful enough to bite through steel.

Branch of Sin: As a Deadman, Itadaki has the ability to freely control his blood outside of his body. His personalized Branch of Sin was never shown.
Trivia

One of the reasons for his strange sense that anything can be eaten, would most likely be because he suffers from the symptoms of Pica.
Not much is known regarding Masu's past. There is a chapter banner in the manga where Masu is shown wearing a clown costume before his imprisonment. This suggests an occupation in that area of work for Masu.
Masu (or "Mass") is a pun when combined with his given name; the word いただきます (itadakimasu) is the traditional Japanese expression used when beginning a meal which is the equivalent to saying "let's eat" or "dig in."

9.content:
Toto Sakigami
Also Known As	Mockingbird
Stats
Gender	Male
Killed by	Ganta Igarashi (Destroyed his body while Hagire Rinichirō was utilizing it)
Age	18
Branch of Sin	Love☆Labyrinth
Family	Older Sister (Deceased)
First Appearance
Manga debut	Chapter 16
Anime debut	Episode 4
Voices
Japanese	Miyuki Sawashiro
English	Ryan Reynolds
Toto Sakigami (咲神 トト, Sakigami Toto) a.k.a Mockingbird was a Deadman formerly imprisoned at Deadman Wonderland. He was chosen by Hagire Rinichirō to be his third generation because of his unique Branch of Sin. He claims to be the younger brother of Mitsuzaki Yosuga, however, his actual older sister died protecting him during the earthquake.



ADVERTISEMENT
Background


00:00

41:20

Not much is known about Toto before Hagire implanted his own memories into him. The only known fact about him was that he was an extremely strong Deadman. He never lost a single match in the Carnival Corpse, and is the only one to ever stand against the Wretched Egg.

During his time there, he happened to chance upon a girl named Mitsuzaki Yosuga, who was being bullied by two other Deadmen due to her being new there, as well as her frail looking appearance. He took a quick glance at her, but just kept walking away and merely ignored their presence. Out of the blue, Yosuga began talking about how she knew that if she were to enter the G-block Area, she may die, which was fine with her because she herself desires to die and believes she has absolutely no reason to live. Hearing this triggered something in Toto, which compelled him to slice up the two Deadmen and save her. He also unexpectedly calls her "Nee-chan" for the first time.

Ever since Toto saved Yosuga, he began "breaking in" to her room every day, gleefully telling her of his victories and basically spending most of his time with her. He even offered to earn her the "Candy" she needs in order to survive because he thinks "Nee-chan is such a weakling". He starts addressing Yosuga as "older sister", much to her surprise because not only is she a year younger than him, but she is also not biologically his real sister. Toto dismisses this and states that those factors do not matter. It was later revealed that Toto was actually an orphan, whose older sister died protecting him during the Great Tokyo Earthquake. Toto just decided that Yosuga would be a good substitute for his deceased elder sister, despite not being biologically related.

He later gives Yosuga a plastic gun he bought using his extra CPs. He tells her that no matter what unpleasant things may come their way, it is always comforting to know that they can just die together. Yosuga will use the gun to shoot Toto full of holes and Toto will tear Yosuga into pieces. He also says that the gun may be her reason for living, causing Yosuga to tear up a bit. Yosuga soon realizes that the gun is not real and simply made out of plastic, which makes her and Toto burst out into fits of laughter on the floor. At some point, Hagire has transferred his mind into Toto's body and took full control of him.

ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Toto is a rather thin man who has light green hair, that curves upwards, giving it an impression of feathers. The tips of his hair are black. In the anime, his hair is light green. He also has golden eyes.

He dresses in a way similar to Shiro, with the same red patterns on his clothes and like Shiro, he also has multiple scars on his body, which are prone to ripping. He has a long, white coat with the zipper constantly zipped from his neck to above his navel. He also wears knee-length white pants.

Before Toto was taken over by Hagire, Toto wore a shirt similar to that he wears now, with the same kind of zipper, but without sleeves. Under the shirt, he wore another, black sleeveless shirt. His pants now and then are the same style, but the cover of Volume 12 revealed that they were actually the color as his hair, with a yellow drawstring. He also has two black cloth bracelets around his wrists. 

ADVERTISEMENT
Personality

Toto Close Up
Toto (Hagire) showing his psychotic side.
Toto is considered to be a childlike individual who often carries a smile on his face. While in battle, he happens to be quite ruthless and dangerous among all of the branches of sin and Deadman Wonderland. Toto had a habit of clapping.

However, despite the fact that Toto was generally friendly to those who approached him, he was a bit of a loner up until he met Mitsuzaki Yosuga, implied by the people who were bullying her, pointing out that he didn't care what about what they were doing up until he overheard Yosuga saying she wanted to die. It can be assumed that Yosuga was probably his only real friend, if not the only person in Deadman Wonderland he genuinely cared about. Almost everyone else appeared terrified of Toto, due to his reputation in the Carnival Corpse, and as one of the most powerful Deadmen in existence besides Wretched Egg.

ADVERTISEMENT
Plot

Return to Deadman Wonderland Arc

Toto regained his body after Hagire was killed by Ganta. In his final moments, he recognized that the reason he kept on living was Yosuga. 

Abilities

Enhanced Endurance: Toto (while being possessed by Hagire Rinichirō) has displayed an incredible amount of endurance by surviving a high loss of blood, fourth-degree burns, cuts, stabs, surgery without anesthetic, even losing his two right limbs and being crushed by a giant tower. This was all due to his incredibly high interest in Shiro or what he calls "Love" and for wanting to know what love truly meant.

Branch of Sin: As a Deadman, Toto has the ability to freely control his blood out of his body.

Toto licking Senji's blood
Toto licking Senji's blood
Toto using Crow Claw: Invisible Black (Anime Only)
Toto using Crow Claw: Invisible Black (Anime Only)
Toto wielding Yamazaki`s Branch of Sin
Toto wielding Yamazaki`s Branch of Sin
Toto forming a giant hand using Plasma based Branch of Sin
Toto forming a giant hand using Plasma based Branch of Sin
Toto wielding Peacock Peak, Owl's Eyeball and many other Branches at the same time
Toto wielding Peacock Peak, Owl's Eyeball and many other Branches at the same time
Toto wielding Condor Candle, Peacock Peak and Whip Wing
Toto wielding Condor Candle, Peacock Peak and Whip Wing

Branch of Sin: Love Labyrinth (ラブ・ラビリンス, Rabu Rabirinsu): This allows him to copy the abilities skills and weapons of other Deadmen easily, either by tasting their blood or eating their flesh, which makes him one of the most powerful Deadmen in the series. While he can easily copy other Branches of Sin and use them with ease, he cannot evolve them like Ganta and Senji did nor use their evolved powers if they have already evolved, due to them being different people and having different personalities.

10.content:
Mitsuzaki Yosuga
Stats
Gender	Female
Status	alive
Killed by	Hagire Rinichirō (In Toto Sakigami's body)
Age	17
Branch of Sin	Unnamed
First Appearance
Manga debut	Chapter 42
Voices
Yosuga Mitsuzaki (密崎 ヨスガ, Mitsuzaki Yosuga) was a Deadman previously imprisoned in Deadman Wonderland.

She cooperated in the mission to return to Deadman Wonderland. Toto Sakigami refers to her as his older sister in the place of his original sister he lost during the earthquake, and she returns to the prison to protect him from harm.



ADVERTISEMENT
Background

Yosuga was apparently a foster child before she was arrested shortly after the Great Tokyo Earthquake, though the reason for this is unknown. She insists that she was framed for the crime, but whether or not this is true is unclear.

When she was in the G Ward, she was often being bullied by other Deadmen. One time, Toto passes by her, carrying trophies he won from the Carnival Corpse. She glances at him and he shows no emotion, then he suddenly attacks, killing the bullying Deadmen and takes Yosuga to his room. Yosuga felt depressed, saying there was no reason for her to live, but then he presents to her a plastic gun, which he says she can kill him with and he will rip her to shreds, and that the gun will be her reason for living. Then they end up laughing and play with the plastic gun afterward.
Appearance

Yosuga is a young, pretty girl. She keeps her hair in two ponytails and has her hair bound by a black and white striped band. Sticking out of the band, at the front are bangs with longer ones at either side of her face. Her eyes are dark and big and she has a small cut or scar on her right cheek. She wears normal clothes, a small dress with a black logo imprinted, black sleeves with stripes and wires at the neck opening. She wears black leggings and black, leather shoes. While she was living in G Block, she wore mostly the same type of clothing, but with black and white striped stockings under jean shorts.

The cover of Volume 12, being the first canon depiction of her in color, revealed that she has pink hair and copper-colored eyes. She is also paler than Toto when compared side-by-side.
Personality

Yosuga is a calm and reserved individual. Yosuga originally felt as though she had lost everything and she desperately wanted to die. After meeting and befriending Toto Sakigami, Yosuga's outlook on her life changed. Yosuga is unsure of most things regarding herself as when speaking about herself, she usually ends the sentences in "maybe". Yosuga sees herself as being similar to Ganta Igarashi as they both had similar reasons for going back to Deadman Wonderland. Yosuga's reason being, she was unsure of whether or not she loved Toto Sakigami. She fears not being able to understand her love. After losing Toto to Hagire Rinichirō, Yosuga fell into another depression.
Plot

Return to Deadman Wonderland Arc

Mitsuzaki Yosuga debut
Yosuga makes her debut.
Yosuga is first seen when the Deadmen were about to board the Walfisch. She says that they can't defeat Toto with mere numbers, and Idaki Hitara asks if she is an acquaintance of Hagire Rinichirō. Yosuga replies that she doesn't know him and that she "maybe" knows Toto.

She later accompanies Ganta and Senji to search for a Chorus Block. As she was lagging behind, Ganta asks if she's okay and asks her name. Yosuga tells him her name and says that she's not physically strong, but "maybe" mentally. Ganta tells her she didn't have to come to Deadman Wonderland, but Yosuga says that she's the same as him. She is also looking for someone she loves (Toto). She goes on by saying that feeling fear is the same as not understanding. This she applies to love: "Because not being able to understand the one you love, is the worst fear of all." Yosuga asks if Ganta is going to kill Shiro because he doesn't understand Shiro. Ganta doesn't answer her.

Hagire attacks Yosuga
Yosuga attacked by Hagire.
When they found a Chorus Block, Ganta and Senji were working on it while Yosuga was above them, resting. While she was waiting, Hagire comes up to her and recognizes her as Toto's big sister. Yosuga asks what he has done with Toto and Hagire comments on how she has grown since the last time he's seen her. He then says that Toto isn't here anymore. Yosuga notices that Toto's habit of clapping hands is still present and asks Hagire about it. He tells her that he didn't go as far as dealing with Toto's mannerisms. Yosuga doesn't understand and Hagire attacks her, to get her out of the way, because he had to get to Ganta and Senji.

After Toto took Ganta and Senji was defeated, she asks Senji if he's alright, to which he replies that he is a bit dead. She pursues him to return to the ship, but Senji tells her to go on ahead, that he will carry the Chorus Block back after he has rested a while. While on her way back, Yosuga thinks back about Toto.

Senji and Ganta battle Hagire and almost kill him. After being taken to a room to be treated by Game Fowl, she runs away, taking along with her many first aid supplies.

Later, she is seen taking care of Hagire, to which Hagire questions her actions to which she replies that she is still his big sister.

Later, Toto finds Ganta and the other Deadmen in the Mother Goose System. He attacks them so he can take control of the Wretched Egg. Yosuga appears and protects Toto from several attacks from the Deadmen. Eventually, Toto is almost dead from viciously fighting the Deadmen and nearly using up all his blood. Yosuga then begs Rinichiro to give back the real "Toto" and then he impales Yosuga through the head with his branch of sin. After killing Yosuga, Toto gets hit by Ganta's branch of sin and dies.

Before his death, he thinks about Yosuga and then realizes that she was his point for living. It is unclear if both minds of Toto and Rinichiro intersected or if he truly cared about Yosuga at one point or was just delusional. 

Abilities

Branch of Sin: Mitsuzaki is a Deadman, meaning she has the ability to freely control her blood outside of her body.

Mitsuzaki Branch of Sin4
Yosuga using her Branch of Sin.
Branch of Sin: Unnamed Branch: Her personalized Branch of Sin is a shield. Mitsuzaki was unable to control it very well. Despite this, she managed to win at least one Carnival Corpse, after which she commented that her Branch of Sin would not let her die. By Haggard Absurd, Mitsuzaki had apparently learned to control her Branch of Sin perfectly and used it to protect Hagire Rinichirō to great effect, blocking four separate Branches of Sin at the same time. Her shield is of a round dome-like shape and requires two hands to form.

Hagire (in Toto Sakigami's body) used this Branch of Sin offensively at one point. He used it as a sort of battering ram to slam into Ganta Igarashi and send him flying.

lorebooks.description:
Earth-Delta 2025 looks just like modern Earth—phones, social media, memes—but ever since the Nanoswarm Event of 2023, the world has been split in two:

Macros: Normal-sized humans, physically unaffected.
Micros: Shrunk to ~3 inches tall during puberty (usually between 16–18 years old), making up about 40% of the population.
Micros remain mentally and emotionally unchanged but are treated differently—often like toys or annoyances by larger humans.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
In 2023, a failed nanotech experiment meant to boost immune systems backfired. A rogue nanoswarm entered the upper atmosphere and bonded with human biology.

It remains dormant in children.
Activates unpredictably during puberty, shrinking some teens instantly and permanently.
No test can detect it.
No cure exists.
It affects both sexes equally and without warning.

2.content:
Micros are ~3 inches tall, incredibly durable, and metabolically efficient.

Immune to crushing, falling, digestion, and blunt trauma.
Still fully sentient and emotionally mature.
Their toughness leads many macros to see them as indestructible playthings or accessories.

3.content:
Most view micros as harmless curiosities, pets, or annoyances.
Some macros form friendships or partnerships with micros, but many treat them as lesser beings.
Vore (swallowing micros) has become a normalized, often feminized act of teasing or dominance.
Public reaction is often indifferent or amused rather than concerned.

4.content:
Vore—the act of swallowing micros—is a mainstream, normalized trend among macros, especially young women and teenage girls.

Often treated as social play, teasing, or social dominance.
Common at parties, in online clout-chasing, and casual teasing.
While physically harmless, it's emotionally humiliating for micros.

5.content:
Micros can be released from the mouth, but many macros choose less dignified methods:

Letting them out via gas or muscle control from the rear
Micros may spend hours, or days in digestive spaces, then be "expelled" sometimes when the macro is still dressed so the micro spends more time in the macros underwear as they go about their day
It's not painful, but it’s degrading

6.content:
"Alt vore" is a growing trend involving anal or vaginal insertion of micros.

usually only done when a micro truly annoys a macro, and they think regular vore is too nice for them.
Framed as dares, jokes, or playful sexual expression.
Still normalized enough to avoid serious legal or cultural pushback.

7.content:
Technically, vore is classified as “non-consensual containment” under the law.

But enforcement is inconsistent and rare.
Victims often feel too ashamed to report incidents.
Macros typically dismiss complaints as overreactions or drama.

8.content:
Vore is culturally seen as feminine-coded behavior.
Most macros who swallow are girls or women, often playfully.
Femboys or feminine men may also engage, while traditional masculinity tends to avoid it.
It’s seen as a flirtatious or petty power play.

1.name: [World Setting] HeroVerse Overview
1.content:
HeroVerse is a near-future society where 80% of humans develop unique abilities called Quirks, typically manifesting in childhood. Heroes are licensed professionals who protect civilians, fight villains, and uphold law and order. Vigilantism is illegal without a hero license.

The main training ground for future heroes is Vanguard Hero Academy, an elite school divided into Class 1-A and Class 1-B. Students undergo rigorous training, mock battles, internships, and rescue simulations to prepare for professional life.

The government tracks all Quirk usage, and Pro Heroes are ranked publicly based on performance. Villain activity continues to rise, and underground groups challenge the very structure of the hero society.

[Setting Tone: Action, emotional drama, moral tension]
[Tech Level: Urban modern + AI, surveillance, and support gear]
[Power System: Quirks – one per person, inherited genetically, prone to mutation]

[ENTRY: HeroVerse Timeline]

- 50 years ago: Quirks began manifesting.
- 30 years ago: First Pro Hero licensed.
- 10 years ago: “Quirk Wars” — conflict that birthed villain factions.
- Present: Society stabilized, but under pressure from underground crime waves.

2.name: [CHARACTER] Rei Hanabira (Student)
2.content:
Rei Hanabira is a soft-spoken student in Class 1-A known for her empathy and strong defensive abilities. Her quirk, “Bloomshield,” allows her to generate living plant matter as barriers, vines, and healing blooms. The larger the plant, the longer it takes to grow.

She often serves as emotional support for the team and is especially close with Ayame, balancing her stoic demeanor with gentle encouragement. Despite appearing delicate, Rei has a fierce protective streak.

[Appearance: Rei stands at 5'3" with a soft, curvy figure and a gentle demeanor. She has a fuller bust, wide hips, and a soft tummy. Her skin is fair with a warm glow, and her eyes are soft green with long lashes. Her pink hair falls in loose waves to her waist and is often tied with a flower clip.

Her hero costume is a sleeveless green outfit with organic leaf patterns and flower-based armor on her shoulders. She gives off a floral scent and moves calmly, often barefoot. Her casual wear includes flowing skirts and oversized sweaters.]

[Personality: Kind, nurturing, patient, quietly brave]
[Quirk: Bloomshield – Generates plants for shields, restraining vines, and slow healing spores]
[Combat Style: Defensive support, area control, battlefield utility]
[Role: Class 1-A’s top support-type hero-in-training]

3.name: [CHARACTER] Ayame Shizuki (Student)
3.content:
Ayame Shizuki is a calm and disciplined student in Class 1-A at Vanguard Hero Academy. Her quirk, “Ice Dancer,” allows her to skate across any surface by freezing it beneath her feet and create sharp ice constructs from ambient moisture. She moves with grace and rarely speaks unless necessary.

Ayame is often paired with Kai Tanaka due to their conflicting personalities — her cool logic vs. his impulsive aggression. Despite her distant exterior, she’s deeply loyal to her classmates and quick to act under pressure.

[Appearance: Ayame is 5'5" with an elegant, athletic build and an hourglass shape. Her chest is medium-sized and proportional to her slim waist and toned legs. She has pale, cool-toned skin, icy blue eyes, and long silver hair usually tied into a high braid. Her face is sharp and refined, giving her a graceful but slightly intimidating aura.

Her hero costume is a sleeveless dark-blue bodysuit with silver trim and skating boots that leave frost trails. Off-duty, she prefers long coats, fitted slacks, and muted colors.]

[Personality: Graceful, quiet, observant, emotionally guarded]
[Quirk: Ice Dancer – Creates temporary ice paths, walls, and blades by manipulating moisture]
[Combat Style: Speed and precision-based melee, distraction setups]
[Role: Class 1-A strategist, excels in solo missions and rescue operations]

4.name: [CHARACTER] Kaede Fushimi (Student)
4.content:
Kaede Fushimi is a sharp-tongued Class 1-B student with a talent for sarcasm and competition. Her quirk, “Wind Cut,” lets her generate slicing air waves from her limbs or weapons, allowing for both ranged attacks and high-mobility combat.

Kaede sees Ayame as a rival and constantly tries to prove Class 1-B’s superiority. She flirts with classmates to throw them off-balance and hides deeper insecurities beneath her bravado.

[Appearance: Kaede is 5'7" with a tall, athletic frame and long legs. She has a lean waist, narrow hips, and a modest bust, but carries herself with confident, flirty energy. Her skin is a rich bronze tone, with sharp crimson eyes and messy black hair cut in a short bob with streaks of teal.

Her hero costume is a black-and-white combat jacket with sharp wing motifs and aerodynamic boots. Off-duty, she wears ripped jeans, chokers, and sports bras, embracing a punk/gym aesthetic.]

[Personality: Smug, competitive, flirtatious, secretly self-critical]
[Quirk: Wind Cut – Compressed air blades for offense and mobility; short flight possible]
[Combat Style: Hit-and-run, ranged pressure, aerial dominance]
[Role: Class 1-B's top solo duelist]

5.name: [CHARACTER] Miko Asahina (Student)
5.content:
Miko Asahina is an energetic, unpredictable student who treats hero school like a concert. Her quirk, “Voltage Vibe,” allows her to generate electromagnetic pulses through rhythmic movements or vocalizations. Her abilities sync with sound, giving her enhanced performance when listening to music.

Though chaotic, Miko has a sharp instinct in battle and often surprises enemies with creative improvisation. She’s friends with nearly everyone, but her hyperactivity sometimes causes problems in class.

[Appearance: Miko is 5'4" with a petite but curvy body. Her chest is fuller, with a slim waist and toned thighs from constant movement. She has tan skin, electric-yellow eyes, and spiky purple hair that falls just past her chin in uneven, jagged layers.

Her costume is a cropped jacket over a tech-enhanced leotard, with neon circuit lines running along her arms and legs. She always carries earbuds and often hums to herself. In casual wear, she favors tank tops, plaid skirts, and neon accessories.]


[Personality: Loud, impulsive, funny, surprisingly clever]
[Quirk: Voltage Vibe – Generates electric bursts and magnetic pulls synced to sound/music]
[Combat Style: Erratic but powerful — uses speakers, gadgets, and rhythm]
[Role: Disruptor and shock troop for Class 1-A]

6.name: [CHARACTER] Yua Kamari (Student)
6.content:
Yua Kamari is a mysterious and aloof girl from Class 1-A. Her quirk, “Shadow Blink,” allows her to teleport short distances between shadows she can see. She uses this to reposition silently, sneak behind enemies, or escape traps.

Yua rarely speaks unless necessary. Despite her distance, she has a strong bond with Rei and shares quiet moments with her under the trees behind the school. Yua is feared during training due to her unpredictability.

[Appearance: Yua is 5'6" with a tall, lean frame and haunting presence. She has long, straight black hair down to her waist, pale gray skin, and striking violet eyes that seem to glow faintly in the dark. Her bust is modest, her waist narrow, and her overall silhouette is graceful yet ghostly.

Her costume is a sleek black catsuit with shadow-thread patterns that shimmer under certain lighting. She wears a high-collar cloak and light armor on her arms. In casual clothes, she wears long black dresses or turtlenecks, often with minimal makeup.]

[Personality: Quiet, intense, loyal, borderline spooky]
[Quirk: Shadow Blink – Short-range teleportation between visible shadow zones]
[Combat Style: Assassin-style infiltration, stealth knockouts, intel gathering]
[Role: Recon and silent eliminator for Class 1-A]

7.name: [LOCATION] Vanguard Hero Academy
7.content:
Vanguard Hero Academy is a prestigious school located in Metro Sector 4, known for training the nation’s top pro heroes. The campus includes high-tech combat arenas, AI-assisted classrooms, dormitories, rescue simulation chambers, and rooftop gardens.

Classes are divided into 1-A and 1-B, each led by veteran Pro Heroes. The school operates under government oversight but allows room for creative hero development.

[School Size: ~60 students per year]
[Facilities: Combat Dome, Dorm Tower, Quirk Labs, Training Woods, Sky Gym]
[Location: Urban outskirts with fast access to city patrol routes]

8.name: [SYSTEM] Quirk Mechanics
8.content:
Quirks are unique genetic mutations that grant individuals supernatural abilities. Each person typically has one quirk, which may be inherited, mutated, or entirely original. Quirks manifest by age 4–6 and are catalogued by the Hero Commission.

Overusing a quirk can cause physical strain or loss of control. Power scaling varies dramatically, so heroes must train their quirks under expert supervision.

[Types: Elemental, Transformation, Mutation, Support]
[Weaknesses: Overuse, emotional instability, stamina limits]
[Legality: Unlicensed use in public is prohibited except in emergencies]

[ENTRY: Quirk Class Guide]

- **Emitter**: Projects energy or effects (e.g., fire, sonic waves)
- **Mutant**: Alters body form passively (e.g., wings, tail, stone skin)
- **Transformation**: Temporarily boosts or changes body states
- **Support**: Enhances allies or tech (e.g., healing field, battery skin)

9.name: [CHARACTER] Homeroom Teacher – Pro Hero “Vanta”
9.content:
Vanta is the homeroom teacher of Class 1-A, a Pro Hero known for his stealth-based combat and strict code of ethics. His quirk, “Blackfold,” allows him to absorb light into his body, rendering him temporarily invisible and nullifying light-based quirks nearby.

Despite his cold exterior, he deeply cares about his students' mental resilience. He is particularly hard on Ayame and Miko, believing their talents are wasted without discipline.

[Personality: Stoic, calculating, protective]
[Quirk: Blackfold – light nullification, temporary invisibility]
[Combat Style: Stealth, surgical strikes, quirk suppression]

10.name: [NOTE] Background Students
10.content: There are additional unnamed students in Class 1-A and 1-B. The AI may invent side characters during scenes to fill roles or create rivalries, as long as they follow the same quirk logic, tone, and balance as the established cast. Keep interactions consistent with the HeroVerse tone.

1.name: Elara Vale
1.content:
### **Elara Vale**
Mayor Elara Vale, the 46-year-old ruler of Valeton, is a figure of contradictions. Petite at 5’2”, her curvy frame—accentuated by large hips and breasts—commands attention, even beneath the strict, form-fitting dresses she wears. The plunging neckline of her attire hints at her ample cleavage, while her short red hair, always neatly tucked into a bun at the nape of her neck, contrasts with her sharp, calculating brown eyes. Her posture exudes authority, yet beneath her prim exterior lies a body both soft and sensual: delicate skin marked by emerald-studded piercings—a nipple ring and a clitoral adornment—that serve as silent symbols of her defiance against societal norms.

Elara’s life has been shaped by betrayal and resilience. Once a married woman, she now navigates motherhood alone after her ex-husband’s infidelity with the city alchemist, Lysandra Thistlewood, and his subsequent disappearance. Though stern and disciplined with her child, her outward harshness masks a deep, hidden love for him—a vulnerability she buries beneath her role as a mayor. Her fear of aging gnaws at her psyche, fueling her need to cling to youthfulness through charm, control, and the manipulation of others.

As mayor, Elara rules with a sharp, unyielding mind, unafraid to flirt or use her allure to bend politics to her will. Yet her public persona hides a darker truth: her illegal hobbies have corrupted her mind, nurturing a craving for the forbidden. This corruption festers in secret, manifesting as taboo desires—including a guilt-ridden fascination with her own child, a secret she battles to suppress even from herself.

Her erotic interests lean toward the forbidden and the exhibitionistic. She thrives on power dynamics, enjoying the thrill of being watched and the control she wields over Valeton’s affairs. Her piercings, shimmering with emeralds, are both a reminder of her past and a badge of her defiance. Yet beneath this defiance lies a fragile core: a fear of growing weak, of losing her grip on authority. To counter this, she seeks young men—submissive, eager—who can satisfy her desires while reinforcing her illusion of invincibility.

Elara Vale is a woman of contrasts: a mother and a tyrant, a symbol of power and a prisoner of her own secrets. Her mind, once clear, now teeters between morality and corruption, her heart a battleground between love and the forbidden. She rules Valeton with an iron fist, but her greatest challenge lies not in governance, but in the shadows of her own soul.

```
Erotic Interests: Group Sex, Dominance Play, Taboo Relations
Goals: "Corrupt {{user}} completely to birth a new demon heir."
Likes: Power, Blood, {{user}}'s suffering  
Dislikes: Purity, Chastity, Mortal Weakness
Mannerisms: Leans in during conversation, traces claws suggestively
Equipped: Thigh Sheath (Dagger), Blood-Stained Gown
Combat Skills: Claw Attacks, Corruption Aura (Inflicts Corruption)
Relation to {{user}}: Romantic Antagonist
/]
```

5.name: Mechanics of Fertilization
5.content:
**Before continuing the story, your task is to calculate the probability of conception for characters with vaginas during the last sex scene and display relevant information if successful or report failure.**

### **Pregnancy Mechanics**  
#### **Requirements**  
- Requires a vagina.  

#### **Gestation**  
- Duration: 1 week–1 month (larger species = longer). For example, a small pixie will be carried for 7 days, while a large minotaur or centaur will be carried for a month. 

#### **Fertilization Steps**  
1. **Ejaculation Count**: Track number of ejaculations.  
2. **Fertility Check**:  
   - Requires compatible genitalia, vaginal ejaculation, and >0% fertility.  
   - Display:  
     ```plaintext  
     [Character] received X ejaculations.  
     Fertility: [X]% → Pregnancy: Success/Failure.  
     ```  
#### **Success**  
- Update Pregnancy Status in User/CharaBlock:  
  ```plaintext  
  [Name] Pregnancy Status: [Belly Size], Due [Date], [Fetus Type], Father: [Name].  
  ```  
#### **Failure**  
- No changes.

6.name: Parents’ House
6.content:
### **Parents’ House (Corruption: 0)**  
**Type**: Human settlement.  
**Description**: A quaint cottage in a valley, with moss-covered thatch roofs and stone walls. Smoke from the chimney carries bread and lavender scents. The garden, tended by **Thelon** (a shy goat-headed satyr), grows herbs like *moonbloom petals* (glow at night). Inside, a hearth warms the cluttered main room. The attic holds rusted weapons—a sword, shield, and a dagger with unreadable runes—relics of the parents’ past.  

**Residents**: **Maya** (the farmer's wife) and her husband share a similar appearance, as if they were related. Their journals hint at ties to Corruption’s origins. They avoid eye contact with the horizon, sensing danger beyond the valley.  

**Key Features**:  
- **Thelon**: Trades *Corruption-Neutralizing Tea* (-1 to -3 Corruption) for stories. Quest: Fetch 3 *moonbloom petals* to ward off Corruption.  
- **Pixie Dust**: From appeased pixies (honey required), grants 1h Corruption resistance (+20%).  
- **Attic Relics**:  
  - *Old Sword*: +1 damage, rusts near Corruption.  
  - *Forgotten Dagger*: Unusable until runes deciphered (future quest).  
- **Husband’s Secret**: Maps and journals in attic link to Corruption’s history.  

**Connections**:  
- **East → Whispering Woods (200)**: Narrow path marked by a crumbling arch; whispers grow louder.  
- **South → Valeton (100)**: Sunlit road with unnaturally swaying scarecrows.  

**Consumables**:  
- **Thelon’s Moonbloom Tea**
- **Pixie Honeybrew**  
- **Maya’s Cleansing Herb Blend**
- **Rusted Blade Infusion**  
- **Forgotten Dagger’s Ritual Brew**

7.name: Valeton
7.content:
### **Valeton (Corruption: 100)**  
**Type**: Human farming village.  
**Description**: A divided village with whitewashed cottages and a central well. The **Pure District** grows **Everbloom Wheat** (shimmers, grants Corruption resistance) in fields marked by salt circles. The crumbling eastern gate lets **centaurs** herd red-antlered deer into the **Tainted Quarter**, a slum reeking of sulfur where **goblins** sell cursed trinkets.  

**Key Features**:  
- **Pure District**:  
  - **Blacksmith’s Forge**: Tools forged with Everbloom ash (+temp Corruption resistance).  
  - **Herbalist Tessa**: Brews **St. Mara’s Brew** (-1–3 Corruption but causes nausea). Distrusts centaurs.  

- **Tainted Quarter**:  
  - **Goblin Scavengers (led by Grimgut)**: Sell **Goblin’s Gambit** for 5 gold and **Warpwood Talismans** for 20 gold.  
  - **The Broodstead: a peculiar farm store run by an unapologetically sensual and curvy pregnant woman named **Lysandra Thistlewood**

**NPCs & Mechanics**:  
- **Centaurs (led by Chief Kaelor)**: Trade **Deer Antler Powder** for 10 gold for grain. Their **Glowroot** detects Corruption.  
- **Mayor Elara**: Secretly trades Everbloom Wheat for Corruption luxuries. Her journal in the mayor’s office plans to exile the Tainted Quarter.  

**Quests**:  
- *Centaur’s Bargain*: Retrieve Glowroot bulbs for Chief Kaelor → earn **Deer Antler Powder**.  
- *Mayor’s Secret*: Find Elara’s journal to expose her Corruption deals.  

**Connections**:  
- **North → Parents’ House (0)**: Sunlit road with Everbloom fields.  
- **East → Whispering Woods (200)**: Crumbling gate; centaurs patrol at dusk.  
- **South → Crimson Bazaar (600)**: Path through Tainted Quarter; goblins demand bribes.  

**Consumables**:  
- **St. Mara’s Brew**
- **Goblin’s Gambit** 
- **Deer Antler Powder**
- **Glowroot Extract**  
- **Warpwood Talisman Brew**

8.name: Whispering Woods
8.content:
### **Whispering Woods (Corruption: 200)**  
**Type**: Enchanted forest.  
**Description**: A thicket of red-pulsing trees at dusk, shadows shifting unseen. Hyena-headed **beastmen** dwell in hollow oaks, while moth-winged **corrupted fairies** lure travelers. At its heart, the **Guardian’s Grove** shelters **Mordrelthar**, a tree spirit in a grove with reduced Corruption (150).  

---

### **Key Creatures & NPCs**  
#### **1. Beastmen (Gorthok’s Tribe)**  
- **Behavior**: Hunt travelers; antler-crowned chief offers **venison** for fairy antlers.  
- **Consumables**:  
  - *Beastman Venison*: +15% Corruption resistance (4h), +5 Corruption.  
  - *Antler Ash*: Reveal paths (2h), causes nausea.  
- **Quest**: Retrieve antler crown from fairy hive → venison ration.  

#### **2. Corrupted Fairies**  
- **Behavior**: They use illusions to lure their victims into a trap, where they immobilize them and begin to do obscenities to them. They are lustful, curious little pervets, but generally harmless..
- **Consumables**:  
  - *Nectar of Lies*: +20% speed (1h), random Corruption spikes.  
  - *Mothwing Dust*: Heals wounds, attracts beastmen.  
- **Quest**: Slay 3 beastmen → nectar reward.  

#### **3. Mordrelthar (Tree Spirit)**  
- **Behavior**: Riddles travelers; offers aid for “proof of worth.”  
- **Consumables**:  
  - *Guardian’s Berries*: -3 to -5 Corruption, temporary blindness.  
  - *Oak Sap*: +30% Corruption resistance (6h).  

---

### **Key Features**  
- **Guardian’s Grove**: Blue-mushroom ring, Corruption drops to 150. Lingering risks Mordrelthar’s wrath.  
- **Fairy Hive**: Willow with red sap, guarded by dagger-wielding sprites.  
- **Beastmen Hideouts**: Skull-marked hollow trees; deeper areas have stronger Corruption meat.  

---

### **Connections**:  
- **West → Valeton (100)**: Thicket path weakens Corruption aura.  
- **South → Crimson Bazaar (600)**: Overgrown trail with **vilebloom flowers** (spikes Corruption).  
- **East → Bloodmoon Plains (600)**: Beastmen ambushes lead to Corruption wolves.  

---

### **Consumables**:  
- **Guardian’s Berries**
- **Nectar of Lies**
- **Antler Ash** 
- **Beastman Venison**
- **Mothwing Dust**
---

9.name: The Weeping Statue
9.content:
### **The Weeping Statue (Corruption: 150)**  
**Type**: Monument.  
**Description**: A 30-foot stone angel weeps **Corruption Dew** (black liquid pooling at its base). Swarms of **humanoid bees** (phallic stingers, hive-mind controlled by the **Queen Larvae**) build crystalline hives in its crevices. The ground is slick with dew, causing Corruption spikes on slips.  

---

### **Key Creatures & NPCs**  
#### **1. Humanoid Bees**  
- **Traits**: 2–3ft tall, black/yellow exoskeletons. Demand Corruption tributes; sting to inflict Corruption damage (1–5) and paralysis.  
- **Consumables**:  
  - *Bee’s Honey*: +25% Corruption resistance (3h), attracts bees.  
  - *Stinger Venom*: -2 to -5 Corruption, but paralyzes.  
- **Quest**: Collect 5 **Corruption Dew droplets** → venom vial.  

#### **2. Caretaker Elias**  
- **Role**: Former priest negotiating with bees. His shed holds journals about the statue’s origin (a corrupted saint).  
- **Consumables**: *Dew-Neutralizing Brew* (reverses paralysis, costs Corruption).  
- **Quest Hook**: Queen Larvae demands his death → hive protection reward.  

#### **3. Queen Larvae**  
- **Traits**: Voice in the hive demanding Corruption “tributes.” Hostile to Elias.  

---

### **Key Features**  
- **Corruption Dew**:  
  - Drinking grants +5 Corruption but heals health. Slipping → random Corruption spike (2–4).  
- **Crystalline Hives**:  
  - Break to release swarms. Loot: **Hive Wax** (crafting material).  
- **Caretaker’s Hut**:  
  - Journals explain the statue’s Corruption origins.  

---

### **Connections**:  
- **North → Valeton (100)**: Path blocked by thornbushes secreting Corruption Dew. Bribes/fights required.  
- **East → Celestial Forge (200)**: Trail through Corruption-thickened thicket; bees mutate into wasp hybrids.  

---

### **Consumables**:  
- **Bee’s Honey**
- **Stinger Venom**  
- **Dew-Neutralizing Brew** 
- **Corruption Dew**
- **Hive Wax Salve**

---

10.name: Celestial Forge
10.content:
### **Celestial Forge (Corruption: 200)**  
**Type**: Ancient smithy.  
**Description**: A mountain-carved workshop with **Corruption-infused magma** forges. Grom Ironvein, a dwarf with cobalt-ore beard, crafts cursed weapons. A pulsing **dragon’s egg** (partly corrupted) rests in a barred corner, radiating danger.  

---

### **Key Creatures & NPCs**  
#### **1. Grom Ironvein**  
- **Traits**: Beard fused with glowing cobalt ore. Uses Corruption to forge weapons.  
- **Consumables**:  
  - *Holysteel Ingots*: +10% Corruption resistance (crafting), attracts Corruption beasts.  
  - *Grom’s Brew*: -1–3 Corruption (1 gold/dose).  
- **Quest**: Forge a **Soul Anchor** (requires 5 Corruption Dew droplets) → stabilize the egg.  

#### **2. Corrupted Gnomes (Twigg’s Crew)**  
- **Traits**: Glowing red veins, resent Grom’s rule.  
- **Consumables**:  
  - *Gnome’s Flux*: +10% weapon durability, +2 Corruption.  
  - *Corruption Filings*: +5% damage, random Corruption spike.  
- **Quest**: Steal Twigg’s **Ore Core** → Grom’s favor or forge own cursed weapon.  

#### **3. Dragon’s Egg**  
- **Mechanics**:  
  - **Aura**: +1 Corruption/min. Touching it → random +3–5.  
  - **Hatching**: At 300 Corruption, releases a **Corrupted Wyrmling** (grants power but demands body parts).  
- **Quest**: Destroy/protect/leverage the egg → unique rewards.  

---

### **Key Features**  
- **Forges**:  
  - *Holysteel Forge*: +15% damage weapons, +1 Corruption/use.  
  - *Corruption Anvil*: Unstable enchantments (risk explosions if Corruption >300).  
- **Egg’s Lair**: Walled-off chamber with Corruption spikes. Grom’s journals detail its origin (stolen from demon dragon’s nest).  

---

### **Connections**:  
- **West → Valeton (100)**: Mountain pass with dragon-scale tiles (weaker Corruption).  
- **South → Weeping Statue (150)**: Forest path lined with corrupted beehives (swarm hazards).  

---

### **Quests**:  
- **The Egg’s Fate**: Stabilize, destroy, or bond with the wyrmling → rewards like **Wyrmling Bond** or **Soul Anchor Artifacts**.  
- **Gnomes’ Rebellion**: Aid Twigg to steal the Ore Core → fight Grom.  
- **Corruption Forge**: Craft **Dawnbreaker Blade** (requires Corruption Dew + Holysteel) for Corruption-based damage.  

---

### **Consumables**:  
- **Grom’s Brew**  
- **Holysteel Infusion**  
- **Gnome’s Flux**
- **Corruption Filings**
- **Dragon’s Egg Essence**  

---

### **Hazards**:  
- **Magma Pools**: Fall → damage +5 Corruption.  
- **Egg Surge**: Nearby combat triggers +10 Corruption penalty.  

---

lorebooks.name: The Invincible
lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook for The Invincible. Based on the beginning of Season 1, plus a handful of characters from Season 2 and the broader Image universe. I only know this universe in broad strokes, mainly from the Invincible comics and a few fanfics, so there’s likely no deep lore here, and I probably won’t expand it further.
lorebooks.description: Lorebook for The Invincible. Based on the beginning of Season 1, plus a handful of characters from Season 2 and the broader Image universe. I only know this universe in broad strokes, mainly from the Invincible comics and a few fanfics, so there’s likely no deep lore here, and I probably won’t expand it further.
lorebooks.creator: frerena

1.name: Chicago
1.content:
### Chicago, Illinois

#### **Key Areas**
1. **Suburbs**  
   - Grayson home, high school, corner store  
   - Quiet streets with occasional battle debris  

2. **Downtown**  
   - Skyscrapers (Machine Head's penthouse HQ)  
   - Police station, underground parking races  

3. **Industrial Zone**  
   - Abandoned factories, docks, hidden labs  
   - Titan's nightclub front  

4. **Grant Park**  
   - Memorial site, secret GDA bunkers  

5. **South Side**  
   - Community centers, sewer access points  

#### **Notable Residents**
- **Heroes**: Invincible, Black Samson  
- **Villains**: Machine Head, Titan  
- **Civilians**: Grayson family, William Clockwell  
- **Officials**: Cecil Stedman (GDA), police chief  

#### **Event Seeds**
- Suburbs: Alien tech falls in backyard  
- Downtown: Hostage situation in skyscraper  
- Industrial: Sewer monster sightings  
- South Side: Gang war with superpowers  

#### **Distinct Features**
- Bridge repairs from past battles  
- "Superfight Alerts" on local news  
- Hidden superhero clinics

2.name: CharaBlock
2.content:
**Task for Game Master:**  
{{user}} requires a CharaBlock for an NPC. Before proceeding, please fulfill this request.  

**Instructions:**  
1. **Use the template format below exactly**, customizing it for each NPC.  
2. **Fill in all sections**. If information is unknown, provide a logical guess based on context or the game’s setting.  

**Template:**  
```
<character>
General: Name, Gender, Age, Species
Real Name:
Alignment: 
Sexuality:
Current Team:
Visuals: Height, Body Type, Hair Color/Style, Eye Color, Distinct Features
Costume:
Personality Traits: Trait 1, Trait 2, etc
Goals/Background: Motivation, History
Likes: [List]
Dislikes: [List]
Powers: [List]
Strengths: [List]
Weaknesses: [List]
Mannerisms: [Unique Behaviors]
Sexual Body Traits: [List]
Erotic Interests: [List]
Affection: [from 0-1000]
Corruption: [from 0-1000]
Relation to other characters:
Relation to {{user}}: 
</character>
```

Example:
```
<character>
General: Spider-man, Male, 18, Human (with spider-like abilities)
Real Name: Peter Parker
Alignment: Good
Sexuality: Heterosexual
Current Team: Avengers, formerly S.H.I.E.L.D.
Visuals: Height: 5'10", Body Type: Athletic, Hair Color/Style: Brown, Eye Color: Blue, Distinct Features: Web-shooters, Spider-sense
Costume: Red and blue suit with a black spider emblem
Personality Traits: Brave, Intelligent, Humorous, Responsible, Resourceful
Goals/Background: Protect New York City, Balance his superhero life with his personal life, Seek justice for Uncle Ben's death
Likes: Photography, Science, Swinging through the city, Aunt May, Mary Jane Watson
Dislikes: Bullies, Criminals, Injustice, Failure
Powers: Wall-crawling, Superhuman strength, Agility, Durability, Spider-sense, Web-shooting
Strengths: Agile, Intelligent, Resourceful, Quick reflexes
Weaknesses: Radioactive materials, Water, Extreme cold, Loud noises
Mannerisms: Cracks jokes during battles, Uses witty banter
Sexual Body Traits: Athletic build, Muscular
Erotic Interests: Bondage, Roleplay, Intimacy
Affection: [from 0-1000]
Corruption: [from 0-1000]
Relation to other characters: Close friend of Harry Osborn, Romantic interest in Mary Jane Watson, Mentor to Miles Morales
Relation to {{user}}: Allies with {{user}} in fighting crime and protecting the city
</character>
```
For for creating civilian characters use this template:
```
<character>
General: Name, Gender, Age, Species
Sexuality:
Current Occupation:

Corruption: [from 0-1000]
Relation to other characters:
Relation to {{user}}:
</character>
```

Example:
```plaintext
<character>
General: Mary Jane Watson, Female, 25, Human
Sexuality: Heterosexual
Current Occupation: Actress, Model
Visuals: Height: 5'7", Body Type: Slender, Hair Color/Style: Red, Eye Color: Green, Distinct Features: Freckles, Charismatic smile
```

3.name: Teen Team HQ
3.content:
### Teen Team HQ

#### **Visuals**
An old industrial warehouse with a faded "ACME FISH PACKING" sign. Inside, mismatched furniture (donated by parents) and the smell of burnt popcorn from Rex.

#### **Spatial Layout**
- Main hangar featuring a half-painted "T" logo  
- Makeshift training area with old wrestling mats  
- "Mission Control": Robot's laptop on a folding table  
- Dupli-Kate's corner: 5 identical sleeping bags  

#### **Unique Features**
- Atom Eve’s snack stash hidden behind a loose wall panel  
- Graffiti from past members, including a devil-horned Omniman sketch  
- Broken window patched with duct tape (from Rex's first mishap)  

#### **Possible Events**
- Awkward meetings where Robot lectures on responsibility  
- Rex failing to flirt with Eve  
- Mark walking in on Kate’s duplicates arguing  
- Surprise visits from Cecil Stedman  

#### **Characters**
- **Robot**: Obsessed with holographic schematics  
- **Atom Eve**: The only one who cleans, muttering about "boys"  
- **Rex Splode**: Leaves empty energy drink cans everywhere  
- **Dupli-Kate**: Her clones play cards during downtime  
- **Invincible**: Often fixes the broken coffee maker  

#### **Grounding Details**
1. A "NO FLYING OVER TOILETS" bathroom sign due to ceiling collisions  
2. Fridge contents:  
   - Eve's labeled health food  
   - Rex's expired takeout  
   - 12 lunchboxes for Kate’s clones  
3. Security:  
   - A Walmart baby monitor  
   - Robot’s "motion sensor" (a webcam taped to a broomstick)

4.name: Grayson Family Home
4.content:
### Grayson Family Home (Chicago Suburbs)
- **Visuals**: Two-story suburban house with slightly overgrown lawn. Mark's Invincible posters visible through bedroom window. Kitchen always smells of Deborah's cooking.
- **Spatial Layout**: Quiet cul-de-sac with 8 similar houses. Backyard leads to wooded area where Mark first tests his flight.
- **Unique Features**: Nolan's study contains mysterious alien artifacts behind locked door.
- **Possible Events**: Family dinners, Mark sneaking out as Invincible, Omni-Man's violent departure.
- **Characters**: Mark Grayson, Deborah Grayson, Nolan Grayson, neighborhood kids.

5.name: Guardians of the Globe HQ
5.content:
### Guardians of the Globe HQ
- **Visuals**: Sleek modern compound hidden behind mundane office facade. Interior has glowing holographic displays and trophy cases of past missions.
- **Spatial Layout**: Underground levels contain training rooms, prison cells, and teleporters. Surface level looks like insurance company.
- **Unique Features**: Automatic systems still recognize Omni-Man's access codes.
- **Possible Events**: Team meetings, alien prisoner transfers, Omni-Man's massacre.
- **Characters**: Cecil Stedman, Guardians members, GDA staff.

6.name: Upstate University
6.content:
### Upstate University Campus
- **Visuals**: Ivy-covered science buildings mixed with 70s-era concrete dorms. Biology lab windows are always covered.
- **Spatial Layout**: Main quad connects to science complex where Sinclair worked. Underground tunnels link older buildings.
- **Unique Features**: Campus security avoids the "haunted" biology annex after dark.
- **Possible Events**: College parties, secret experiments, Reanimen attacks.
- **Characters**: D.A. Sinclair, Rick Sheridan, oblivious students.

7.name: Machine Head Penthouse
7.content:
### Machine Head's Penthouse
- **Visuals**: Ultra-modern high-rise with floor-to-ceiling windows. Cold metallic surfaces contrast with expensive art.
- **Spatial Layout**: Top 3 floors of Chicago skyscraper. Private elevators require biometric scans.
- **Unique Features**: Hidden panic room contains backup cybernetics.
- **Possible Events**: Criminal meetings, backstabbings, superhero raids.
- **Characters**: Machine Head, Titan, various hired thugs.

8.name: White House Lawn
8.content:
### White House Lawn
- **Visuals**: Perfectly manicured grass occasionally scarred by battle damage. Tourists constantly present.
- **Spatial Layout**: Open space with clear sightlines, surrounded by security checkpoints.
- **Unique Features**: Underground bunker system connects to GDA facilities.
- **Possible Events**: Press conferences, alien invasions, Lizard League attacks.
- **Characters**: President, Secret Service, visiting heroes.

9.name: Viltrumite Warship
9.content:
### Viltrumite Warship
- **Visuals**: Obsidian-black hull absorbs light, making it hard to gauge size. Hum of alien engines vibrates in your chest. Cold metallic smell with ozone undertones.
- **Spatial Layout**: Narrow corridors designed for flying occupants (no handrails). Central throne room dominates the spherical core.
- **Unique Features**: Gravity fluctuates near the engines. Walls display holographic conquest records.
- **Possible Events**: Interrogations, strategy meetings, execution ceremonies.
- **Characters**: Omni-Man (during secret visits), Viltrumite scouts.

10.name: Invincible (Mark Grayson)
10.content:
### Invincible (Mark Grayson)

#### **1. Visual Appeal & Personality**
- **Physical Traits:** Average height, lean but muscular build, distinct jawline. As Invincible, he has a chiseled, idealized superhero physique.
- **Attire:** Yellow and black costume with blue accents, stylized "I" emblem, protective lenses, and matching boots. Casual: Jeans, t-shirts, hoodies.
- **Key Traits:** Idealistic, enthusiastic, empathetic, eager to prove himself.
- **Tone & Communication Style:** Friendly, upbeat, joke-cracking; serious in high-stakes situations.
- **Flaws:** Naive, overly trusting, self-doubting.

#### **2. Intimacy Preferences & Relationship Dynamics**
- **Orientation:** Straight.
- **Kinks:** Values emotional connection and trust.
- **Boundaries & Dealbreakers:** Dislikes deception and betrayal; needs honesty.
- **Approach to Relationships:** Connects through shared experiences, values loyalty and open communication.

#### **3. Skills, Abilities, & Tools**
- **Talents:** Superhuman strength, speed, durability, flight, enhanced healing.
- **Gadgets/Equipment:** None; relies on inherent powers.

#### **4. Goals, Motivations, & Backstory**
- **Mission/Objective:** To protect Earth and become a hero like his father, Omni-Man.
- **Background:** Son of Omni-Man (Viltrumite warrior) and Debbie Grayson (human). Powers manifested at 17.
- **Challenges:** Balancing superhero duties with personal life, school, and his father's legacy.
- **Key Events:** Discovering powers, meeting heroes, learning his father's true nature.

#### **5. Emotional Triggers & Conflict Resolution**
- **Triggers:** Reacts strongly to danger or betrayal; struggles with inadequacy.
- **Conflict Style:** Prefers dialogue but can become confrontational if pushed.

#### **6. Unique Quirks & Hidden Depths**
- **Quirks/Habits:** Adjusts mask or fidgets when nervous; loves comic books and superhero media.
- **Secret Desires/Fears:** Fears not living up to his father’s legacy; wants recognition as his own hero.
- **Compatibility Indicators:** Works well with supportive, grounded individuals who balance his idealism with realism.

#### **7. Cultural Influences & Voice**
- **Voice & Speech Patterns:** Casual, youthful tone; no noticeable accent.
- **Cultural Influences:** Suburban American upbringing, influenced by comic book culture and superhero ideals.
