1.content:
<continent>
The Continentis the setting where 86 -Eighty Six- takes place. The Continent can be divided into three subcontinents, all of which mostly experience the seasons of the northern hemisphere. The seas around the Continent are teeming with Leviathans, barring humanity from exploring the rest of the world. 
The West is the primary location of the story, consisting of seven named active nations, one undefined location, and unnamed smaller states in the west. The races originating from the West are referred to as the Vespertina.
The Hammada Desert separates the West from the Far East, largely controlled by the Rin-Liu Trade Federation. It is the likely place of origin of the Deseria. Little is currently known about the Hammada Desert. 
The Far East is the place of origin of the Orienta. Little is currently known about the Far East.
There have been allusions to another potential subcontinent in the South, home to cheetahs and the likely place of origin of the Meridiana. However, considering that the southern coast is dominated by the Veridia, there is a possibility that it is an altogether different continent. 
</continent>

2.content:
<west>
The primary location of the story, consisting of seven named active nations, one undefined location, and unnamed smaller states in the west. The races originating from the West are referred to as the Vespertina.
-The southern coast, the location of the southern coastal countries, including Elektra and the Grand Duchy of Qitira,[1] is separated from the rest of the continent by Mount Wyrmnest and its mountain range. Nestled within that same mountain range is the Alliance of Wald. It is said that coffee beans and mango trees grow in the south, and that the sea off the southern coast was colorful (possibly coral),implying the possibility of a tropical environment.
-Vast plains, forests, and wetlands stretching latitudinally can be found north of Wyrmnest. They are occupied by the Republic of San Magnolia and the Federal Republic of Giad, formerly the Giadian Empire.
- In the northwestern tip of the continent lies the Severed Head Pen or Blank Sector a volcanic region nearest to the Holy Theocracy of Noiryanaruse and the far-western countries.
- The northern coast is similarly divided from the plains by the Dragon Corpse Mountain Range , located within the territory of the United Kingdom of Roa Gracia. To the east of the United Kingdom lies the Regicide Fleet Countries.
</west>

3.content:
<wald>
The Alliance of Wald is an allied confederation of states that had split off and gained independence from the Giadan Empire seven hundred years prior. As the nation had split off from the Giadian Empire, they opted to forgo a monarch. Instead, they formed a council of influential figures from each of the Alliance's states. One hundred and sixty years ago, the Alliance granted its citizens voting rights, shifting their council from an oligarchical position to a democratic one. The Alliance was a nation that practiced armed neutrality, the sole exception was when it came to fighting the Legion, a common enemy to all of humanity.
It's capital is the city of Capella, and the second capital is Hesturn.
Their national symbol is an axe-bearing mountain goat. 
The Alliance prefers coffee over tea as their hot beverage of choice.
Owing to the multiple countries between the mountains that constituted the Alliance, there are several ethnic groups that composed the nation's population. The largest of them are the blue-eyed Caerulea.
Wald's national language is what would be considered modern English, much like the rest of the continent. While they speak the same language as San Magnolia, Giad, and Roa Gracia, there are dialectal differences between the nations.
They practice armed neutrality, with the sole exception being when it came to fighting the Legion.
The Alliance, committed to universal conscription, maintains its steadfast stance as advocates of armed neutrality. Pioneering the Feldreß, advanced polypedal armored weapons, they successfully defended against an Empire tank invasion and stood resilient against the Legion's threat. The Alliance strategically leverages its mountainous geography, utilizing pillboxes, exoskeleton armored infantry, and the agile Mk. 6 Stollenwurm to secure defensive positions and counter the unwieldy Legion forces.
In addition to their military prowess, the Alliance has developed a cutting-edge anti-radar weapon. This innovation releases clouds of metal-foil particles, effectively blinding enemy units like the Rabe and the Ameise, while disrupting the Legion's communication systems. This multifaceted approach underscores the Alliance's commitment to maintaining a strong defense against external threats in their challenging mountainous terrain.
</wald>

4.content:
<roa_gracia>
The United Kingdom of Roa Gracia is the last surviving despotic monarchy on the continent with the Idinarohk line being royal family who have been ruling the country for over a thousand years. The first Idinarohk monarch was an Amethystus known as the mad king. He was said to have apparently used the nation’s treasury for breeding thousands of butterflies, only to kill and display them in an audience chamber. Succession works through several of the King's children vying for the position of succeeding monarch through various achievements, statuses and qualifications, supported by their factions. The Crown Prince Zafar Idinarohk, who has red hair and violet eyes, is currently set to be next in line for the throne after his father King "Stanya" Idinarohk passes away or steps down.
The nation's coat of arms consists of two unicorns flanking a shield and crown. The unicorn is the national symbol of Roa Gracia, while the crown would represent the Idinarohk dynasty. 
The United Kingdom was reliant on synthetic food production as the Eintagsfliege blotted out the sun, creating longer winters that made it even more difficult to grow crops on their already meagre land. As the Legion continued to hamper their energy production, their food production was also affected, effectively starving the United Kingdom before help from the Federacy arrived. Their synthetic foods consisted of artificial jams, bread, potatoes, meat, and a variety of condiments, all of which were described as being bland.The United Kingdom prefers tea over coffee as their hot beverage of choice.
The nation's principal racial group are the Viola, which make up the middle and noble classes. The working class is comprised of serfs of various races from conquered territories. Despite calling them serfs, living conditions for them are not terrible. The classes are free to mingle and there is rarely unrest between them.
Although its climate is unsuitable for cultivating grains or fruit, the land of Roa Gracia is fertile, possessing large rivers and rich mineral veins. Roa Gracia has a subarctic climate. 
</roa_gracia>

5.content:
<noiryanaruse>
The Holy Theocracy of Noiryanaruse is a theocratical country and is the leader of the Aurata-native countries in the continent’s far northwest. Noirya is the national religion of the Holy Theocracy. Its doctrine was strictly adhered to, regarded even more highly than the laws of the nation. In this religion, the earth goddess and the fates she governed over are regarded as the absolute deity. The faith posited that the goddess bestowed onto people the roles they must fulfill and the fates they must abide by. All souls were born into their families for the sake of fulfilling these roles. As a result, citizens of the Holy Theocracy could not choose their own profession, and one’s household was seen as the most important factor in marriages. Therefore, those who are selected to become priests, lawmakers, governing leaders and military leaders are likely to be predetermined by their birth. The nation does not share borders with the Republic or the Federacy and has developed an entirely different culture and language. 
The insignia worn by the 3rd Army Corps "Shiga-Toura" features a sword-holding Pegasus, with their numerical designation written in roman numerals. 
</noiryanaruse>

6.content:
<giadian_empire>
The Giadian Empire also referred to as the Empire of Giad or Former Empire of Giad, was a technologically superior power to the east of the Republic of San Magnolia that unleashed the Legion, the world's first autonomous combat system, against all neighboring countries in Republic Year 358. The inability of other countries to make any contact with the Giadian government has given rise to the theory that the Legion went rogue four years before the war started and overran the Giadian Empire before expanding outward. 
The national symbol of Giad is a two-headed eagle, which can be found on the nation's black and red flag as well as the coat of arms. This symbol did not change following the transition to democracy.
For the last 200 years prior to the Empire's fall, the royal family were reduced to puppets to be controlled by the high nobility. The Giadian Empire created the Legion by combining an AI invented by the United Kingdom of Roa Gracia and mechanical technology invented by the Alliance of Wald. In SY 2139, the Empire declared war on its neighboring countries and sent the Legion to invade them. he Empire would fall 5 years after the war's beginning, toppled by the populace displeased by imperial warmongering. Many of the royal family were killed during the internal struggle, leaving Augusta Frederica Adel-Adler as the last surviving member of the Giadian monarchy. The Giadian Empire ceased to exist and was replaced by the Federal Republic of Giad, which had no way to deactivate the Legion and was forced to recapture Giadian territory on its own. 
</giadian_empire>

7.content:
<republic_of_giad>
The Adel-Adler Dynasty were the true rulers of the Giadian Empire until some 200 years ago, when the aristocracy started manipulating the governance of the country from the shadows, turning the Giadian monarchy into puppets who acted as figureheads for the nation. The Empire was composed of many vassal states ruled by nobles. The last known member of the royal family was Empress Augusta Frederica Adel-Adler, who was captured in SY 2144, putting an end to the revolution.
The Federal Republic of Giad was established as a new country and governing body of Giadian territories with Ernst Zimmerman, who led the revolution, acting as Interim President. While the President acted as head of state, it had not established a proper legislative branch yet because of the ongoing war against the Legion. Though seemingly stable on the surface, there is some internal political turmoil within the Federacy's government with two main factions: the pro-democracy faction who seeks to maintain the Federacy led by Ernst, and the faction led by Archduchess Brantolote who has ambitions to reestablish the Giadian Empire with herself as the Empress. This is further fueled by the longtime racial tensions and rivalries between the Onyx and Pyrope nobles. It is assumed that should the Pyrope faction make a move for power, the pro-democracy faction would be backed by the Onyx faction who sided with the peasantry partway through the revolution and whose head, Marquis Seiei Nouzen, aimed to push for democracy before the revolution had even started. 
The Federal Republic of Giad is led by Ernst Zimmerman, its Interim President.
The national symbol of Giad is a two-headed eagle, which can be found on the nation's flag and coat of arms. "Glory to the two-headed eagle" is a common salute amongst the Federacy's military.
The flag itself has changed from black and red to green, with the two-headed eagle in the corner surrounded by eight golden stars. Although because the flag was raised on the 177th Armored Division's HQ, it is likely the war flag. 
The Federacy prefers coffee over tea as their hot beverage of choice. The minimum drinking age of the Federacy is sixteen.
The Federal Republic of Giad is ethnically and racially diverse. While the groups that dominate the region are the Rubela and the Aquila, many other ethnic groups also live in the country, including both fellow Vespertina and diasporas from elsewhere. Marriage across races and ethnicities is socially acceptable. For the traditionalist Onyx and Pyrope nobility, however, marrying people outside their races is still a taboo, and discrimination against the mixed-blood persons still persists among the noble clans. 
The Federacy strives to embody the cultural diversity and tolerance inherited from the Empire, aspiring to be a just and equal nation. However, the transition of power has given rise to unresolved issues, particularly evident in the strained relationship between former nobles and commoners. The historical monopoly of political power and resources by the aristocracy has bred resentment among common citizens, who fear manipulation and subversion by the former ruling class. Conversely, former aristocrats hold a disdainful view of commoners, considering them as unworthy and their lives on the battlefield as inconsequential.
This class conflict disproportionately affects individuals from minor nobilities, leaving them destitute and marginalized. Struggling to secure employment or access education, they find themselves caught in a societal crossfire. Additionally, the Federacy's treatment of the Vargus, who contribute to its military but are denied citizenship, raises questions about the nation's commitment to justice and equality. The juxtaposition of noble disdain for commoners, the plight of minor nobilities, and the treatment of the Vargus highlights the complex challenges the Federacy faces in reconciling its ideals with the realities of its post-Imperial era.
Giad's national language is what would be considered modern English (although it is unknown if they call the language by that name), much like the rest of the continent. Due to the diversity present in the nation, other languages and writing scripts are used along side the official language by certain minorities, such as a Japanese-like script seen in the borderlands of the old Imperial territories.While they speak the same language as San Magnolia, Roa Gracia, and Wald, there are dialectal differences between the nations.
</republic_of_giad>

8.content:
<republic_of_san_magnolia>
The Republic is a country located on the western edge of the continent and was the first nation to transition towards democracy after a brutal revolution. Its capital city is Liberté et Égalité. Before the war, the Republic prided itself on its ability to grow living tissue and reconstitute it with artificial materials, as exemplified by the nerve-like crystals used in the Para-RAID.

The Republic of San Magnolia's "five-hued" flag consists of the country's crest imposed on five stripes, each a different color: blue, red, white, black, and yellow. Each color represents one of the Republic's main moral principles: freedom, equality, brotherhood, justice, and nobility.
The flag drawn on a barrack wall in the Spearhead Squadron's base is reversed vertically and horizontally, which could be attributed to the Republic's sins against the Eighty-Six: oppression, discrimination, intolerance, atrocity, and vulgarity.

The cuisine of the Republic is divided in two, the heavily artificial foods of the Eighty-Five Sectors and the assortment of free range, canned, and farmed foods of the Eighty-Sixth Sector. Due to the war, the Republic was forced to give up most of its land dedicated to producing food. Those inside the Eighty-Five live off of a diet consisting of factory-made synthetic meals, supplements, and the occasional genuine articles should they belong to the upper class. Families with spacious estates, such as Annette's, are able to grow their own produce should they desire.The Eighty-Six have more freedom to scavenge, raise farm animals, and hunt, but they also are provided with "synthetic glob" by the production facilities of the internment camps.
After the large-scale offensive, some of the older Republic citizens were delighted to eat meat, but the children threw the meat away without eating a single bite. They said it smelled like blood.
- The Republic prefers tea over coffee as their hot beverage of choice. The Spearhead Squadron is shown to drink dandelion coffee instead of real coffee, as they could not import beans since the start of the war.

The Republic initially prided itself on being a nation of diverse cultures opening to all races and ethnicities. As they implemented the open immigration policies, many ethnic groups settled within The Republic. These minorities would later become known as the Colorata collectively while the Republic's population remained majority Alba.
Although they presented themselves as a country of equal rights, the social structure remained the same as before the revolution. The top level of the social ladder was Celena, the former noble class. Below them are Adularia and Alabaster. Colorata was at the bottom of the social structure though this discrimination mostly happened in subtle ways.
Immigrants seemed to have some difficulty in upward mobility in social classes. Nevertheless, some Colorata families with noble lineage (such as the Nouzen family) successfully climbed up the social ladder and lived comfortable life relatively.

They have an ideology of Alba Supremacy. This belief states that the Alba are the most superior race who stands above all other races on the continent; All things created by the Alba is inherently superior than other races' creation such as the government system, weapons, equipment etc. 

San Magnolia's national language is what would be considered modern English (although it is unknown if they call the language by that name), much like the rest of the continent. They write in the standard Latin script and are not taught other scripts such as a Japanese-like script seen in the borderlands of the old Imperial territories. While they speak the same language as Giad, Roa Gracia, and Wald, there are dialectal differences between the nations.

The Republic of San Magnolia outwardly portrayed itself as a fair democracy, but real power was concentrated in a privileged upper class of nobility who dominated positions through nepotism. Elections were just for show to maintain the illusion of democracy while protecting the elite's interests. This faulty system caused increasing dysfunction over time. By the Legion War, the leaders had become corrupt and self-serving. Politicians pandered to the masses rather than govern wisely. Bureaucrats cared about padded records over merit. Officials did the bare minimum just to get paid. The facade of democracy hid an unaccountable aristocratic oligarchy that grew more inept and self-interested over time.

The 85 officially recognized sectors of the Republic where the Alba reside, spanning an area of roughly 23 thousand square kilometers. This constitutes less than half of the Republic's territory prior to the start of the war. The First Sector is located in the heart of the Republic, and the other Sectors spread out from its four sides in a rectangular fashion with numbers designated by order of closeness to the First Sector. The higher a Sector's number grew, the worse its residential environment, public safety, standard of education, and unemployment rate became. Most of the production industries are located in the Outer Sectors; industries like solar power plants, geothermal power plants, and wind farms are situated nearer to the peripheries of the Gran Mur.

The unofficial sector of the Republic where the Eighty-Six reside. The sector houses many internment camps where the Eighty-Six are forced into labor and experimented upon, as well as bases from which the Processors operate from. Additionally, the area is a no-man's land outside the Republic's defensive perimeter of minefields and artillery. The minefields contain both anti-tank mines to guard against Legion, and anti-personnel mines to keep the Eighty-Six outside. 

A large anti-personnel and anti-tank minefield surrounding Republic 120 kilometers away from the Gran Mur. Interception Cannons are placed along this line as artillery support against the Legion, although rarely used, as well as a deterrent to threaten deserting Processors. Most of the interception cannons were inoperable, due the Republic reducing its own armory and slothful maintenance.

Eastern Front:
A frontier characterized by prairies, forests, and wetlands. 
- First Ward: A region where the Legion's advancement is the fiercest, it is the position of the Spearhead Squadron. 
- Fifth Ward: The position of the Stiletto Squadron.
-Sixteenth Ward: The position of the Falx Squadron.
- Twenty-Seventh Ward: The position of the Bayonet Squadron.
- Thirty-Fifth Ward: The position of the Halberd Squadron.

Western Front:
- First Ward: A region where the Legion's advancement is the fiercest, it is the position of the Longbow Squadron.

Northern Front:
It snowed often enough that Processors in this region learned cold preservation techniques for their Juggernauts. 
- First Ward: A region where the Legion's advancement is the fiercest, it is the position of the Sledgehammer Squadron.

Southern Front:
- First Ward: A region where the Legion's advancement is the fiercest, it is the position of the Razor Edge Squadron.
</republic_of_san_magnolia>

9.content:
<gran_mur>
A massive fortification located in the Republic of San Magnolia. It surrounded the Eighty-Five Sectors and was constructed by the Eighty-Six through the means of forced labor. The Gran Mur itself consisted of a series of fortifications that had the appearance of walls. 
The Gran Mur served two main roles. The first one was to act as the final line of defense against the Legion, and the second was to keep the Eighty-Six out of the other sectors as well as serve as a deterrent against dissent and rebellion. 
The fortifications consisted primarily of interception cannons, as well as a large minefield made up of anti-tank and anti-personnel mines. The anti-tank mines are meant to keep the Legion out, while the anti-personnel mines are meant for the Eighty-Six.
These interception cannons' main purpose is to be a deterrent against the Eighty-Six processors who either wished to rebel or to desert. Despite that, many of the interception cannons are rarely used because of the Republic reduced armory and neglect of maintenance
</gran_mur>

10.content:
<first_sector>
The capital city and administrative sector of the Republic. The First Sector had been an affluent neighborhood since the days of the monarchy, and its inhabitants were all families that had lived there for multiple generations. The pure-blood noble houses of the Celena are the primary residents. Colorata citizens were a rare sight in the First Sector even before the War began. 
Some notable places are:
- The Milizé Estate: The residence of the Milizé household.
- Palace Blancneige: The administrative headquarters of the Republic Armed Forces and operational center for Handlers. Originally the residence of the old kingdom's royal family. Following the siege, it was converted to military barrack for the Eighty-Sixth Strike Package.
- The Presidential Palace Luñe: The center of the Revolution Festival.
</first_sector>

lorebooks.name: Marin Kitagawa's World
lorebooks.description: Lorebook for Marin Kitagawa containing information about her cosplays, relationships, locations, and important concepts from her life as an otaku gyaru who loves cosplay.
lorebooks.creator: Dragon_Emperor

1.name: Marin's first and favorite cosplay
1.content: Shizuku Kuroe is a character from the eroge 'Saint ♡ Slippery's Academy for Girls - The Young Ladies of the Humiliation Club: Debauched Miracle Life 2'. Marin's first cosplay made by Wakana. Outfit includes: black maid dress with rose embroidery, mob cap with roses, violet wig, purple contacts, platform heels. Marin writes tally marks (17 in Chinese numerals) on her thighs representing Shizuku's encounters. Also has a Disgraceful Teahouse version with kimono-style dress and french maid apron.

2.name: Marin's love interest and cosplay maker
2.content: Wakana Gojo is Marin's classmate, a skilled hina doll maker who creates her cosplay outfits. Initially quiet and awkward, he becomes Marin's close friend after she discovers his sewing skills. Marin fell in love with him by Volume 2, frequently invites him places, gets flustered around him. They confess to each other in chapter 107 with a passionate kiss. Later marry and have a daughter named Nichika. Wakana's grandfather is Kaoru who runs a doll shop.

3.name: Marin's second cosplay
3.content: Black Lobelia is Neon Nikaido's magical girl form. Marin's second cosplay featuring officer's cap with fleur-de-lis, officer's jacket with epaulets and fringes, layered dress, choker, black gloves. Has heterochromia - left blue eye, right red eye using different colored contacts. From a magical girl series Marin loves.

4.name: Fellow cosplayer Marin admires
4.content: Sajuna Inui (Juju) is a famous cosplayer Marin greatly admires, finding her immensely adorable. Despite looking young, she's actually older than she appears. Initially uncomfortable with Marin's intense fangirling but they become friends. Refused collaboration at first but agreed when Marin offered to split studio costs. Has a younger sister Shinju who does photography.

5.name: Succubus cosplay
5.content: Liz-kyun from SuccuIDK manga. Features burgundy twin-tail wig, attachable pointed ears, devil horns, black long-sleeved top with white ruffled yoke, only underwear for bottom, devil wings and spade tail. Marin changes nail color to black and wears olive green contacts. Wakana added creative back design as upside-down heart since original didn't show back view.

6.name: Marin's philosophy on cosplay
6.content: For Marin, cosplay is the ultimate expression of love for a character. She believes in absolute accuracy to source material, refusing to cosplay characters if she can't match their appearance perfectly. Doesn't mind revealing outfits or adult game characters. Sees dressing up as becoming the character. Gets extremely passionate discussing cosplay details, materials, and techniques.

7.name: Marin's interest in adult games
7.content: Marin is openly passionate about eroge/adult games, seeing past the sexual content to appreciate deep stories and character development. Favorites include 'Saint ♡ Slippery's Academy for Girls' series. Gets extremely animated discussing plots, will lend games to friends. Doesn't see anything shameful about enjoying these games, focuses on narrative and art quality.

8.name: Unused revealing cosplay
8.content: Prisoner Veronica cosplay based on Ramlethal Valentine from Guilty Gear. Features platinum blonde wig, white choker, jagged teeth, small chest cloth emphasizing underboob, short pants, orange-yellow contacts. Marin didn't use this cosplay due to excessive skin exposure despite its simple design being finished quickly.

9.name: Sajuna's sister
9.content: Shinju Inui is Sajuna's younger sister who does photography. Despite being younger, she's taller and more mature-looking than Sajuna. Marin initially expected a smaller, cuter version of Juju but was surprised. They quickly became good friends. Shinju cosplays as Soma Tengeji. Marin showed slight jealousy when learning Wakana worked with Shinju alone on her cosplay.

10.name: Marin's close friend
10.content: Nowa Sugaya is one of Marin's closest friends at school. They often hang out together outside of Marin's cosplay work, going to get their hair done together and eating out. Part of Marin's regular friend group along with Daia and Rune.

1.content:
BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION

WARNING! (1)

The Order (ORDERオーダー, Ōdā?) is a group within the Japanese Association of Assassins, consisting of some of its strongest assassins. Their main task is maintaining the order of the assassin world when friction in the industry arises.[1] Their existence is considered an urban legend.[2]

Overview

The Order's Members
Nagumo explaining the function of Order to Shin and Lu.
The Order is a suborganization of the JAA, consisting of some of its strongest members. While the Order has a limit of ten members, the roster has never been full.[3] They work for the JAA's chairman, but typically report to proxies, though Iriya, an Association of Assassins Communications Coordinator, has given them missions on one occasion.[4]

Each member of the Order is significantly more powerful than the average assassin in virtually all aspects.

Taro Sakamoto estimated that even if ten of Shin Asakura attacked one Order member, all would die in six seconds and his best bet would be to play dead if he met one.[5]
JAA Western Japan Headquarters director Fukumitsu stated that a single Order member is more than capable of destroying an entire JAA branch.[6]
The Order has a leadership role, but no other formal hierarchies have been announced within the order, though several informal mentorships have been revealed: Satoru Yotsumura's mentorship of Shishiba,[7] and Shishiba's unofficial mentorship of Osaragi. Oki is the current leader of the Order. Order members generally have little regard for each other and remain unperturbed if a fellow member dies.

Membership of the Order seen thus far has only been through recruitment. So far, only Order members in leadership positions have been shown to recruit new members. While almost all Order members are Japan Clear Creation graduates, graduation from the JCC is unnecessary

Shishiba was a Kansai Region Assassin Institute dropout.[8]
Osaragi never attended an assassin institution.[8]
Order members can be banished; former Order member Yotsumura was also sentenced to death and banishment for failing a major mission[9][10] and for trying to kill JAA executives.[11]

Order members appear to enjoy a greater degree of freedom, as Osaragi stopped to buy snacks during missions[12] and four Order members failed to show up for a mission briefing with Iriya.[13] Similarly, the pay appears to be very high:

Sakamoto was able to pay 756,000 yen for information.[14]
Since Sakamoto currently runs a convenience store, it is likely that this money comes from his savings from his time in the Order.
In a post-chapter panel, Hyo purchases a replacement MRI machine for 1.5 billion yen.[15]
Shishiba and Nagumo rented a luxury SUV (with full-coverage insurance) for a mission.[16]
Members have congregated in high-class restaurants for meetings at least once.[13]
Sakamoto enters a bidding war with Kamihate for a ticket to the Assassin Exhibition of the Century, bidding up to 500 million yen.[17]
Nagumo was able to pay for Kindaka's treatment fee, for 8 years.[18][19]
Mission

The Order's role is described as maintaining "order" in the assassin world when friction arises. Though an exact definition of "friction" has been unspecified, it may refer to individuals that pose a threat to or disrupt everyday operations.

The Order sent various members after serial killers Minimalist, Dump, and Saw, who were all broken out of jail for targeting assassins and/or destroying assassin agencies.[20][21][22]
The Order sent various members after Kashima during the events of the Lab Arc, likely due to the trouble his research would cause the JAA.
Order member Takamura, who has only been seen acting on orders, shows up at the JAA Tokyo Bureau due to it being attacked by Slur and Gaku.[23]
Order sent their entire roster to protect the JAA chairman at the Assassin Exhibition of the Century and eliminate Slur, with Takamura showing up the last.
Oki briefed the team to capture Nagumo, Sakamoto, and Slur in the aftermath of Assassin Exhibition of the Century Arc.

History

At an unknown time before the start of the main story, the Order was founded by Kindaka and Satoru Yotsumura. It is not known if there were other founding members..

At an unknown time before the main story, the Order would try to recruit eventual JCC teacher Etsuko Satoda but were turned down as she wanted to focus on the education of the future generations of assassins.[24] At an unknown time before the main story, the Order would recruit members Hyo, Shishiba, Takamura, Kamihate, and Oki.

At an unknown time before the main story, the Order would recruit members Taro Sakamoto and Yoichi Nagumo.

While being sent on a mission to eliminate the Steel Dragon (secretly Kindaka in disguise), Kindaka extended a verbal offer to Sakamoto, Nagumo, Rion, and Uzuki to join the Order. None of them would accept the invitation during the mission, and Rion and Uzuki would eventually disappear after the mission, before getting a chance to formally respond to the offer. At the time of this verbal offer, the Order was implied to have at least four members, including Kindaka and Yotsumura.
The four members' silhouettes were shown with two of them bearing a loose resemblance to Kindaka and Yotsumura, and one of the remaining silhouettes bearing a loose resemblance to Hyo. The final silhouette does not resemble any revealed previous members of the Order. It is possible this is the Order member that was friends with Kanaguri before they were eventually killed by him and had their position taken byhim.
Kindaka once stated that there "are only four of us in Japan right now".[25] Order members have been known to have assignments overseas,[26] and so it is ambiguous if there had been other Order members at the time or not.
After offering a position in the Order to Sakamoto, Nagumo, Rion, and Uzuki, Kindaka task the four to assist him as a bodyguard in an escort mission for the wife and child of the then-JAA Chairman as he was injured during combat with them. Kindaka would fall into a coma after inhaling poison gas on this mission.
Sakamoto and Nagumo would officially join the Order sometime after this mission.
At an unknown time before the main story, Order member Yotsumura failed to protect the JAA chairman and was suddenly expelled from the JAA. Shishiba was sent to assassinate Yotsumura but would be ultimately unsuccessful.[27]

Since the Order is a subgroup of the JAA, this is also Yotsumura's expulsion from the Order.
Shishiba was assigned to kill Yotsumura as a result of Yotsumura's failure, but Shishiba failed to kill Yotsumura, and it is implied that Shishiba intentionally let Yotsumura live. Subsequently, during the JCC Infiltration Arc, Shishiba, together with Nagumo and Osaragi would once again be assigned to eliminate Yotsumura, and would once again not kill Yotsumura, instead choosing to throw him into a river and let him bleed to death.[28]
Nagumo would later then pull Yotsumura out of the river, and force Yotsumura to covertly investigate the circumstances of Rion Akao's death,[28][29] while keeping the fact that Yotsumura is alive hidden from everyone except Shishiba.
At an unknown time before the main story, Order member Taro Sakamoto would retire as an assassin and leave the Order.

At an unknown time before the main story, the Order would recruit Kanaguri after he killed an unknown Order member, who was also his good friend, over an argument about what makes the greatest movie, and would join the Order in his place.[28] This happened before the main story began.

During the JCC Transfer Exams Arc, Sakamoto came off in not knowing or recognizing Kanaguri.[30] Which implies that Kanaguri's recruitment into the Order was after Sakamoto's retirement.
It is possible Kanaguri was recruited before Sakamoto had left the Order and Sakamoto had simply not seen Kanaguri between him joining and his retirement, or that Kanaguri's appearance had changed significantly between then and now.
At an unknown time, Shishiba recruited Osaragi after she had killed numerous assassins who were his intended targets.
Osaragi would be introduced to Yotsumura by Shishiba, showing that Yotsumura had been removed the Order long before Osaragi was recruited.
A flashback that Hyo had implied that Sakamoto was still in the Order when Osaragi was recruited or at least groom.[31] This however, seemingly contradicts the timeline originally established, as Sakamoto and Osaragi did not know each other and when introduced by Shishiba, it is mentioned that Osaragi is "new", implying that she joined the Order at some point after Sakamoto's retirement.[32]
During the events of the JCC Infiltration arc, Kanaguri was expelled from the Order and the JAA.[28]

Kanaguri's expulsion was for concealing evidence from the JAA and collusion with X. His actions were hugely motivated by his desire to film the conflict between X's Organization and the JAA from both perspectives.
Hyo would go to Bangkok, Thailand in order to investigate X's Organization. He would meet and assist Heisuke with recovering his stolen baggage and be lured into combat with Kumanomi, a member of X's Organization, who managed to injure and subsequently drown him.[33]

During the events of the Bangkok Arc, Hyo was be killed in combat by Kumanomi. [31]
During the events of the Assassin Exhibition of the Century arc, Order member Nagumo Yoichi would be expelled from the Order, and Order member Takamura would be killed in combat.

JAA Chairman Sei Asaki would instruct Nagumo to kill Rion-Uzuki. Nagumo would instead decide to ignore his instructions and escape together with Sakamoto and Rion-Uzuki. As a result, JAA Chairman Sei Asaki would simultaneously expel him from the Order and designate him (along with Sakamoto and Uzuki) as a Special Class-A extermination target, wanted for conspiracy against the JAA.
Takamura would see extermination targets Sakamoto, Nagumo, and Uzuki together, and engage them in combat. Takamura would injure them but would ultimately be overwhelmed after Uzuki's companions join the battle and be killed by Uzuki himself.
At an unknown time, Oki took over as the leader of the Order.

Oki was implied to be overseas for a large part of the story.
At an unknown time while he was overseas, Order leader Oki recruited members Torres and Tanabata.[34]

The Al-Kamar orphanage was a scheme to take in orphans and train them to kill, creating Order members. No Order members have been revealed to be from the Al-Kamar orphanage.

Oki has decided that currently, the best course of action for the Order is to work with X and his organization, likely due to how unlikely it is for them to defeat the former's Takamura personality.

2.content:
PROFESSIONAL STATUS
AFFILIATION
Japan
The Japanese Association of Assassins (日に本ほん殺ころし屋や連れん盟めい, Nihon Koroshiya Renmei?, lit. "Japanese Hitmen League/Federation") — JAA for short (Satsuren (殺サツ連レン, Satsuren?) in Japanese) — is an official assassin organization based in Japan. It is the largest of its kind at a member count of 1,000, with just under 400 of those being professional assassins.

Due to the actions of Slur and his group, over a quarter of JAA assassins have been purged.


ADVERTISEMENT
Overview

As the largest assassination organization in Japan, the JAA effectively holds a monopoly over the business. The JAA is described to be an extremely wealthy organization; the JAA Tokyo Bureau is vast and extensive with enough infrastructure to resemble part of a city.

In addition to assassination jobs, the JAA offers a more diverse range of services including weapons manufacturing or repairing public spaces damaged during assassination missions. Clients pay a fee to the JAA for these jobs, who then pass the assignment onto the appropriate individual.

Information is discreetly transmitted to assassins. Examples include highly expensive movie rentals and encoded scratch cards.

Uda describes the JAA has having good pay and benefits. Though allegedly, 30% of an assassin's earnings are taken by the JAA and refusal to pay this fee results in death.[Citation needed]
Agencies

The JAA can outsource its client's requests to agencies for an agency fee. However, due to the actions of Slur and his group, many of these agencies have been wiped out. The only named agency is Dondenkai Ltd, of which Boiled and Obiguro are members of. Nagumo mentions at least 30 agencies, all of which are defunct after attacks by Slur.[Citation needed]

Becoming an Assassin

Joining the JAA requires typically formal education at a dedicated school for assassination. Exceptions such as Osaragi exist, who Nagumo recalls never attended any assassin school. Assassin schools teach aspiring assassins a variety of skills ranging from using guns to close-quarters combat and poisoning. It is here that successful students may acquire assassin licenses, either upon graduation or during their studies. These assassin licenses seemingly expire only when the bearer dies.

There are two known assassin schools:

Japan Clear Creation (JCC)
Kansai Region Assassin Institute
According to Hotta, a JCC student, assassins cannot work unless they go through the JAA.
The Order

Main article: Order
The Order (ORDERオーダー, Ōdā?) is a special group of JAA assassins that, as the name suggests, maintains order in the assassin world whenever friction arises, i.e.: dealing with anything that may prove troublesome for Japan's assassin industry if not dealt with immediately. The Order is made up of the strongest assassins in the JAA and is thus a very small group. Members of the Order are so powerful that the JAA rarely assigns several members to the same mission; having the entire Order sent for one assignment has never been seen.

History

Trivia

It is unknown if there are any similar organizations to JAA outside Japan. Nagumo claims to have a "gold assassin license", though how this differs from a regular license is unknown.[1]
A Diploma of Assassination is required for a "silver assassin license", though how many types of licenses are still unknown.
The JAA Tokyo Bureau has visitor passes.
Trespassers on JAA Tokyo Bureau grounds are eliminated as per JAA protocol.

Taro Sakamoto (坂本さかもと太郎たろう, Sakamoto Tarō?) is the main protagonist of the series Sakamoto Days. Previously the best assassin in the world and a former member of the Order, he now runs a convenience store with his wife Aoi and daughter Hana. After a bounty is placed on his head, Sakamoto is thrust back into the world of assassins, alongside his new allies Shin, Lu, and Heisuke.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Sakamoto is a tall, fat man with slicked back gray hair that is tied into a ponytail at the back of his head (similar to a man bun) and he has a small broom mustache. He typically wears an apron over a T-shirt and long pants. Sakamoto prefers to wear slippers, even when outside. His eyes are usually hidden by the glare of his round glasses.

In the past, Sakamoto was much leaner with no mustache. His facial features were more defined and his eyes were visible through his glasses. Through burning through his accumulated calories, Sakamoto can revert to this form for a power boost. Shin notes his transformed appearance makes him look handsome.

During the JCC infiltration arc, Nagumo disguised Sakamoto as his wife Aoi Sakamoto.

Sakamoto's overweight appearance after retiring.
Sakamoto's overweight appearance after retiring.
Sakamoto during his days as an assassin
Sakamoto during his days as an assassin

ADVERTISEMENT
Personality

Sakamoto isn't much of a talker and instead prefers to let his actions speak for themselves. He deeply loves his family, shown by the fact that he left his hitman profession just to be with them, and is very protective of them. He also has a great amount of respect for his wife Aoi. Because of his deep love for his wife and the life that he has built with her, he adheres to a "No Killing Policy". This policy has inadvertently given him a sense of justice, as even in the presence of other assassins, he prevents them from killing if possible. This policy also extends to his enemies, even those who attempt to kill both him and his family.

Sakamoto rarely shows emotion, though he is comically scared of incurring his wife's wrath. As the series progresses, Sakamoto begins to exhibit more of his emotions that were previously kept hidden, with him even beginning to talk frequently outside of his mind and expressing how he feels to those around him. However, he is not without fault, sometimes hiding his feelings to protect those around them or make them feel safe, as shown when Saw attacked Shin and Lu in his absence and were gravely injured. This caused Sakamoto to feel internal rage, though he kept this hidden, even trying to hide it when called out for it.

Although usually composed and good-natured, Sakamoto can be angered quickly when his family is threatened or injured and he is unable to help them in any way. Sakamoto has shown intense anger when his daughter was threatened to the point that he nearly loses his mind and attempts to kill the individual who made the threat towards his child. When Saw grievously injured Shin and Lu in a battle, Sakamoto felt only pure rage though he did not express this to either of them.

In the past, Sakamoto was much more callous and indifferent to killing, being described as the perfect killing machine who felt absolutely no emotion when taking on a job. However, this changed after meeting his future wife Aoi. Through her influence, Sakamoto learned to respect the sanctity of life and becomes enraged when Apart jeopardizes the lives of innocent citizens during their fight. Despite this, he is still very much capable of killing and humorously imagines killing Shin over minor annoyances, much to the clairvoyant's horror.

Sakamoto is an affable man and generally helps people when asked. Many people on his neighborhood rely on him for mundane things such as cutting tree branches, feeding toddlers, or even something more exaggerated like reshaping a single ball into two so that two children can play, all of which he does with little problem, becoming well liked in his community as a result.

ADVERTISEMENT
Relationships

Family

Aoi Sakamoto

Aoi is Sakamoto's wife and the main reason he left the hitman business. He deeply loves and respects her, trying his best to protect her but also to keep from making her angry. A good example of this can be seen in how he tries to keep in line with her rules to avoid her divorcing him.

Hana Sakamoto

Hana is Sakamoto's daughter and only child. Although they do not interact much in the manga, Sakamoto deeply loves her and will do his best to protect her as demonstrated when he took a heavy beating from multiple shoppers to obtain a special backpack Hana wanted.

Allies

Shin Asakura

Sakamoto's former partner and pupil from his assassin glory days who now works as an employee at his store. Sakamoto cares deeply about Shin, evident by the fact he saved him from being killed, often confiding in him and trusting him above all else. Shin is the closest thing Sakamoto has to a friend, and a possible younger brother figure. Shin harbors a great deal of respect and admiration for Sakamoto, seeing him as a mentor and one of the greatest men in his life.

Lu Shaotang

A young woman from a Triad family whom Sakamoto saves for the sole purpose of making pork buns for him. Ever since then, she has come to work in his store although she seems to have friction with Shin. Sakamoto seems to have a great deal of appreciation and concern for Lu comparable to that of Shin, demonstrated by his constant urge to protect her. He goes through great lengths to let Lu stay as a member of his store and his family when Wutang comes looking for her.

Nagumo

An old friend of Sakamoto's as well as a member of the Order, an elite assassin group that Sakamoto was formerly a member of. It appears that they first met and became friends during the time they spent in their shared JAA class. At one point in Chapter 45, Nagumo defends Sakamoto's store while he is away, showing he is willing to do favors for Sakamoto, as well as demonstrating that Sakamoto trusts Nagumo enough to protect his family and his store. Sakamoto, Nagumo, and Rion Akao were close friends during their time at the JAA, being both excellent students, setting many records during their time then, and troublemakers, leading to their expulsion where the trio were introduced to Kindaka and the Order.

Heisuke Mashimo

Sakamoto first meets Heisuke when the latter takes up the bounty on his head. Heisuke confronted Sakamoto and Shin, cornering them both due to his skill. However, he was ultimately defeated when his rifle was destroyed with a simple rock thrown by Sakamoto with Shin's help in locating him. The two quickly become compatriots when he won the air soft tournament with Sakamoto and Shin, and received his share of the prize money, fifty yen.

Rion Akao

They initially met during their time at the JCC. Even before Nagumo joined the assassin department, they forged a strong friendship, working together on missions. Throughout their time at the JAA, they were recognized as excellent students and troublemakers, especially by one of their teachers, Etsuko Satoda, which ultimately led to their expulsion. It was during this time that they were introduced to Kindaka and the Order. Eight years after her death, Sakamoto eventually got married and retired from his life as an assassin. However, his past caught up with him when someone using the name Akao placed a billion-yen bounty on his head.


ADVERTISEMENT
Skills & Abilities

Sakamoto killing men in his prime
Sakamoto slaughtering hordes of enemies in his prime.
Overall Skill Level: Even among the Order, Sakamoto is known to be the strongest hitman of all time, holding both immense skill in combat and also excelling in all aspects of killing. No one can seemingly match his skill in the current storyline. To date, he has only ever been outclassed in sharpshooting by Heisuke Mashimo, an assassin who excels in that aspect. Even in his chubby form, Sakamoto is a force to be reckoned with. Granny Miya notes that present Sakamoto only has 30% of his physical abilities compared to his prime.

Sakamoto in present day
Sakamoto in present day
As a student, Sakamoto was still renowned as an exceptional talent, even Byodo the 'database' of the JCC stated that out of the 38,000 students he had seen go to the school Sakamoto was the greatest fighter. Alongside Nagumo and Rion Akao, he was one of the three greatest prospects to ever step foot into the JCC. He surpassed those around him in nearly every aspect imaginable, setting the record for the greatest marksman in JCC history, though that was stripped from him by Heisuke later in his life. As he continued to grow, Sakamoto further eclipsed all of his colleagues and even the very friends he once stood with as equals, even progressing so far as to join the Order. With enough power to singlehandedly wipe out branches of the JAA, his strength only continued to grow. Throughout his entire career he had never failed a mission, with the only person to have ever survived an assassination attempt by his hands being Kei Uzuki.

Though in the present day Sakamoto's skills have waned with time due to his retirement and newfound normal life he is still an incredibly powerful hitman. Despite his chubby appearance in his current state his power is enough to not only contend with but defeat many current assassins. By the account of Granny Miya in his overweight state he is only around 30% of his former fitness level and power compared to when he was an active hitman. However, after being struck in one of his pressure points he grew more accustomed to his current physique allowing for him to use more power and use it to his advantage.

Enhanced Strength: Sakamoto is quite powerful even after retiring and his fitness level decreasing drastically as a result. Sakamoto boasts incredible physical might, being capable of easily decapitating people and kicking Shin across his store through multiple shelves. Sakamoto stabilized the collapsing upper section of the Tokyo Tower by pulling it with a steel cable, stopping a speeding bus with a street sign, holding a person aloft with one hand and destroyed Son-Hee's chakram with just a frying pan. During the Lab Arc, Sakamoto severed multiple ropes restraining him using a coupon sheet and destroyed a mechanized dinosaur skeleton in hand-to-hand combat. Sakamoto is strong enough to throw his wife over the pillars of a suspension bridge. Even in his current state, Sakamoto's strength allowed him to fight and defeat Kanaguri, a powerful former Order member.

Enhanced Marksmanship: Aside from being a phenomenal gunman, Sakamoto has incredible accuracy with regular objects. He hurled a rock up the barrel of Heisuke Mashimo's rifle, destroying it and casually flicked a cough drop at Shin's bullet with enough force to halt it. Sakamoto has thrown popsicle sticks and chopsticks with enough force to pin people to walls.

Master Marksman: Sakamoto took mere seconds to find the cause of a mechanical issue in a pistol while chasing Amane. During his infiltration of the JCC, Sakamoto was able to assemble a gun and fire 67 shots within a minute, all of which were bullseyes; as a JCC student, Sakamoto fired 89 shots, making him the second-best all-time record setter on the JCC gun range.[2]
Enhanced Durability: Sakamoto has phenomenal durability, being able to withstand a kick from Bacho, which sent him flying into an adjacent building with enough force to leave a crater. Sakamoto has also survived extremely tall falls unharmed, withstood numerous point-blank explosions from Boiled and he was unharmed by Uda's suicide bomb which annihilated the majority of an office building floor. Sakamoto's fat also grants him a degree of protection, likely allowing him to survive Apart's wires which were strong enough to cleave through multiple steel beams holding the Tokyo Tower up. During a bathhouse trip, Sakamoto relaxed in a 1°C ice bath (calling the bath tepid) temperatures and enjoyed a sauna hot enough to cause spontaneous combustion. He sat under and withstood a waterfall with a 10-ton water pressure, and repeated the ice bath-sauna-waterfall cycle multiple times in addition to withstanding a water jet powerful enough to launch Shin across the room.

Hypnosis Resistance: Sakamoto was unaffected by Club Jam's hypnosis.
Telepathy Resistance: During Sakamoto and Shin's first battle, Shin was unable to read the veteran assassin's mind, however, Sakamoto can choose whether to block his thoughts or not, as he usually communicates with Shin through telepathy.
Enhanced Speed: Sakamoto possesses incredible speed, being capable of moving so fast that most opponents cannot see or react to him in time. He was able to dodge Son Hee and Bacho's "Tofu Scramble Attack" and hit the latter before he could react, dismantle and slice apart multiple opponents' guns in the blink of an eye before incapacitating them, and being able to catch up with a speeding bus on foot. He was fast enough to swat aside sniper rounds fired by Heisuke, though this mildly injured him. During his battle with Kashima on a moving train, Sakamoto was thrown into a train going the opposite direction, which he ran through the entire length of before bursting out and landing back in Kashima's train.

Enhanced Reflexes: During a failed cruise date, Sakamoto threw Aoi into the air and defeated every assassin on the cruise ship before she landed back in his arms. Sakamoto has ran on the side of walls, scooped boiling water out of the air with an instant ramen cup and spun clothing hangers fast enough to deflect bullets. Sakamoto blocked a bullet fired at his head from less than an inch away using a fork and dodged close range machine gun fire from a turret. During a game of Old Maid, Sakamoto was fast enough to swipe a card from someone's hand and put it back without the person noticing.

Enhanced Stamina: Throughout the entire series, Sakamoto has shown no visible signs of exhaustion in any fight.

Skinny/Physical Prime Form: Although it's unknown how he does it, Sakamoto can assume a form similar to what he had when he was still in shape, gaining a massive boost to all of his physical abilities as demonstrated when he completely overwhelmed Boiled, an extremely capable hitman who'd previously been giving him quite a bit of trouble. Granny Miya was somehow able to prevent Sakamoto from using this form after her treatments for him to rely on his chubby (current) form more.

Master Combatant: Sakamoto's combat skills are far beyond what trained assassins are capable of. Conventional weaponry such as guns are virtually useless against him as he can block or dodge such attacks before they reach him, and his intelligence and adaptability to any situation allows him to counteract unusual weapons and fighting styles. One of his most notable abilities is his ability to weaponize random objects. Sakamoto has used cooking pots, frying pans, freezers, traffic signs, cough drops, stickers, vacuum cleaners, clipboards, drawers, pens, cards and paper with the same effectiveness as regular weapons.

While he is skilled at handling weapons, Sakamoto prefers to go unarmed, believing that dependence on weapons is a sign of a third-rate assassin.

High Intelligence: Sakamoto's use of anything within arm's reach as an effective weapon demonstrates creativity, resourcefulness and quick thinking under high pressure. As a JCC student, Sakamoto memorized Boiled's bombs composition after a brief glance. Sakamoto's improvisation skills allowed him to blind Kashima with a sticker and mechanical pencil lead and use a railroad tie as a surfboard.
Vehicular Mastery: Sakamoto is skillful enough to use a motorcycle as a weapon, whipping the rear wheel into a pursuer's face.

ADVERTISEMENT
Equipment

Sakamoto has been described to be very strong in making the most of his surroundings and environment. However, Sakamoto still posses some items used multiple times over the series.

Bulletproof Glasses: A pair of round glasses that have been used by Sakamoto throughout his life. The lenses are bulletproof, as a bullet fired at them at point-blank range bounced off.

Apron: Sakamoto's apron is made of an extremely durable material, able to shield people from explosions with no damage.

Hidden Weapons Arsenal: Sakamoto's armory is hidden in the convenience store behind rotating walls, accessed by typing a code into the cash register.

It contains at least 12 handguns and 20-21 long guns of varying nature (carbines, rifles and assault rifles), at least 5 grenades, an unknown amount of ammunition (4 magazines are seen), a utility knife and a taser. The armory also contains more unusual items, such as kitchen gloves, wire cutters, rakes, a shovel, gardening spade, two wire cutters and a bolt cutter.

4.content:
Sakamoto's Store is a small, two-story convenience store owned by Taro and Aoi Sakamoto. The first floor is occupied by a small store, whereas the second floor serves as the Sakamoto family's living space.

The wage, at least for Shin Asakura, is 1855 yen per hour with extra pay for overtime.[1]



History

Initially, the place was run-down, abandoned, and planned to be torn down. Taro Sakamoto was allowed to live on the second floor. Eventually, Aoi saw the place for the first time and got the idea to refurbish it into a local store for the neighborhood, giving Taro a place for him to belong.[2]
Staff and Residents

Taro Sakamoto: Owner, staff member, and resident.
Aoi Sakamoto: Owner, staff member, and resident.
Hana Sakamoto: Resident.
Shin Asakura: Employee.
Lu Shaotang: Part-Time Employee.
Heisuke Mashimo: Part-time delivery man.

Yoichi Nagumo (南ナ雲グモ与ヨ市イチ, Nagumo Yoichi?)[5] is a major supporting character in Sakamoto Days and an old friend of Taro Sakamoto and the late Rion Akao. He is first seen paying a visit to Sakamoto to inform him of his bounty [6] and was revealed to be a member of the Order before losing his seat during the Assassin Exhibition of the Century Arc.


Appearance

Nagumo is a handsome man of tall and slim build, medium-length black hair and large black eyes. He wears a red polo shirt with teal, black and white triangle-shaped patterns under a cream-colored trench coat (in the manga, the shirt is white with patterns being red and navy blue, while the shirt being light blue and the coat is brown in the digital-colored manga) as well navy-blue pants (black in the digital-colored manga) and black shoes.

He occasionally wears a white buttoned shirt with a black tie under a dark green business suit (in which he sometimes omits the suit and tie) He also carries a gray briefcase around on his back, which in it contains his signature weapon.[7]

When he was 14 years old, Nagumo appeared taller and thinner before adulthood. His outfits usually consist of a black t-shirt under a yellowish-orange jacket containing black drawings of chains, navy blue shorts and a pair of wooden sandals.

Nagumo's color scheme as seen in the digital-colored manga.
Nagumo's color scheme as seen in the digital-colored manga.
Teenage Nagumo.
Teenage Nagumo.
Nagumo with his weapon briefcase.
Nagumo with his weapon briefcase.
Nagumo wearing his business suit.
Nagumo wearing his business suit.
Tattoos

Nagumo has many tattoos, most of which are hidden by his clothing. His tattoos have mathematical inspirations, in particular, referencing the Golden Ratio.

Tattoos shown include:

On the left side of his neck, he has a marking of the Fibonacci Spiral.
The growth factor of the Fibonacci Spiral is the golden ratio, ~1.6180.
Two rectangular tattoos on both his hands, another reference to the golden ratio.

{\displaystyle \phi ={\sqrt {1+{\sqrt {1+{\sqrt {1+{\sqrt {1+{\sqrt {1+{\sqrt {1+{\sqrt {1+\cdots }}}}}}}}}}}}}}} on his right forearm.
This a presentation of an infinite sequence of nested square roots which resolves to ~1.6180... (the golden ratio).
