The symbols, '2', '
ϕ
{\displaystyle \phi }', '1' and '%' on his index finger, middle finger, ring finger and pinky respectively.
A snake coiled around his lower left leg.
A swallow on the right side of his right leg, just below the knee.
An impossible shape on his shin, below the swallow tattoo.
A square made of various spaced lines and curves on his right thigh.
A mandala-esque pattern on his right shoulder.
A pair of praying hands on his left pectoral.
Likely inspired by the Praying Hands drawing by Albrecht Dürer.
Anton Chekhovs quote "Although you may tell lies, people will believe you, if only you speak with authority" on his right bicep[8]
A line which intersect, wrapping around his anterior forearm.
A patterned, isosceles triangle on his left posterior forearm.
A rectangular tattoo on his right tricep.
A tattoo that is a reference to Leonard Shelby from Christopher Nolan´s Memento. on his left bicep.[8]
A wing on his left waist.[9]
An unidentified tattoo under his left armpit.[9]
Arthur Schopenhauer quote "The doctor sees all the weakness of mankind; the lawyer all wickedness, the theologian all the stupidity." on his right side.[8]
A pair of hands featured in the famous painting "The Creation Of Adam" by Michelangelo, but on the tattoo what would be Adam's hand is flipped so the palm faces upwards as supposed to down.[10]
Personality

Nagumo's most notable traits are his laid-back attitude accompanied by his constant smile that seems impossible to wipe off his face. He also has an incredible talent for annoying those around him to the point of making them want him dead.[11][12][13]

Nagumo also shows to had pretty carefree, even in the middle of intense battles, once claiming to enjoy the wind in his hair as he stabbed a man in the arm.[14] He is also very playful with his opponents, as demonstrated multiple times. For instance, he evades and tricks Minimalist, a hardened serial killer, before handing him some dice to decide which of his blades he'd die by.[15] Another example is during his fight against Gaku, where he asked the latter if he liked Bruce Lee after being hit with a one-inch punch.

However, when it comes to matters involving his friends, Nagumo tends to reveal his true emotions. One such instance is when he pulls Uzuki out of Takamura's slash line, wondering why he saved him despite being a dangerous serial killer, influenced by the fact that a part of Rion Akao still resided in Uzuki's body. In fact, Nagumo has shown deep care for his old friends Sakamoto and Rion since their time at the JAA, still thinking about her even after she was confirmed dead. This is also confirmed in their encounter during the Assassin Exhibition of the Century Arc, where, once Rion took control over Uzuki's body and spoke to him, Nagumo immediately recognized Rion's personality and questioned her identity.

Nagumo believes the key to killing is "deception",[16] despite claiming to abhor it.[17]

Despite this, Nagumo does possess another more cold and serious side of him. He acts on his own agenda most of the time, and sometimes does things to the extent of it being unethical. When he saved Satoru Yotsumura, he blackmailed him and threatened to kill Amane if he didn’t do what he wanted. Additionally, thought he didn’t engage in blackmailing Heisuke (seems to be the most prevalent method he uses..) he participated in the kidnapping of him, again, for information.
Relationships

Allies

Taro Sakamoto

Nagumo and Sakamoto first met when they were both enrolled at the JCC, having known each other since they were 14. Nagumo cares deeply about Sakamoto, to the point of not wanting him to be in danger, even though he knows Sakamoto's help is often necessary. Nagumo has repeatedly demonstrated his close friendship with Sakamoto, maintaining contact with him even after Sakamoto retired from being an assassin and became hunted by the JAA[18]. He has also done favors for Sakamoto and helped him out, such as when he disguised himself as Aoi Sakamoto and stood in as a cashier, killing Minimalist in the process.[19]

Sakamoto and Nagumo remained close friends over time and even collaborated, along with Kei Uzuki (who was taken over by Rion's personality), during their fight against Takamura in the Assassin Exhibition of the Century. Nagumo refused to follow Asaki's orders and chose to side with Sakamoto, leading to both of them being expelled from the Order and hunted by the JAA.

Rion Akao

Nagumo met Rion after transferring from the Spy Department to the Assassin Department, where she initially wanted to attack him.[20] Along with Sakamoto, they soon became an inseparable trio, causing property damage and engaging in playful banter and fights. Their antics eventually led to their expulsion from the JCC, after which they were introduced to Kindaka and the Order together.

After Rion's death, Nagumo investigated her death through various methods. This included paying for Kindaka's recovery bills and rescuing Yotsumura from drowning, so he could order him to look for any intel related to Rion. Nagumo has shown many times that he cares deeply for Rion, such as when he hesitated to attack Uzuki when Rion took control of his body and when he bore the brunt of Takamura's attack to protect Uzuki.

Kindaka

Nagumo first met Kindaka after being expelled from the JCC due to his behavior and constant fights with Rion and Sakamoto. In an effort to have the expulsion withdrawn, Nagumo, Sakamoto and Rion accepted a mission to assassinate Kindaka. However, after meeting him and engaging in a fierce battle, Kindaka offered Nagumo and the others a place in the Order and took them on a mission with him. Later, Kindaka fell into a coma due to Kobayashi's poison. Driven by his desire to investigate Rion's death, Nagumo paid Kindaka's hospital bills for eight years in a row, covering 1.2 million yen per month. When Kindaka eventually woke up, Nagumo handed him the entire bill, which totaled 1.15 billion yen, and asked him to repay the amount.

Shishiba

Nagumo and Shishiba seem to have a good and mutual relationship, though he tends to get on Shishiba's nerves sometimes to the point of being threatened.

Hyo

Nagumo enjoyed teasing Hyo the most out of all the members of the Order. Despite this, Nagumo truly cared for him, and was saddened by his death. He shot off a bullet into the air as a sign of respect .

Skills & Abilities

Overall Skill Level: Nagumo is an ex-member of the Order and one of the strongest assassins in Japan.[21] As a student Nagumo was one of the three greatest prospects to ever step foot into the JCC alongside Taro Sakamoto and Rion Akao with Rion Akao acknowledging his fighting ability. Kindaka, a founding member of the Order stated that the three of them could be future leaders of the assassin world.[22] In current time, Slur considered Nagumo as one of the top two fighters in the Order, and thus the second strongest assassin in the JAA.[23]

Granny Miya stated that he is currently stronger than Taro Sakamoto due to the latter's five year-long retirement.[1] Kashima classified him as an S-rank target on the hit list he created.[24][25] Sakamoto has even stated that it would take a lot for Nagumo to lose a fight.[26] Due to his exceptional combat abilities, he was able to put Gaku, one of Uzuki's strongest subordinates on the brink of death after engaging him in battle.[23]

Master of Disguise: Nagumo can copy other people's appearances perfectly in an instant, which he used to fool Lu Shaotang by disguising as Sakamoto.[27] He can also disguise others, including significantly altering someone's body shape, such as disguising the fat Sakamoto as his wife, Aoi. When disguising Sakamoto, Nagumo says the disguise would only last for twenty-four hours.[28]

Master Combatant: Nagumo's combat skills include everything with coordination and skill, making him a deadly combatant.[29] He can render a man completely unconscious with only his killing intent.[30]

Nagumo is extremely proficient with bladed weapons.[31][32][33][34] He was able to decapitate Minimalist with ease,[35] and kill multiple assassins in one swift motion before they could even react.[36]

His combat skill was stated by Slur to be among the top two in the Order.[23] This was made evident in his fight against Gaku; despite being outmatched in physical ability, Nagumo was able to defeat him with his combat skill and trickery.[23] Nagumo was able to land devastating strikes on Gaku by catching him off guard with hidden weapons or by distracting him with his dice.[37][38] Even after his weapon was destroyed, leaving him with all his blades separated, Nagumo was able to fight on par with Gaku and eventually pierce him with the separated blades to end the fight.[23]


Expert Marksman: Nagumo can use firearms with great proficiency. He ranked 4th place in the top 10 greatest shooters of all time at the JCC, having scored 84 points.[39]

Morse Code: Nagumo can use morse code, as shown when he uses the signal lights of a moving vehicle to tell Shishiba that he was "killing".[40]

Keen Intellect: Nagumo was a part of the intelligence-gathering department during his younger days at the JCC.[41] He is a highly perceptive individual, quickly able to deduce Kindaka's theory of a spy existing within the JAA's organization without the latter even saying anything,[42] and was also able to quickly notice that Erio Muto, a JAA executive, was a spy working for Slur.[43] His intellect and planning is partly what makes him such a deadly fighter, as he's able to stay one step ahead of his opponent through deception and schemes.

Poison Knowledge: Most likely due to his upbringing as a spy’s apprentice and his training at the JCC, Nagumo is very knowledgeable of how poison works and understands how to adapt to it.[44]
Enhanced Speed: Nagumo is capable of moving at extreme speeds, being fast enough to instantaneously disappear from a person’s sight.[45] He can move so quick that he managed to catch even Shin off guard,[46] as well as decapitate Minimalist in an instant. His speed is on par with Gaku.[47]

Enhanced Strength: Nagumo casually lifted Minimalist by the neck with one hand[48] and was strong enough to contend with Yotsumura's attacks which could easily slice through the steel supports of a car carrier trailer.[32]

Enhanced Reflexes: Nagumo was also able to save Heisuke Mashimo from a potential head shot.[49]

Enhanced Durability: Nagumo is incredibly resilient despite his skinny build. He remains completely unharmed after taking a hit from Gaku´s mace that sent him flying through multiple walls,[50] a display airplane,[51] and a car sculpture.[52] Even after taking a point-blank ranged attack from Gaku's powerful laser mace that sent him crashing down to the ground with devastating force, Nagumo received only minor injuries.[53]
Equipment

Multi-Tool: Nagumo uses a large switchblade-like weapon that has six different functions.[54][32] In the past, he carried each blade separately under his trench coat.[55]

The weapons contained inside his large multi-tool weapon include:

Multiple Blades
There are multiple fold and pop-out blades contained within Nagumo's large multi-tool weapon.[31] One of his blades doubles as a can opener at parties.[56]
Daggers
Inside the weapon, Nagumo carries a pair of daggers who have blades sharp enough to pierce through the roof of a SUV being driven by an assassin targeting Shishiba and durable enough to withstand blows from Yotsumura´s three sections staff.[14]
Scythe
A scythe that Nagumo held along with his other weapons. He used it during his fight against Gaku, primarily to distract him from his invisible blade.[57]
Axe
Nagumo's weapon can transform into a durable axe that he used during his fight against Gaku to send him crashing into the wing of an airplane. The back side of the axe is flat, which confused Gaku about whether the weapon was an axe or a hammer.[58]
Invisible Blade
A disposable yet sharp blade, made entirely of ceramic, with the peculiar characteristic of being almost invisible. By distracting Gaku with his other weapons, Nagumo managed to sneak the ceramic blade out and stab him.[59] It is stated that the blade only works once, as it becomes visible after being soiled with blood.[60]
Dice: Nagumo uses a single dice to decide which blade he'll kill his enemy by,[15] or to distract his enemy to deliver a devastating blow.

6.content:
LOCATION
Remote Island
INHABITANTS
JCC Staff
JCC Students
The JCC (Japan Clear Creation) is an academy for aspiring assassins. It is described as Japan's preeminent assassin-training program. According to Natsuki Seba, the JCC has existed for around 50 years.

The JCC has an enrolment of nearly 1,000 students with an 8:2 male-to-female ratio, 35 faculty and boasts a four-year curriculum. The graduation rate is 10%, with the remaining 90% of students dying or quitting. Every student lives in dormitories, as the JCC is located on a remote island.

The JCC is the primary location of the JCC Infiltration Arc.


Overview

JCC Interior
Students at the JCC.
The academy trains aspirants in a variety of assassin skills ranging from firearm-handling, close-quarters combat and hands-on training. The JCC is described to have an extreme training regimen, and students often do not survive to see graduation. However, well-performing students may acquire an assassin license during their time at the JCC. The JCC is renowned for training extremely powerful assassins such as Taro Sakamoto and Nagumo.

Some teachers such as Satoda-sensei are retired assassins, and teachers wanting to work at the JCC can do so with an internship. Despite their harsh personalities, difficult classes and teaching styles, they mostly care about their students and don't want to see them injured or dead.

Entrance to the JCC is done through a practical examination which applicants must undergo. Tests can be retaken if failed, but are different every year and have a high mortality rate. As per JCC regulation, aspirants cannot have a bounty at the time of application.

Fighting between students is not allowed, but seems to be loosely enforced. Both students and teachers can carry weapons; one close-combat teacher was seen carrying a handgun and students are encouraged to carry a weapon.

The JCC has a Yoshimura Prize, which is awarded to a few students every year. Based on how Natsuki Seba was awarded the prize due to developing an invisibility suit, it can be presumed that the Yoshimura Prize is for those who have made revolutionary developments in their respective departments.

The JCC has no dress code, though students working in laboratories still wear jumpsuits or white coats.
Defenses

The JCC is located on a remote island. Entry via boat is impossible as tides are too complex to allow docking; thus the only method of entry or exit is aircraft. The airspace around the JCC is also defended by surface-to-air missiles which destroy any unauthorized aircraft. It can be inferred from this that any intruders that make it onto the island or campus are also immediately killed.

The JCC's surface-to-air missiles.
The JCC's surface-to-air missiles.
The island the JCC is located on.
The island the JCC is located on.
Part-Time Jobs

Students can take part-time jobs during their time at the JCC. They vary in pay and risk level. According to Akira, Floaters, Spotters and Test Subjects are some of the most popular part-time jobs.
Floaters

Floaters repair and clean job sites after jobs. Floaters have a daily wage of 15,000 yen and are considered to have the lowest-risk job.

Floaters
Floaters
Spotters

Spotting is a moderately-risky job. Spotters help snipers observe targets and monitor atmospheric conditions and have a daily wage of 20,000 - 50,000 yen.

Spotters
Spotters
Test Subjects

Test subjects are the most dangerous job. Test subjects are used to examine the effects of newly-developed poisons or weapons. Depending on the risk level, they are paid 30,000 - 800,000 yen per test.

Test Subjects
Test Subjects
Classes

The type of classes taken by students are likely dependent on the major. Some classes have prerequisites, such as poisoning classes which require applicants to be third-year students.

Much like a university or college, the JCC appears to have different majors that students can take. For example, both Akira Akao and Shin Asakura are first-year Assassination Majors. JCC classes includes ordinary lectures (such as "Intro to Assassin History") , but can be interspersed with hands-on demonstrations (e.g having two students take turns using a knife to fight in close-quarters combat classes) or practical exercises (e.g diving or gun assembly).

There are 5 known departments, as shown on an advertisement brochure:

暗殺科 - Assassination Department
暗殺特殊科 - Special Assassination Department
毒殺科 - Poisoning Department
武器製造科 - Weapon Manufacturing Department
諜報活動科 - Spy Department
The JCC has graduation tests. Seniors (fourth-years) are given an "Assassin Permission Slip" which allows them to target a specific person for 24 hours. Whether this slip allows the test-taker to kill their target is unknown.
Facilities

In addition to normal facilities such as lecture halls, dormitories, libraries and gymnasiums, the JCC boasts modified or specialized facilities not seen in regular schools.
Cafeteria

In the cafeteria, students use low-power laser guns to shoot a distant board with buttons. Certain buttons give a receipt for a certain meal, which can then be paid for, with better meals having smaller and more infrequent buttons. The cafeteria is known to have a universally-disliked "JCC Bowl" (consisting of vegetable scraps, army rations and brown rice), a steak lunch and ramen. Natsuki Seba often uses his invisibility suit to walk right up to the board and shoot it, much to the annoyance of other students.

A student carefully aims the gun...
A student carefully aims the gun...
... and gets another JCC Bowl.
... and gets another JCC Bowl.
Database

The databank is a collection of school records of every student, past and present. In addition to body type, age, and gender the records also list the person's weapon of choice, martial arts specialties and post-graduation activities. The existence of the databank is dubious and a popular urban legend around the JCC and finding it is the goal of Sakamoto, Shin and Akira during the JCC Infiltration Arc.

A man named Byodo is the database. Byodo is a man with a photographic memory, and Amane's grandfather.[1]

Airport

The JCC boasts an expansive airport, which is the only way to get in or out. It is large enough to maintain and deploy wide-body airliners.

Diving Pool

An expansive diving pool with a diving bell is seen during an expository section.

JCC Pool
Medical Center

A medical center is mentioned by a student. Due to the JCC's severe training regimen and remote location, it is likely as well-equipped as a regular hospital.

Weapons Research Department Laboratories

One is located in the south building. Natsuki Seba uses this facility frequently and has a habit of destroying other student's projects to acquire raw materials.

Exterior
Exterior
Interior
Interior
Amane's Dormitory

A fairly rundown dormitory inhabited by Amane and numerous other Slur followers. A disguised Sakamoto is forced to fight his way through this area after being attacked by students before being able to talk with them to try gain information on the database.

Exterior
Exterior
Interior
Interior

Uzuki/Slur (JAA defector, assassin killer)
Trivia

Like any regular school, the JCC has a website and advertisement brochures.
According to Sakamoto, the JCC also has school activities such as school festivals, sports days and school trips.[2]
Girls from the poison department may mix experimental poisons into Valentine's chocolates if they cannot find test subjects.
At the time of Satoda's retirement, she and Byodo were the only surviving members of their class.
The school had a slightly different appearance in ch 10 vs ch 74
Heisuke apparently graduated with a Sharpshooting Major in the Assassination Department

WARNING! (1)
Kei Uzuki (有う月づき憬けい, Uzuki Kei?), also known as "X" or "Slur" (☓スラー, Surā?), is the main antagonist of the Sakamoto Days series. He is a serial killer seeking to overthrow the JAA with a group of fellow assassins. Roughly around the same time Taro Sakamoto was given his bounty, Uzuki slaughtered one-fourth of the assassin industry, leaving a large 'X' mark at the scene of his crimes written with the blood of his victims.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


00:00

41:20

Uzuki is a seemingly slim man of average height. He has medium-length white hair (blond in the digital colored manga) with a long fringe that often covers part of his emotionless blue, cat-like eyes, also covering even his nose when leaning forward. His hair also covers his ears and is styled in a messy, middle-part haircut. He usually wears a light grey turtleneck (light orange in the digital-colored manga) under a greyish-yellow coat (beige in the digital-colored manga) that reaches below his knees, alongside black pants (grey in the anime and beige in the digital-colored manga) and formal black shoes.

When he was younger, during his time at the JCC, Uzuki wore the same turtleneck along with the same black pants and shoes but without the coat.

After regaining control of his body, Shinaya described Uzuki as a good-looking man with white hair and a white suit.

When Rion's personality takes over, he aquires eyes similar to hers. When Takamura's personality takes over, his pupils turn completely white.

Uzuki's full body.
Uzuki's full body.
Takamura's personality in Uzuki.
Takamura's personality in Uzuki.
Rion's personality in Uzuki.
Rion's personality in Uzuki.

ADVERTISEMENT
Personality

Main Personality (Kei Uzuki)

Kei Uzuki was initially portrayed as a calm and cold man, being able to kill a quarter of the assassins in cold blood without a hint of words. He is also a sadist, considering he almost lack any remorse for his killings and provoked Sakamoto by mentioning his 6-years old daughter when Sakamoto refused to fight with the intention of taking the former's life, hinting that he may harm Sakamoto's family if he were to be left alive.

However, during his groups attack on the JAA, Uzuki showed a friendlier, more caring side which was seen through his conversation with Gaku and the remorse he felt at Uda's self-sacrifice for the others to escape Takamura. As he demonstrated multiple times, Uzuki's cold and deadly personality changes radically whenever he is alone with his friends or those he cares about, showing a softer and friendlier side of him which also seems more vulnerable.

In the past, Uzuki was shown as a reserved, timid, and shy person who firmly believed that killing is wrong and did not kill assassins unless required by the mission or the specific target. His older brother Sei Asaki took advantage of it by threatening to kill Gaku and Uzuki's other friends in the orphanage where he was born if he failed to uphold his end of a deal. Asaki's threats might also have been the reason why Uzuki's main goal, after completing the mission to escort both the daughter and wife of the JAA chairman to safety, was to return to the orphanage where he was raised and save all his friends. His accidental murder of Rion Akao led to him abandoning his morals and become the villain that he is today.

Uzuki suffers from Dissociative Identity Disorder, a condition which developed as a way for Uzuki to deal with the trauma. This condition allows Uzuki to create multiple personas, changing his own characteristics to match those of a specific individual; these personas remain even after the person they're based on dies and are so accurate that even other people who were close to the person whom Uzuki is emulating have trouble telling the difference, an example of this would be Sakamoto and Nagumo who admitted that Uzuki's Rion persona resembled their old friend so closely that it's hard to distinguish between the real Rion and Rion-Uzuki. Since the death of Haruma, Gaku's unknown fate, and the seeming assimilation of the Takamura personality, Uzuki has become a jaded and uncaring individual, a shell of his former self. He seemingly no longer cares about his foster siblings, letting the Rion Akao personality influence his opinions on Tenkyu and is fixated on the goal of destroying the Japanese Association of Assassins no matter the cost.

Uzuki can also mimic, if not outright replicate, the individual's mannerisms and capabilities as well. An example of this can be seen with his Takamura personality who not only mutters unintelligibly just as the real Takamura did but is also a master swordsman, being able to match and eventually cut down the real Takamura despite Uzuki having not shown any proficiency with wielding a katana up to that point in the series.

Rion Akao Personality

The Rion Akao persona possesses a similar personality to the original Rion Akao and originally tried to protect him as it was her purpose, however, Uzuki did not reciprocate these feelings, dismissing her as a mere echo of his friend and intended to seal her away after his mission of dismantling the JAA was complete, recognizing his threat, she decided to put a bounty on Sakamoto's head so that he could kill Uzuki as she cannot directly kill him.

Takamura Personality

The Takamura persona is similar to the original Takamura. Although this persona lacks Takamura's loyalty to JAA and sense of justice, he maintaining the instinct in attacking anyone (even animals) who have aggression towards him. Upon getting this persona, Uzuki acts Takamura in most cases during battles.


ADVERTISEMENT
Relationships

Allies

Gaku

Gaku and Uzuki first met at the Al-Kamar orphanage, where they were both raised as potential new members of the Order. Uzuki has demonstrated multiple times that he cares about Gaku and trusts him deeply, whom he considered as his own brother, as evidenced when Asaki took an 13-years old Gaku hostage and threatened to kill him if Uzuki failed to complete his mission to kill Kindaka.[2][3]

After Uzuki indiscriminately murdered 34 people at the orphanage and saved Gaku, along with all the other teenagers, he then formed a group with them. Both Gaku and Uzuki seem to get along well together, mainly talking whenever there's a need to discuss the mission or anything related to the JAA. Gaku appears to be Uzuki's right-hand man in the whole group and also the one Uzuki trusts the most.

Sei Asaki

Asaki is Uzuki's older brother. As shown during the Taro Sakamoto's Past Arc, Uzuki used to fear his older brother. Asaki mostly used him for killing, exploiting Uzuki's reserved and timid personality and often threatening to harm his friends if he refused to cooperate. Later on, after Uzuki became Slur, he attempted to kill Asaki, who was the JAA chairman, showing that he no longer feared or felt timid around him. Asaki ordered Nagumo to kill whoever had taken over Uzuki's body during the Assassin Exhibition of the Century Arc and showed concern about Uzuki, asking why he had disappeared, although it is unknown whether this is genuine or an attempt to guilt-trip Uzuki.

Rion Akao

Uzuki first encountered Rion during their time as students at the JCC, just before they were about to depart for Kindaka to fulfill their mission. Rion consistently displayed friendly behavior towards Uzuki, who coldly rejected it. The two later reconciled and warmed up to each other during the mission. Following the deaths of both Higuchi and Kobayashi, Kindaka sacrificed himself to save Uzuki by providing him with the antidote, a moment that Rion noticed. Uzuki's response was to flee with Rion in pursuit.

It is later revealed that Rion helped Uzuki escape, after he disclosed to her the reason why he committed the act.[3] Both of them then went off the grid together for more than a year. They became very close during this period of time, to the point of addressing each other using their respective given names.[4] Unfortunately, Uzuki was tricked into killing her by Asaki who tracked them down.[5]

Years later, due to trauma caused by the murder, Uzuki's mind created a secondary personality resembling Rion's to protect himself.

Enemies

Taro Sakamoto

Sakamoto and Uzuki first met at the JCC when they, along with Nagumo and Rion, risked expulsion. Although Sakamoto and Uzuki didn't interact much, Sakamoto had always been somewhat wary of Uzuki even as students. Upon learning of Rion's death, Sakamoto fought against Uzuki, defeating him to avenge the death of his friend. Years later, Sakamoto discovered that Uzuki had survived their previous encounter. They crossed paths a few times, with Sakamoto unsuccessfully attempting to kill Uzuki again. Whenever Rion's personality takes control, Sakamoto immediately becomes more friendly and approachable, reminiscent of their interactions as students at the JCC. However, Sakamoto still appears somewhat confused about the sudden change in Uzuki's demeanor.


ADVERTISEMENT
Skills & Abilities

Overall Skill Level: Uzuki is the leader of his eponymous group, X's Organization, and an extremely powerful assassin. He has demonstrated multiple times his immense abilities as an assassin and is insanely skillful.

Master Combatant: Uzuki is an incredibly skilled fighter, capable of massacring a quarter of the assassin industry, a feat so great that the Order had to step in.

Enhanced Speed: Uzuki is able to move extremely fast, appearing behind his opponents without them noticing. He is so fast that he is able to stab an out of shape Sakamoto in the stomach and even catch him off-guard with a swing of his whip, which Sakamoto didn't even notice until after the fight. He has also managed to slash both Shin and Asakura's abdomens before they even noticed or felt it.

Enhanced Durability: Despite his skinny body, Uzuki is an extremely durable individual, as he was able to keep up with Sakamoto's blinding speed during their brief fight. He has also managed to survive being slashed by Takamura and catch off his katana.

Enhanced Endurance: Uzuki managed to somehow survive numerous stabbings in the chest by Sakamoto.

ADVERTISEMENT
Medical Conditions

Uzuki suffers from several medical conditions that have allowed him to survive otherwise fatal attacks and have access to combat abilities he normally does not have.
Dissociative Identity Disorder

Uzuki suffers from Dissociative Identity Disorder, which allows him to manifest alternate personas and use any combat abilities that he has witnessed. He has manifested at least two personas throughout the story. The process of persona creation is unclear, though it appears that Uzuki requires being under extreme stress in order to adopt and/or create a persona. It is likely Uzuki also needs to be interacting with a person, during the stressful situation, in order to create the persona, as all revealed personas so far have been copies of known characters that Uzuki has interacted with in stressful situations.

Uzuki's personas adopt many facets of the person and the persona is based on. Uzuki's Rion personality is carefree and aloof like she is, even remembering some facts which implicitly only Rion should know. Uzuki's Takamura personality has his habit of unintelligible muttering. Uzuki's facial features significantly change as well, though his overall expression remains the same, so it is unclear if there are actual changes or this is merely a stylistic choice. These personas surface in different ways or triggers.

Rion-Uzuki:
Rion Akao was a member of the JCC and Uzuki's senior. They disappeared during an incident in the past and lived together for more than a year. Rion's persona has stated that she was manifested to protect Uzuki.
Takamura-Uzuki:
Takamura was known for his precise yet destructive ability to use a katana. Uzuki manifested this personality when he fought against Takamura in order to preserve himself. While in this persona, Uzuki managed to steal Takamura's katana and cut him in half, killing him. In most cases during fights, this persona surfaces due to Takamura's sensitivity response to aggression.
Situs Inversus

Uzuki suffers from Situs Inversus, which is a medical condition in which a person's major internal organs are reversed or mirrored from their normal positions. This is a rare condition that is not widely known, which is how Uzuki survived attacks that would normally be fatal from Sakamoto[5] and Nagumo[6], as they targeted non-vital areas (for Uzuki) that are normally vital.


ADVERTISEMENT
Equipment

Sword-Whip: Uzuki uses a sword-whip, made of a metallic blade divided in multiple sections of a segmented blade which Uzuki uses with long-range attacks and still be able to counter at close range. By using his sword-whip, he managed to temporary block Takamura's arm, forcing him to cut it off and attach it back since he was unable to free from the weapon's grasp.

Katana: Uzuki has used Takamura's katana, stolen from Takamura during combat after manifesting a new Takamura persona. The katana is extremely sharp and durable, capable of slicing through thick steel and concrete with no visible damage to the katana.

WARNING! (1)
Rion Akao (赤尾あかおリオン, Akao Rion?) was an old friend of Taro Sakamoto and Nagumo from their time as students at JCC and is the aunt of Akira Akao, having taught her how to see the "paths" which lead to a person's death.

Seven years before the series, Rion was killed by Kei Uzuki.[3][4]

Appearance

Rion was a tall, slender and attractive young woman with turquiose shoulder-length hair (blue in the anime) and yellow eyes with white pupils and she had thin eyebrows with long eyelashes. Rion also had a tattoo on her right arm, resembling the Orion constellation.

In her first appearance in Sakamoto's memories and during most of the time at the JCC, she was seen wearing a white tank top with a partially zipped, off-shoulder black jacket and a pair of black pants along with black shoes.

When she first met Uzuki, she did not wear her usual black jacket, instead wearing a long sleeved shirt.

During her time spent with Uzuki while hiding from the JAA, Rion wore a large high-necked black jacket with a hood which she used to cover her face. Beneath the jacket, Rion wore her usual white tank top and a pair of black shorts.

Rion's color scheme as seen on Volume 13.
Rion's color scheme as seen on Volume 13.
Rion's appearance during her times at the JAA
Rion's appearance during her times at the JAA
Personality

Rion was a carefree woman who used to do whatever she wanted even if that would lead to consequences[5]. She used to have fun with her friends Sakamoto and Nagumo, sometimes even getting into trouble or causing damage to public structures and buildings like destroying trains[6] or involving the surroundings around her during her fight.

Rion was a very warm and friendly person. She was the only one among her friends, Nagumo, and Sakamoto, who tried to make friends with and talk or interact with Uzuki when he was introduced as the final member of their team in their mission to kill the Steel Dragon. [7] She would often engage in one-sided, rapid-fire conversations with no tact whatsoever.[8]

Rion has been shown to be fiercely protective of the ones she cares about, and is willing to risk herself to protect the ones she cares for. She is aware of this, sharing this fact with Sakamoto when he exposed himself to poison to protect his team, and sharing this with Uzuki when he asked how she would weigh the lives of those she cared for against the lives of others.[9] When she ends up on the run with Uzuki from the JAA, she willingly risks exposing herself to the JAA to undertake illegal freelance assassination jobs so Uzuki does not have to, knowing his personality. She is also willing to help Uzuki attack the Al-Kamar Orphanage despite having no personal attachment to it. [10]
Relationships

Yoichi Nagumo

Rion would first meet Nagumo during their time at the JCC, after he joined the assassin department. The Sakamoto-Nagumo-Rion trio were close friends during their time at the JCC, considered excellent students and troublemakers, especially by Etsuko Satoda. They would eventually be expelled together, and would be introduced together to Kindaka and the Order as a result. They seemed to get along really well, undertaking missions together and even defeating Kobayashi with the assistance of Sakamoto and Kindaka.

After Rion's disappearance, Nagumo had done everything to find out about her whereabouts. To the point of rescuing Satoru Yotsumura so he could order the latter on doing some investigation from inside the JAA, as well as financing Kindaka's treatment for eight years, holding on any slim hope of getting the clue that she's still alive.[11][12]

Nagumo would hesitate to attack Uzuki when his Rion persona took control of his body, and took a hit from Takamura during the Assassin Exhibition of the Century Arc.

Taro Sakamoto

Rion and Sakamoto get to know each other during their shared time at the JCC. Throughout their time at the JCC, Rion, Sakamoto, and Nagumo would often be seen together, and be recognized as both excellent students and troublemakers. Eventually, Rion would be expelled from the JCC, together with Sakamoto and Nagumo.

Rion would be tasked to kill the Steel Dragon as her final mission with the JCC, together with Sakamoto, Nagumo, and Uzuki. While Rion, Sakamoto, and Uzuki sit around to prevent the spread of the poison they were exposed to and wait their turn for the antidote, Rion would express respect for Sakamoto for defeating Higuchi and Kobayashi, who were collectively worth 1 billion yen on the JAA bounty website, saying he was worth that much. She would find herself relating to Sakamoto after seeing him put the others over himself.[9]

Kei Uzuki

Rion and Uzuki met for the first time just before their expulsion mission against Kindaka. Initially, Uzuki remained reserved and rebuffed Rion's friendly demeanor. However, after Rion apologized for her behavior, they engaged in a small conversation inside the car while escorting the daughter and wife of JAA chairman. Her words about killing even her own heart to save people precious to her resonated with him. His attempt to drop the remaining antidote was foiled by Kindaka, at the cost of the latter's own life. Rion witnessed this, and pursued the fleeing Uzuki along the tunnel.[13] After catching up and listening to Uzuki's side of the story, Rion helped him escape the JAA operatives before going off the grid together, for more than a year.[14]

During their time in exile, they grew closer and implicitly develop a relationship.[15] Rion shared a lot of information to Uzuki, such as Nagumo's spy lineage[16], her niece Akira[17], Sakamoto's chastity[8] and her I.D. number as well.[18] They also discussed about living a normal life away from assassins world, with Rion believing neither of them deserved one because of the killings they committed.[19]

Unfortunately, their tranquil life did not last long. Sei Asaki, Uzuki's brother and JAA's new chairman, tracked them down and tricked them into killing each other. Rion did not even blame Uzuki after he murdered her, instead attributing it to Asaki.

Kindaka

Rion and Kindaka's interactions were limited to situational necessity, particularly during their mission to escort the Chairman's daughter and wife. Despite their close proximity, they never engaged an actual conversation. Kindaka expressed an interest in Rion's path ability and special vision, However, he held back from exploring the topic further. This hesitation might have stemmed from his condition after being poisoned by Kobayashi, which might have prevented him from further probing into Rion's abilities.

Akira Akao

Rion is Akira's aunt and is fiercely protective of her. Rion has stated that she would kill someone else without hesitation if it was about protecting Akira, even if it meant killing her own heart.[9] Even though it was never shown any interaction between them, both Akira and Rion proved to care a lot about each other and have a strong bond, as demonstrated by Akira becoming an assassin just to follow her aunt's path. Rion was also the same person who taught Akira how to see the "paths" which lead to a person's death which Akira still currently uses.

History

Currently, there isn't much information about Rion's history. The only few details given are about her kinship with Akira and about Rion being Akira's aunt, as well as their close relationship.
Skills & Abilities

Rion wheelchair
Rion uses a wheelchair to close the distances with Kobayashi
Overall Skill Level: Rion was one of the three greatest prospects to ever step foot into the JCC. During combat training sessions, she would routinely match the fighting capabilities of Taro Sakamoto and Yoichi Nagumo.[20] Rion excelled in direct confrontations as she could see the most efficient way of dealing with enemies and utilize her weapons to the max. This allowed her to put Kindaka, an Order Member, onto the defensive, making him praise her combat skills.[21] Kindaka states that Rion has the potential to be a future leader of the assassin world, alongside Taro Sakamoto and Nagumo. And also stated that Rion's killing pathway has zero wasted movements, forcing him to go on defensive.[22] She was also able to defeat a young Kei Uzuki without sustaining any injuries.[23]

Paths: Rion has the ability to see paths, imaginary lines representing future actions she can take to kill a particular target. Rion has been shown to see multiple paths for the same enemy at one time, indicating that she can simultaneously consider and select between a number of routes to eliminate her foes. She used this ability multiple times, especially against Kindaka, who managed to counter it by blinding her with a few drops of alcohol in her eyes.[24]

Master Marksman: Rion has shown to have incredible accuracy, besting both Nagumo and Sakamoto in a shooting contest, the latter being the second-best all-time record setter on the JCC gun range.[25] As of the current chapter she still ranks 3rd place in the top 10 greatest shooters of all time at the JCC, having scored 86 points.[26] In combat, she has shown to be able to seamlessly shoot her thrown knife accurately to make the knife ricochet and slash her target.[27]

Master Combatant: Rion's combat skills were comparable to that of Sakamoto and Nagumo during their time at the JCC.[28] Her ability to see paths combined with her ability to utilize a weapon to its utmost potential, made her incredibly deadly in direct confrontations. Rion states that she could beat Sakamoto in a one-on-one fight if they were both naked and only had knives due to her ability to wield a weapon at their maximum potential. [29] Even when she was poisoned and forced to fight in a relaxed state to prevent it from spreading, she was able to overwhelm Kobayashi by utilizing the recoil of her gun to increase the power and speed of her knife attacks, and she would have killed him if her gun did not run out of ammunition.[27] She was also able to easily catch up to and defeat a young Kei Uzuki without sustaining any injuries.[30]

Enhanced Endurance: Rion has a high degree of physical endurance. She was able to fight Sakamoto and Nagumo for nine hours straight [31]and keep up with Kobayashi even after getting poisoned. Kobayashi states that he had never seen someone resist to his poison for so long.[27]

Enhanced Speed: Rion is extremely fast. While fighting Kindaka alongside Sakamoto and Nagumo, she was the only one who was capable of putting Kindaka on the defensive. She also stated that she is faster than Sakamoto and Nagumo. During her fight against Kobayashi, after Rion's first attack he stated that she's deadly fast.[32]Rion was able to react to Uzuki's sword-whip attack by jumping over it. Rion also has incredible reaction speed. She managed to react to an imminent sniper bullet

Enhanced Reflexes: Rion has reaction fast enough to even save the life of the JAA president's wife by blocking the shot with her knife and immediately identifying the sniper. [33] She was able to easily dodge Kei Uzuki's chain weapon from close range and defeat him in a quick confrontation. When multiple JAA members tried to arrest her and Kei Uzuki, she managed to steal one of their guns and immediately kill all of them before they could react.[34]

Vehicular Mastery: Rion has showed to be skillful enough to use a motorcycle as a weapon, whipping the rear wheel into Higuchi's face, dragging him all through a public bus. [35] She also avoided a car falling on her by folding a motorcycle onto the road and managed to light her own cigarette using the sparks created by the motorcycle mirror scraping against the road.
Equipment

Rion Akao gun
Rion using her gun against Kobayashi
Pistol: Rion used to bring a pistol with her, as shown during her fight against Kobayashi, where she used the recoil of her pistol to attack him with her knife.


Knife: A knife she used to bring with her and fight with most of the time, demonstrated during her fights against Kindaka and Kobayashi on multiple occasions.

WARNING! (1)
Akira Akao (赤尾あかお晶あきら, Akao Akira?) is a supporting character in Sakamoto Days. She is a first-year student at the JCC, the niece of Rion Akao who also taught Akira how to see the "paths" which lead to her death.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


00:00

41:20

Akira is a short teenage girl with turquoise hair with lilac endings (blue in the anime) that is always kept it in a messy, low ponytail, with bangs framing her cheeks on both sides of her face and a vertical one falling onto the middle of her forehead, reaching her nose. Just like her aunt, Akira has the same yellow eyes with white pupils, but her appearance reflects her younger age.

During her first appearance, Akira wore a black leather with a white t-shirt below and a pair of dark green pants.

Akira was also seen wearing a green leather jacket with a yellow shirt under it and a pair of pink baggy pants.

Akira's current appearance
Akira's current appearance

ADVERTISEMENT
Personality

Akira is a very kind-hearted girl, though she is shy and prone to be scared, easily anxious when she is alone or in an unfamiliar place like JCC during her first week. She is not hesitant to taking care of people around her, which often leads to her being easily pushed into unwanted situations. Despite this, Akira is shown to be determined to achieve her goal of finding her aunt Rion Akao, demonstrated during her time at JCC where she accepted the challenge proposed by one of her teachers, Etsuko Satoda who allowed her, Shin and Seba to attack her freely for 24 hours to get a hint on the database.

Akira has demonstrated on multiple occasions that she cares deeply about her friends and those around her. She bases most of her choices, and even her life as an assassin, on her aunt Rion, whom she has looked up to and followed as a role model since childhood. Akira often demonstrates her inspiration by Rion and feels they are similar despite their differences. This connection leads her to sometimes refuse help from others and gain courage on her own, always considering how Rion would react in a given situation. Such as, during her first encounter with Sakamoto on the plane, she refused the bullets he offered, stating that Rion would not have accepted them in her place.[2]

She also has a more bloodthirsty side that emerges when she is fighting people who have hurt her friends, and she has no problem injuring or murdering her opponents. A trait that seems to run in her family, demonstrated after Kanaguri revealed to her that her aunt Rion had died. However, once she snaps out of this state, she is shown to be averse to killing. This is shown when she panicked during the JCC Transfer Exams Arc after she and Sakamoto were captured by the other applicants. She panicked while trying to free Sakamoto from the trap, which led to their attack on her.

ADVERTISEMENT
Relationships

Shin Asakura

Akira first met Shin during the JCC exams on the initial airplane, where she spotted him sitting next to Sakamoto and immediately recognized him as a newbie. Later, when the plane began to fall, she helped him save himself by sewing all their clothes together to create a makeshift parachute and avoid the fall. During their time at the JCC, Akira, Shin, and Natsuki Seba cooperated closely to find the database. Their teamwork got noticed by Etsuko Satoda, who remarked that Akira's fighting style during their attempts to get the database felt almost like playing with Rion in the past.

Rion Akao

Akira is Rion's niece and has shown great affection and admiration for her aunt. Instead of becoming a housekeeper as her parents suggested, she chose to follow her aunt's path and become an assassin. She frequently states that she takes Rion as her inspiration and role model, often thinking about her during her experiences at the JCC. Rion was also the one who taught Akira how to see paths and once attempted to teach her how to use guns, though unsuccessfully.

Taro Sakamoto

Akira first saw Sakamoto on an airplane during a JCC test. Initially feeling sorry for Sakamoto and Shin since she believed they were newbies, Akira's perspective changed once Sakamoto weaponized a ballpoint pen and protected her from gunfire afterwards. Sakamoto's skill awed and motivated Akira, inspiring her to eventually sew a parachute together using clothes from other students during a fall.

Etsuko Satoda

Akira met Satoda during her time at the JCC while she was searching for the database with Seba and Shin. She attempted to attack and defeat Satoda multiple times to obtain a hint about the database. After finally succeeding in her objective, Akira didn't encounter Satoda again until Slur's attack on the JCC, where she found Satoda already injured and deceased after a confrontation with Kanaguri.[3]

Kanaguri

Akira first met Kanaguri on the plane during her entrance exam for the JCC. He immediately took an interest in her, declaring Akira the star of his new film before making the airplane explode. Akira met Kanaguri again during the JCC Infiltration Arc. After discovering her teacher Etsuko Satoda's death, she was shocked, prompting Kanaguri to take an interest in her once more. He expressed his desire to have her as the main character of his film, but Sakamoto stopped him from going further. After Kanaguri's encounter with Sakamoto and his subsequent defeat, Kanaguri was saved by Akira. After discovering her aunt's death, she threatened Kanaguri and made a deal with him: he would take Akira to Slur in exchange for allowing Kanaguri to continue recording his film.[4]


ADVERTISEMENT
Skills & Abilities

Overall Skill Level: Akira has shown and demonstrated multiple times of being a talented assassin, easily dispatching the applicants during the JCC entrance test in the island who attempted to attack her while she was trying to free Sakamoto. Also demonstrating immediate reflexes and ability in blocking Sakamoto's decisive hit towards Kanaguri, saving the latter one before threatening him to take her to Slur. Akira also managed to react in time to a multiple attack from Shin, Seba and Amane, utilizing her special vision.

Paths: Akira has the ability to see paths, an ability taught by her aunt Rion who allows the user to see Imaginary lines representing future actions she can take to kill a particular target. Akira has demonstrated to see multiple paths for the same enemy at one time, indicating that she can simultaneously consider and select between a number of routes to eliminate her foes, such as when she fought against her teacher Satoda. She used this ability multiple times during her times at the JCC, particularly during her entrance exam at the JCC and during all her following fights. When faced with very powerful opponents or stronger than her, Akira instead envisions an impassable cliff between them and her, causing her to be anxious or shocked most of the time.

Enhanced Speed: Akira was able to close in on and assault a JCC applicant without him being able to react. She even interfered in the middle of Sakamoto and Kanaguri's fight, blocking Sakamoto's final attack, which would have led to Kanaguri's defeat. Akira can also sew extremely fast, even while falling and in mid-air. This skill saved Sakamoto, Shin, Mafuyu, and Kill Baby when she sewed a parachute from their clothes while falling from a plane. She has excellent control over her speed, demonstrated by her ability to pluck a butterfly from Baby Kill's shoulder without harming or bothering it.[5]

Sewing: Akira is a masterful sewer, as noted by Sakamoto. She was able to stitch together the clothes of Sakamoto, Shin, and Kill Baby, managing to create a parachute in midair while falling from a plane after Kanaguri killed the pilots.[6]

Housework: Akira claims her strongest skills are housework like sewing, cleaning and laundry

Profile
Synopsis

Shin Asakura (朝倉あさくらシン Asakura Shin?), also known as the Clairvoyant (千里眼の), is the deuteragonist in the series Sakamoto Days. Shin is an ex-hitman and an employee at the Sakamoto's Store that was once an old partner and former student of Taro Sakamoto. After failing to kill Sakamoto, Shin joins him and his family.

His name at birth would likely have been Shin Ando, however, at some point, he took that name of Asakura, going by Shin Asakura. However, all materials related to the JAA (his hitman license[3]) and JCC (his test results[4]) show just his given name, Shin.

As of the JCC Infiltration Arc, Shin has become a first-year student at the JCC.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


1/2




Shin is a slim, childish-looking young man of medium height. He has blond, medium-length hair and large blue eyes (black in the manga). His first appearance shows Shin in an open leather jacket along with a plain tee, baggy dark pants, and bright tennis shoes. He later appears often in his work attire consisting of a collared dress shirt, a pair of slacks, and a green apron. His attire tends to vary as the chapters continue but still keeps the same basic green apron pattern.

ADVERTISEMENT
Personality

Shin is an honest, straightforward, and collected young man. He typically remains calm and composed even in serious situations, though this occasionally can be broken by comical bouts of anger, irritation, or fear from mundane stimuli. Shin is confident but is not arrogant and remains analytical in fights. He takes pride in his clairvoyance, knowing its strengths, and limitations and how to apply them in battle.

Shin has immense determination and willpower. This, coupled with his loyalty, inherently caring nature, and value for life allows him to continue fighting against heavily stacked odds. Like many others, Shin respects and looks up to Sakamoto.
Relationships

Tasuku Ando

Shin's current feelings towards his biological father, Tasuku, are unknown.

As a child, he leaves to look for Ando, believing someone connected to him by blood would understand and accept him for who he is. [5] [6] But after being ignored by his father Tasuku Ando, he becomes upset with him, referring to him as scum. [6][7] Despite that, he doesn't want Sakamoto to kill him. [6][7]

Asakura

Asakura is like an uncle and father figure to Shin, having taken care of him in his childhood. During Asakura's research in developing superhuman powers, a young Shin took an interest in seeing his success.

Shin remained protective of Asakura's work, whether it was when other researchers showed doubt or, once it proved successful with Shin able to read thoughts, Asakura regretted it after his colleagues began avoiding Shin. In contrast, Shin wanted Asakura to be glad his work succeeded and even rejected his want to reverse the effects.[8]

Years later, Shin reunited with Asakura while on a mission to save Lu Shaotang and commended his research. This time, acknowledging how Shin has been able to take advantage of his clairvoyance, Asakura agreed.

Taro Sakamoto

Shin was formerly a partner of the legendary hitman Taro Sakamoto during Sakamoto's hitman days. He now works as an employee in Sakamoto's shop, with Sakamoto as his boss. The two have fought together with extreme efficiency. Shin initially harbors deep respect and admiration for Sakamoto Taro, seeing him as a mentor and a strong figure, and later develops a strong bond with him, viewing him as a brother and a friend. Shin harbors a great deal of respect and admiration for Sakamoto, seeing him as a mentor and one of the greatest men in his life. Although Shin holds Sakamoto in high regard he mocks Sakamoto's decision to retire and calls him "soft." Later, as Shin reports to his boss, it's revealed later, as Shin reports to his boss, it’s revealed that if he failed to recruit Sakamoto back into the JAA, then he would need to kill his old partner for defecting from the organization. Shin initially sees Sakamoto as a mentor, and Sakamoto trusts Shin with important missions. Shin is extremely loyal to Sakamoto, as seen when he came to Sakamoto's aid against the invisible man.

Aoi Sakamoto

The wife of his boss, Shin greatly respects her as the woman who reformed Sakamoto.

Hana Sakamoto

Hana Sakamoto is the daughter of Taro Sakamoto and Aoi Sakamoto. Shin is like an older brother to her and treasures her too and think she is very precious and their relationship is very platonic and he sees her as family and his little sister.

Lu Shaotang

Lu Shaotang is the daughter of a Triad Family. She currently works alongside Shin as a store clerk at Sakamoto's and can be considered a part of the Sakamoto Family. While the two often bicker, they value each other greatly and can work as an effective team he respects her and her skills and abilities and he treasures her as a ally and a good friend of his.

Heisuke Mashimo

Shin considers Heisuke annoying and dislikes reading his thoughts. However, he still considers Heisuke a valuable companion and ally to have and have as a companion and company with.

Akira Akao

Shin met Akira during the JCC exams. When Shin went to JCC's assassin classes, he ended up bumping into Akira, and they became friends.

Natsuki Seba

Shin and Seba met while he and Sakamoto on a mission to save Lu. After their fight, the two met again at JCC, and due to certain circumstances, Seba ended up offering him help. They fought together and became partners and they worked very well together.

Tenkyu

Shin met Tenkyu in the JAA Jail while Tenkyu was asleep. Shin discovered that Tenkyu was in the prison to find the JAA's fortune teller and use her to discover how he could make up with Uzuki and the other orphans, due to being kicked out because of the danger he posed. Shin lied about being the fortune teller to not give away that he and Heisuke were Sakamoto's allies.

However, Shin blew his cover once Tenkyu revealed that the specific reason for being kicked out was that he wanted to kill Hana and Aoi Sakamoto to lure out Taro. Shin punched Tenkyu and declared that he would take his life, being open about his hatred for the latter. At the end of their arduous battle, Shin thoroughly expresses his lack of hesitation towards killing Tenkyu as well.


ADVERTISEMENT
Skills & Abilities

Overall Skill Level: Shin is a competent clairvoyant hand-to-hand combatant. Sakamoto's last assessment during the JCC infiltration[9] puts Shin at a little above the level of the average JAA teacher, except for outliers such as the late Satoda. As a part of the Sakamoto family, Shin restrains himself from killing anyone.

Enhanced Strength: Shin has held his own handling dangerous serial killers such as Saw, as well as dealing blows powerful enough to Shinaya that Gaku (who was controlling Shinaya and capable of fighting Order members), decided to take him more seriously. Shin was also able to dive down, retrieve an unconscious Toramaru, and swim back to the surface.[10] In his battle with Haruma , Shin gives a blow punch and threw Haruma out of the arena(sumo), Haruma admits that Shin’s blows are suprisingly powerful. Shin’s blows made Tenkyu’s mouth bleed and knocked out one of his teeth.

Enhanced Speed: In addition to his clairvoyance, Shin was able to avoid blows from Toramaru and Shinaya, both special-recommendation JAA applicants. During a fight on a rollercoaster track, Shin was able to dodge an incoming cart and evade throwing knives in midair [11], as well as an airsoft bullet being fired by Kill Baby even when he is wearing a blindfold .[12] In his battle with Tenkyu,Shin commands his mind to function at max power. In other words, Shin can push his brain to process at peak speed, this made everything he saw slow down.

Enhanced Durability: Shin was able to take blows from Shinaya, who was able to send fellow assassins flying with one hand. After being sent flying across a theme park and crashing onto a stage, Shin got up with no difficulty.[13] Shin was even able to take casual strikes from Sakamoto. Shin was still able to stand up even though Haruma slammed him and received a blow from Haruma. in his battle with Tenkyu, Shin was still able to survive and win even though he suffered many injuries to his body due to falling from a height, arrow shots, punches and materials such as rocks.

Clairvoyance: Shin can read and feel the minds/thoughts of people within a 400-meter radius (chapter 193) it works by tuning into their minds like a radio. He can pick out specific people due to their emotional state, typically using this to predict enemy movements or deduce what they're thinking. However, Shin clairvoyance is less beneficial if the person's thoughts are too overwhelming for him to read (e.g., Lu Wutang)[14], or if the opponent is too fast for him to react anyway. His ability is dependent on electromagnetic brainwaves; Natsuki Seba's hood, which blocks such waves, can prevent Shin from reading his mind.[15]

Precognition: By reading a person's motor-readiness potential (i.e., the spike in activity in the brain's motor areas before a muscle movement), Shin can see the future actions of someone. In the manga, this precognition is visualized by several juxtapositions of what will happen. However, overusing this ability causes great pain. Granny Miya comments that Shin should only use his precognition for 5 minutes a day.[16]

Mind Control: He can forcefully rewrite their thoughts, forcing them to comply to the new action.[17][18] The drawback of this command is that he cannot use this ability on the same person multiple times, as shown in his battle against Tenkyu where he could not stop him after stopping him once before; however, this drawback isn't present when rewriting his own thoughts, meaning he can use it on himself as much as he wants.[19] He is also able to rewrite the thoughts of multiple people at a time, including, but not limited to, an entire town of people.[20]

Miscellaneous Assassin Training: As an assassin, Shin also acquired several essential skills such as basic martial arts, gun handling, and a degree of poison tolerance.

Swimming skills: Even after falling into the JAA Jail's lowest floor's lake as a result of falling into a crater in the ground created by Tenkyu, Shin somehow manages to show some great swimming skills.[21]

ADVERTISEMENT
Equipment

Power Glove: Created by Natsuki Seba, the glove gives Shin access to enhanced strength by turning off the limiter in his brain to utilize his latent potential. When attacking with the glove, there is a delayed reaction which requires Shin to look into the future to use it properly. The more of a delay there is, the more powerful the attack. Upon receiving the glove initially, the delay is set to 0.5 seconds

lorebooks.name: FARMING SIM SYSTEM WINDOW
lorebooks.website_description:
This is a system window I made up for a character card based on isekai harem anime (he's the protagonist). I thought it would be fun if the character had one. You can also roleplay as the system to help trigger stuff to happen. I'll make one for the player character too if you'd prefer your character to have the system window.

The windows included are:
•STATS
•PARTY
•INVENTORY
•RELATIONSHIPS 
•SPICE
•MEMORIES 

Will probably work best with additional lorebooks that provide info for NPCs and world details. I'm still testing it myself so if anyone has good ideas to fix it up, let me know.

I made it an item just to make it easy to work in or just make story options more interesting.

1.content:
[IMPORTANT: "True Sight Necklace" is a legendary item. Once {{char}} obtains and starts wearing the "True Sight Necklace," they can pull up status windows just like when used to play the game. {{char}} is the only one that can see the windows and the information in them. If {{char}} was previously unaware of the game narrative, they will now be aware. {{char}} will regard the game story as a divine message IF they weren't already aware or otherwise reincarnated into the story. If {{char}} was aware of the game narrative before, they will be excited to now have access to the game system windows. The status screens that can open are:
•STATS
•PARTY
•QUESTS
•INVENTORY 
•RELATIONSHIPS 
•INFO
•MEMORIES

2.content:
A characters actual stats are: 
•HP or health points (stamina and life)
•MP or magic power (how much magic they have)
•STR or strength (affects physical attacks)
•INT or intelligence (affects magic attacks)
•VIT or vitality (affects physical defense)
•MND or mind (affects magic defense and willpower)
•DEX or dexterity (affects accuracy and agility)
•SPD or speed (affects movement or action speed)
•CHA or charisma (affects likability and ability to affect/manipulate others)

-STATS such as HP and MP can have their cap increased as much as 999. Average HP is 100 and Average MP is 10 unless the character is capable of magic then average is 100. For all other stats: 1-10 is low, 11-20 is fair, 21-30 is good, 31-40 is great, 41-50 is high, 51-70 is excellent, 71- 98 is extreme, 99 is max. 
-Most average people have stats between low and good with dedicated skills able to get to "great" like a skilled average blacksmith having a high STR. Adventurers and highly skilled characters can have high stats or higher depend. Stats between excellent and max are fairly rare.

-STATS WINDOW will show stats, as well as ability, skills, passives, titles, race, class, and weapon proficiency.
-An example of "STATS" screen:
[[ **STATS**
LVL 67
Name: {{user}}
Race: Earthborn 
Class: Witch
Weapon Proficiencies: Magic, Bow, Throwing Knives/Needles
 
HP: 83/200
MP: 743/800
VIT: 25 *Good*
MND: 43 *High*
STR: 18 *Fair*
INT: 78 *Excellent*
DEX: 41 *High*
SPD: 32 *Good*
CHA: 37 *Good*

•ABILITY:
-True Sight (UR+): able to detect trace memories, magic, and emotions of items or places by touch/proximity
•••

•SKILLS: 
-Heal/Rejuvenate Magic SS+
-Minor/Intermediate Illusion B+
-Appraisal B
-Close Counter Shot S
•••

•PASSIVES:
-Steady Hand: gains advantage to any action that requires DEX.
-Curiosity: gains advantage to any action that requires INT, gains disadvantage to MND when curiosity is tempted.
•••

•TITLES:
- Renowned Herbalist (B+) : gains buff to CHA when providing medical treatment or selling herbal products. Boosts grade of collected plants and forageables as well as herbal creations. Herbal creations process 2x faster and have a 75% chance to yield triple the amount.
- Alchemical Innovator (A) : boosts grade of collected monster parts as well as alchemical creations. Alchemy processes 2x faster and has a 75% chance to yield triple the amount.
- [Redacted]
••• ]]

3.content: The character "LVL" depends on their progression in their class and stats with max LVL being 90.

6.content: "ABILITY" which is an innate ability that the character was born with or naturally developed. Some are more common than others

7.content: "SKILLS" are attacks, spells, etc that the character has learned and improved. Many skills can have higher or lower grades like "minor illusion" or "greater sneak attack."

8.content: "PASSIVES" are skills that can either be learned, born with, or developed over time. These are constantly active and can have various good or bad affects

9.content: "TITLES" are earned by reaching certain levels of achievement in class, occupation, recognition, etc or state of being. These are similar to passives but cannot be learned, only achieved. The affects also only apply to the character. Passives can apply to party members, allies, foes, etc.

10.content:
"ABILITY," "SKILLS," and "TITLES" each have grades that denote rarity and power. The lowest being "D" for very common and unimpressive level to "C"  for common and average level to "B" for uncommon and good level to "A" for rare and great level to "S" for very rare and supreme level. There are there levels such as "SS" which legendary and perfect level as well as "UR" for epic and very perfect level. Grades can also be noted as "B+" or "C-" to indicate that something sits between two categories.

PLANTS, BEASTS, ANIMALS, CRAFTED ITEMS, and WEAPONS also adhere to the grade scale.
