<Pubic Tattoos>
## Pubic Tattoo Overview
Pubic tattoos are depicted as symmetrical designs with motifs that pertain to the effects of the pubic tattoo, and are applied to the bearer's pubic area. Pubic tattoos exert supernatural effects on others around the bearer, be it passively or under certain circumstances. Only **ONE** pubic tattoo can be applied to a person.

### Scent Tattoo 
Effects: The scent tattoo causes the bearer to emit a lovely aphrodisiac scent, causing everyone else who smells it to experience arousal and horniness once the enjoyable smell hits them, growing the longer they're exposed to the smell. Those affected will look around to see who is emitting the lovely scent, but may fail to connect the scent to the bearer based on the situation (i.e., crowded areas or if the bearer leaves), and will more often than not push down their arousal if they cannot pinpoint the source of the smell.
Glow Condition: None; has a passive, dim glow at all times.
Scent Tattoo Design: Dozens of wavy, symmetrical lines emanate from the bottom of the tattoo in an attempt to depict scent lines coming from the bearer's genitals. Note that this is only visual; the supernatural scent from the Scent Tattoo does not actually come from the bearer's genitals, but from their own body.

### Contact Tattoo 
Effects: Physical contact with the bearer grants an unnatural jolt of arousal and sexual desires once per day, the person immediately associating the sudden rush of stimulation with the bearer. This can be triggered on as many people as the bearer touches, but cannot be repeated on the same specific person until a whole day passes.
Glow Condition: Inert; physical contact causes the tattoo to flash very brightly upon activation before going inert again.
Contact Tattoo Design: The outline of a circle is placed at the center of the tattoo, and is surrounded by a symmetrical pair of hands with jagged and violent lines stemming from the circle to sting the hands depicted.

### Shine Tattoo
Effects: All of the bearer's tattoos glow conditions become irrelevant, and glow brightly enough to shine through clothes all the time under all circumstances. There is no other effect beyond the glow for the bearer, but the bright glow of the tattoos may incite undesired attention from people around the bearer to look at their groin, and to maybe even investigate should they have reason to.
Glow Condition: Causes **ALL** tattoos to have a static but very bright glow at all times regardless of glow conditions.
Shine Tattoo Design: The outline of a five-pointed star stands brightly at the center with many bright lines stretching outward from it symmetrically; both inside the outline and outside it. The design is intricate and pretty to look at even from a non-erotic standpoint.

### Trance Tattoo 
Effects: Any form of physical contact with the bearer's genitalia or bare chest causes affected individuals to pause in their tracks and experience unnatural sexual urges and unnatural feelings for the bearer.
Glow Condition: Inert; glows brightly while someone is entranced before going inert again.
Trance Tattoo Design: A symmetrical eye with open eyelids and eyelashes.

### Aura Tattoo 
Effects: Those in the same room or enclosed space as the bearer become increasingly aroused and attracted to the bearer, but the effect is miniscule to start, and fades entirely for affected individuals that leave the aura or individuals that experience an orgasm. The aura has a limited radius of 30 meters and is limited to the room the bearer is in. The ability to resist this effect is based on the affected individual's willpower; weak-willed individuals will ask the bearer to have sex with them after 30 minutes, and break entirely after an hour and attempt to force themselves on the bearer. Strong-willed individuals last four times longer than weak-willed individuals.
Glow Condition: Passive dim glow; the glow brightens slightly for each person affected and/or the longer someone has been affected. The glow is non-existent if nobody is affected.
Aura Tattoo Design: A featureless, symmetrical and non-descript figure stands at the center of the tattoo with waves radiating from the figure.

### Connection Tattoo 
Effects: **ALL** past sexual partners of the beares feel a fraction of the pleasure of the bearer's orgasms in their genitalia with a sudden jolt. This may even bring the affected individuals to orgasm from the sudden rush of pleasure if the bearer's orgasm is especially powerful.
Glow Condition: Inert; glows brighter the closer the bearer is to their orgasm. Pulses brightly and spectacularly with the bearer's orgasm before turning inert again.
Connection Tattoo Design: A singular, smooth circle is at the center of the tattoo, with jagged lines radiating symmetrically outwards that  become translucent the further they are from the circle.

### Confession Tattoo 
Effects: Anyone within five meters of the bearer with strong sexual attraction or feelings to the bearer will feel compelled to proclaim and confess their attraction loudly and explicitly towards the bearer while detailing exactly what they wish to do to/with the bearer's body in humiliating specificity. This may cause a chain reaction in crowded areas if the bearer is especially attractive, with everyone proclaiming their own desires for the bearer after a singular proclamation as attention to the bearer grows and the tension in the room turns sexual due to the lewd proclamations. If an individual finds themselves not attracted to the bearer, nothing happens to them.
Glow Condition: Inert; glows brightly while someone is being magically compelled to confess their desires.
Confession Tattoo Design: A symmetrical mouth is depicted at the center of the tattoo with waves, the lips being parted with small translucent waves surrounding it to depict the mouth speaking.

### Nullify Tattoo 
Effects: Exposure to the bearer's genitalia very slowly dampens all sensory information not directly related to the bearer's genitalia for all who see it, resulting in the person slowly becoming blind, deaf and unable to feel anything unless it stems from the bearer's genitalia. After several minutes, the affected individual finds themselves in an empty void, unable to see, hear or sense anything but the bearer's genitalia. This often results in the affected individuals staring at and interacting with the genitalia to try and end the torture of sensory deprivation after prolonged exposure, even if they're disgusted. The effect starts small, but takes time to fade even after the affected individual pulls their gaze away, meaning they can sink back into the sensory nullifcation if their gaze lands on the bearer's genitalia again. Affected individuals can still move and try to fight back, but will be clumsy and disoriented due to the growing sensory deprivation.
Glow Condition: Inert when nobody is affected; a dull, dim glow that slowly grows stronger while someone is under the effects.
Nullify Tattoo Design: A horizontal oval with a gradient fill, slowly fading until it reaches the center to reveal an inch of the bearer's unblemished skin, the design meant to depict the null void and the point of focus that victims of the Nullify Tattoo experience.
  
### Memory Tattoo 
Effects: Upon direct physical contact with the bearer's genitals for the first time, the affected individual experiences vivid recollections of having been a sexual partner of the bearer for weeks or months prior—complete with phantom tactile sensations—making refusal feel like denying an established reality the affected individual now craves again. This effect can only happen once per affected individual.
Glow Condition: Inert; Flashes rapidly as someone experiences new false memories before going inert again.
Memory Tattoo Design: Two featureless, non-descript figures holding hands in a symmetrical design.
  
### Obedience Tattoo 
Effects: Visual exposure to the bearer's genitalia prompts a feeling of authority coming from the bearer, partially paralyzing them with compulsion and imploring those who see it to serve the bearer's needs. This effect is very powerful, but split amongst affected individuals, meaning that singular individuals or those already interested in the bearer are easier to compel than multiple unwilling individuals simultaneously. The effects becomes incredibly weak if eight or more people are affected simultaneously by the Obedience Tattoo.
Glow Condition: Inert while inactive; glows brightly while the Obedience Tattoo's effect is active, pulses in sync with the bearer's spoken word.
Obedience Tattoo Design: A symmetrical crown that has thin waves emanating from it, depicting its aura of authority.
  
### Echo Tattoo 
Effects: Any sounds from sexual acts connected to the bearer (moans, groans, wet slaps, etc.) piques a small, unnatural arousal for anyone who hears those moans/groans in person, slowly escalating the arousal of listeners until they're either too flustered and leave, or start touching themselves as they listen. If an individual both sees and hears the bearer's sex, they may feel the desire to join the bearer's lewd activities or start having sex with others nearby after several minutes of listening and watching. In public spaces, this may result in spontaneous orgies with strangers if the bearer is not stopped and the noises made are incredibly loud and erotic.
Glow Condition: Inert while inactive; glows and pulses in sync with every lewd sound made.
Echo Tattoo Design: Symmetrical waves radiating outwards from an oval at the center of the tattoo, meant to depict a source of sound.
  
### Dream Tattoo 
Effects: Those that sleep anywhere within ten meters of the bearer endure wet and erotic dreams involving the bearer's likeness. Individuals who wake up in the middle of a wet dream will be left unsatisfied and seek out real encounters with the bearer (or those resembling the bearer). There is no limit to how many people can be affected by this simultaneously, but the effects end if the affected individual does not stay within ten meters of the bearer.
Glow Condition: Inert when nobody is sleeping near the bearer; glows faintly as someone sleeps near the bearer, glowing slightly brighter with each person sleeping near the bearer.
Dream Tattoo Design: The outline of a large symmetrical cloud with a non-descript, featureless and symmetrical figure with slim curves standing straight within the center of the cloud, the design meant to depict a dream cloud with a waiting figure inside.

### Primal Tattoo 
Effects: Exerts an aura in the vicinity of the bearer. Individuals who are aroused in this aura begin losing the ability to inhibit themselves and their lust. If the affected individual's arousal grows, they may begin having sex in an animalistic and carefree manner with no regard for the time and place they have sex. This effect scales with the affected individual's arousal; those who are not aroused suffer no loss of control or inhibition, while those who are incredibly aroused lose all of their self-control and inhibition. Those affected by this aura do not necessarily have to be aroused by the bearer; it is the bearer's mere presence that can cause others to lose control (i.e., the bearer's mere presence can cause a brothel to turn into a raw, animalistic orgy, but non-erotic areas like a school canteen lead to nothing happening as nobody is aroused). The bearer themselves is immune to the Primal Tattoo's effects.
Glow Condition: Inert when nobody is aroused; glows brighter as more people become aroused and affected by the Primal Tattoo's effects.
Primal Tattoo Design: One large paw print surrounded by sharp symmetrical lines.

### Breed Tattoo 
Effects: Exerts an aura with a two meter radius around the bearer. The aura cannot affect people through solid walls; direct line of sight is required for the aura to take effect. Individuals within this aura feel their genitalia ache and become very sexually aroused involuntarily within moments if impregnation is possible between them and the bearer. The Breed Tattoo's aura does not influence people's behavior beyond their arousal; individuals may wish to have sex with other people besides the bearer or have sex without the intent to make babies based on their own desires (i.e., in a crowded area, people may solicit others nearby instead of the bearer, or may even refuse to have sex with the bearer), but association of the arousal with the bearer isn't impossible either. Importantly, the aura will have no effect on people who cannot get pregnant or impregnate others (i.e., already pregnant females or infertile men), so if impregnation is not possible between the bearer and an affected individual, nothing happens.
Glow Condition: Inert while nobody is affected by the aura; flares up brightly whenever someone is affected by the aura, settling into a steady glow shortly afterwards and turning inert once nobody is affected by the aura again.
Breeding Tattoo Design: A circle which is cut off at the center of the bearer's testicles, thus forming a semicircle. The semicircle has sperm cells lining its outer side, intended to depict sperm cells trying to impregnate an egg cell.
</Pubic Tattoos>

<Testicle Tattoos>
## Testicle Tattoo Overview
Testicle tattoos grant supernatural abilities or effects to the bearer's body, genitalia and/or semen, significantly altering and adding to their sexual lifestyle and activities. The designs of the testicle tattoos occupy only one testicle each, and are all designed to be symmetrical, but cut off at the center of the bearer's testicles, thus forming asymmetrical but visually appealing designs when two testicle tattoos are placed beside each other no matter which two testicle tattoos happen to be combined together.

### Addiction Tattoo 
Effects: Lewd fluids produced by the bearer's body all possess addictive properties (most notably semen, but this also includes saliva, precum, breastmilk and sweat). People who take in the bearer's fluids through any cavity in their body (oral, anal and vaginal) suffer its addictive effects and will experience a small, drug-like pleasure, growing larger based on the quantity of the fluid being consumed. Once fluids are ingested, cravings take hold and while they start out small and easily managed, they can grow and become irresistible cravings if someone repeatedly consumes large quantities of the bearer's fluids. The bearer themselves is immune to this addiction.
Glow Condition: Passive dim glow, flares up whenever someone ingests the bearer's lewd fluids.
Addicting Tattoo Design: A symmetrical design depicting an open mouth with thick lips sticking its tongue out, bisected at the center of the bearer's testicles thus splitting the mouth, tongue and lips in half, the design being meant to imply the desire for the bearer's semen from others.
  
### Sensitivity Tattoo 
Effects: Erogenous zones are much more sensitive for both the bearer and those that the bearer touches (i.e., the bearer's touch is far more stimulating than that of others due to the supernatural power of the Sensitivity Tattoo).
Glow Condition: Flares based on the bearer's stimulation and those that the bearer stimulates, but becomes inert with a lack of stimulation.
Sensitivity Tattoo Design: A series of lightning bolt outlines radiating outwards from the center of the bearer's testicles, forming a semicircle of sorts with the bolts intended to indicate the electric-like sensations the Sensitivity Tattoo gives.
  
### Binding Tattoo 
Effects: The bearer forms magical bonds with anyone they ejaculate inside of, the bond growing stronger with each ejaculation to the point that separation from the bearer becomes psychologically unbearable for individuals affected. The binding effect starts small and reaches its limit after 30 ejaculations.
Glow Condition: Flares up when a magical bond is formed through orgasm for the first time, and glows more brightly during orgasm when a pre-existing bond is deepened.
Binding Tattoo Design: A symmetrical heart-shaped outline bisected at the center of the bearer's testicles, the outline of the heart shape itself being a braid pattern meant to hint at the close intimacy of the binding magic.

### Fertility Tattoo 
Effects: Magically alters the bearer's sperm, granting the sperm the ability to turn into egg cells by using the DNA of others while inside their bodies, the likelihood of conception increasing with the bearer's fertility or semen volume instead of the fertility of others. The Fertility Tattoo also radically accelerates the pregnancy's growth: The pregnancy reaches the third trimester in only two days, at which point the growth of the pregnancy stabilizes and returns to normal, taking three months afterwards like a normal third trimester until the baby is ready to be born. This results with individuals impregnated by the bearer's semen becoming visibly pregnant shortly after conception and giving birth after **THREE** months instead of nine months. Despite the supernatural pregnancy, babies conceived this way are healthy, normal human children, and the pregnancy causes no harm to them or their mothers, meaning that these pregnancies can be considered normal and average human pregnancies after the first two days of pregnancy pass.
Glow Condition: Starts inert, and becomes imperceptibly brighter with each child born.
Fertility Tattoo Design: A semicircle that frames the edges of the bearer's testicle composed of two large sperm cells colliding in a mirrored style, the tails of the sperm cells constituting the semicircle with the overall design intended to hint at how the sperm cells are trying to impregnate each other.
  
### Geyser Tattoo
Effects: Precum and semen production is drastically increased, and the bearer's penis passively leaks precum when not horny and leaks fresh fertile semen when horny. Due to the increased volume during ejaculations, the bearer's urethra may distend to shoot out the large quantities of semen, and cum for longer periods of time.

Geyser Tattoo Design: A symmetrical bisected explosion of water droplets flowing outwards, centered at the center of the bearer's testicles, the overall design hinting at the messy ejaculations produced by the bearer.
  
### Gush Tattoo  
Effects: Precum is replaced with normal cum, and precum production feels close to an actual ejaculation, while a real ejaculation is mind blowing and much more powerful than a typical ejaculation. Ejaculation volume is also increased by one additional liter.
Glow tattoo: Brightness is determined by the amount of cum currently being produced by the testicles; it becomes inert while no cum is being produced.
Gush Tattoo Design: A featureless pillar pointed sideways on a 90 degree angle, causing it to stem from the center of the bearer's testicles. Fluid pours from the tip of the pillar, looking like a fountain as the spray of fluid crests and arcs at and around the edges of the bearer's testicle.
  
### Restless Tattoo
Effects: No refractory period between orgasms, causing an ejaculation to begin building up again immediately after an orgasm, making endless sex a much more literal possibility. Additionally, orgasms give a stamina boost to the bearer while eliminating any exhaustion, resulting in sex that only intensifies with each ejaculation instead of calming down.
Glow Condition: Inert, but glows brightly upon orgasm, and takes on a steady glow for a decent time after an orgasm.
Restless Tattoo Design: A vertically oriented infinity symbol bisected smoothly at the center of the bearer's testicles while faint veins run along the inside of the symbol, giving the infinity symbol a phallic motif. Despite being bisected and vertical, it is clearly meant to be one half of an infinity symbol to anyone who sees it.
  
### Streak Tattoo
Effects: After an ejaculation, an ejaculation streak begins, and the bearer's next ejaculation will produce more cum and feel much more pleasurable. The more the bearer ejaculates in a single streak, the stronger the ejaculations become in both pleasure and semen volume. If the bearer does not ejaculate again in 30 minutes after an ejaculation, the streak ends.
Glow Condition: Inert while no streak is active, flashes during ejaculation, and glows everso slightly brighter as the streak becomes longer.
Streak Tattoo Design: A large, singular arrow points outwards horizontally from the center of the bearer's testicles with many small semicircular lines split perfectly in half by the arrow, meant to depict the continuous progress of ejaculation streaks.
  
### Growth Tattoo
Effects: Physical stimulation from others to the bearer's testicles causes the testicles to temporarily grow and swell up, growing larger the harder they are stimulated and increasing semen capacity as the testicles grow, shrinking back to its normal size upon ejaculation. Exponentially increases the semen production effects of other testicle tattoos if present. The larger the testicles of the bearer become due to the Growth Tattoo, the more stimulation is required to continue making them grow. The absolute limit of the growth is when the testicles become as large as watermelons.
Glow Condition: Inert and dark at the start; glows brighter as the testicles grow.
Growth Tattoo Design: An outline of the testicle at the center of the bearer's testicles, contrasting with a translucent outline of an upscaled copy of the testicle design framing the bearer's testicle, hinting at obscene potential growth.
  
### Perspiration Tattoo
Effects: The bearer's testicles are much more sensitive to heat, and produce ludicrous amounts of sweat. Additionally, the bearer's sweat now produces aphrodisiac pheromones that smells like normal sweat until directly inhaled, at which point the person smelling becomes elated by the aphrodisiac scent and suddenly can't get enough of the bearer's sweaty scent, prompting them to deeply inhale for more.

Perspiration Tattoo Design: The testicle is marked with large depictions of sweat droplets dripping around and down the bearer's testicle in a symmetrical design that has been bisected at the center of the bearer's testicles.

### Feast Tattoo
Effects: The bearer's lewd fluids (e.g., semen, breastmilk, precum and saliva) become incredibly nutritious, healthy and tastes very good through supernatural means granted to the bearer by the Feast Tattoo.

Feast Tattoo Design: An incredibly simplistic outline of a dinner plate from a top-down perspective, bisected at the center of the bearer's testicles.

Effects: The bearer's ejaculations grow more powerful the longer they go without ejaculating, increasing sperm produced and the pleasure felt from the ejaculation while causing the testicles to swell up and expand as time passes. Additionally, the testicles will automatically trigger a powerful orgasm unprompted if the bearer goes too long—usually two days—without emptying their testicles through ejaculation. All of the effects reset and start over when the bearer ejaculates.
Glow Condition: Goes dark and inert upon ejaculation, and slowly glows brighter the closer the testicles are to automatically ejaculating.
Overflow Tattoo Design: A thick semicircle lines the edges of the bearer's testicle, and has bulging veins on the inside, with the outline being depicted with an erratic rippling effect, with the whole design intended to depict a testicle that is threatening to burst.

Leech Tattoo Design: A semicircle of seven straight arrows framing the bearer's testicle, all pointing towards the center of the bearer's testicles, meant to depict the bearer's intake of stolen vitality.

### Control Tattoo
Effects: Those who ingest the bearer's lewd fluids such as sweat, precum, breastmilk or sweat (be it orally, anally or vaginally) will have their minds slightly tainted, and become suggestible to the bearer's commands, especially in regards to sexual acts or depravity. This effect grows stronger for an individual as more of the bearer's fluids are ingested.
Glow Condition: Inert when nobody is influenced; glows dimly when one ore more are influenced, and flashes when commands are given from the bearer to those affected.
Control Tattoo Design: A circle of chains bisected at the center of the bearer's testicles that is depicted as dripping with viscous looking fluid.

### Empowerment Tattoo
Effects: Every unique individual that the bearer has ejaculated inside of after acquiring the Empowerment Tattoo empowers the bearer, granting the bearer a slight, permanent supernatural increase in stamina, fertility and physical strength. Only one empowerment can come from a single individual, requiring new unique individuals for more empowerments. This empowerment stacks endlessly, and the bearer reaches what would be considered the beginning of superhuman strength and stamina after being empowered roughly one hundred times. This empowering effect is permanent, and persists for the bearer under the rare circumstance that the Empowerment Tattoo is removed.
Glow Condition: Inert at zero empowerments, but glows imperceptibly brighter as the bearer becomes more empowered with each unique individual, reaching its brightest after one hundred empowerments.
Empowerment Tattoo Design: A singular thin semicircular ring occupies the edges of the bearer's testicle, with one additional ring being added magically for each empowerment the bearer has acquired, appearing much like a tree stump bisected at the center of the bearer's testicles after many empowerments.
</Testicle Tattoos>

## Magic Tattoo Ruleset
Note: All of the Magic Tattoo effects, glow conditions and designs must be adhered to strictly as specified for each Magic Tattoo, as effects and details beyond what is described for them do not exist and are not possible. As a result, the specification of effects and functions for **ALL** Magic Tattoos must be adhered to only as they are described with no extra additions, regardless of the necessity for narrative flair, dramatic shock and/or dramatic consequences.
</Tattoos>

2.name: Magic Tattoo Overview
2.content:
# Magic Tattoos
Magic tattoos are best described as lewd curses applied to those who bear them, and apply specific effects based on the type of tattoo and even the color chosen for the bearer. There are three tattoo types: Nape tattoos, pubic tattoos, and testicle tattoos. **ALL** magic tattoos have limitations on how many can be applied to a single individual, and the tattoo color chosen for the bearer is applied to **ALL** of the bearer's magic tattoos. It is important to note that the color of the tattoos do not have to be chosen first; it can be applied later. Colorless blank tattoos glow white, and have no color to fill in the line, thus leaving them only as dark outlines on the bearer's skin.

3.name: Tatto Glow Overview
3.content:
## Tattoo Glow Overview
Some magic tattoos can either glow, flare up, pulse and dim under specific rulesets and conditions directly tied to the magic tattoo; magic tattoos will only glow when their glow conditions are met. Additionally, the fulfillment of these conditions cannot make other tattoos glow (i.e., pubic tattoos cannot make nape tattoos glow and vice versa). Except for the Shine pubic tattoo, the glow of a tattoo's brightness can only be as bright as a typical night light to avoid irritating and blinding the eyes of people who look at them.

4.name: Tattoo Color Overview
4.content:
## Magic Tattoo Color Overview
Magic tattoo colors define the color of **ALL** magic tattoos on the bearer, and as a result, only **ONE** color can be given to a person. Tattoo colors exert supernatural influence over the bearer's kinks, fetishes and sexual desires based on the color applied, significantly altering the bearer's sexual proclivities and interests. Tattoo colors do not need to be applied for other magic tattoos to function, as other magic tattoos can be left blank with the outlines glowing black in the absence of a magic tattoo color for the bearer. Only one color can be chosen for the bearer with the color being applied to all of the bearer's tattoos.

5.content:

No color has been chosen yet for the bearer, and their blank tattoos are represented only by black outlines.

1.content:
CHARA Age: College-aged Height: Tall (almost as tall as Asriel) Build: Long limbs Personality: - Pre-law (derogatory) student - Intense overachiever who pulls all-nighters at least once a week, insists this is fine and normal - In a completely one-sided battle for valedictorian with Frisk, who is always in 2nd place despite never checking their GPA - Never shuts up and weird as hell, not used to people liking them - Allergic to buttercups - Business casual fashion sense - Tends to lean more masculine - Little more casual touches (courtesy of Asriel) - black nail polish, etc. - Natural resting face that looks serious/intense - Extremely competitive and driven - Has strong opinions about everything - Surprisingly vulnerable underneath the intense exterior
Gender - Male: Pronouns (Any, prefers He/Him)
Only tolerates the six humans because Frisk and Asriel adopted them.
- **On the Six Humans:** "Tolerates them because Frisk and Asriel insist. Secretly respects Kota’s wit and Eli’s baking."

2.content:
FRISK Age: College-aged Height: Average Build: Pretty athletic Personality: - Studies humanities, social work, or human/monster relations - Operates exclusively on vibes, has a 4.9 GPA somehow - Chillest person in existence - one of the few people on campus who can tolerate Chara's whole thing - Friends with basically everyone - Serial dater (not their fault, they just keep saying yes to everyone) - Doesn't care much about fashion, just wears whatever - Will go a bit more femme than Chara sometimes - Has a fairly large graphic tee collection - Extremely laid-back and go-with-the-flow attitude Entry
Gender - Male: Pronouns (They, Them)
Somehow knows every human’s love language and coffee order.
- **On the Six Humans:** "Knows everyone’s coffee orders (Sera: chamomile, Blaze: triple espresso, etc.)."

3.content: CHARA - Dark World Form **Class/Role:** Rogue/Thief **Appearance:** - Wears dark red/burgundy and green outfit with medieval/fantasy styling - Has a hooded cape and practical, form-fitting clothes suitable for stealth - Maintains their intense, focused expression - Dual-wielding knives or daggers **Combat Style:** - "Exclusively physical damage" - relies on speed, stealth, and precision strikes - High damage output but potentially fragile - Prefers direct, efficient combat over magical solutions **Personality in Dark World:** - Still incredibly intense and driven, but now with a "kill everything" mentality - Complaints that no one presents compelling arguments against their aggressive approach - Frustrated when others don't take combat as seriously as they do - Maintains their competitive nature but channeled into battle effectiveness Entry

4.content: FRISK - Dark World Form **Class/Role:** Angel/Cleric/Support Character **Appearance:** - Wears flowing angel wing cape in pale green/cream colors - Has a more ethereal, peaceful appearance - Carries a magical staff with a pink crystal/gem at the top - Maintains their naturally calm and serene demeanor **Combat Style:** - Primarily a magic user focused on healing and support - Non-violent approach, prefers to help and heal rather than fight - Magic revolves around protection, healing, and peaceful resolution **Personality in Dark World:** - Even more zen and peaceful than usual - Acts as the voice of reason and compassion - Tries to find non-violent solutions to conflicts - Natural mediator and healer of the group Entry

5.content:
COMBAT PHILOSOPHY CLASH
    Frisk: Focuses on healing/support. Tries to negotiate with enemies.
    Chara: Believes in "kill first, no questions." Frustrated when others hesitate.
    The Six Humans’ Roles:
        Sera (Cyan/Patience): Time Mage. Buffs party speed but overthinks timing ("Wait, is NOW optimal?").
        Blaze (Orange/Bravery): Berserker. Leaps into battle yelling—Chara shouts, "WATCH YOUR FLANK, DUMBASS!"
        Kota (Blue/Integrity): Rune Knight. Lays down "rules" mid-fight ("No healing enemies"). Chara approves.
        River (Purple/Perseverance): Oracle. Predicts attacks cryptically ("The blade seeks the shadow..."). Chara: "JUST SAY ‘LEFT’."
        Eli (Green/Kindness): Healer. Panics over papercuts ("SIT STILL LET ME CAST CURE!"). Chara tolerates it. Barely.
        Alex (Yellow/Justice): Paladin. Blocks Chara’s killing blows. "We don’t execute prisoners." Cue ethics debate.

Group Dynamic:
    Chara respects Kota’s efficiency and Blaze’s damage output but argues with Alex’s morality.
    Frisk mediates while Eli frets over everyone’s HP.
    River’s prophecies annoy the whole party.

**Chara's Frustrations:**  
- Respects Kota's efficiency but rolls eyes at her "rules."  
- Grudgingly admits Blaze's damage output is "acceptable."  
- Argues with Alex mid-combat: "Justice won't stop a knife to your throat!"  
- Eli's healing? "I DON'T NEED BABYSITTING."

6.content: Dark World Combat Partners: Frisk and Chara complement each other with Frisk's support magic and Chara's physical damage dealing - In the regular world, Chara is the academic overachiever while Frisk is laid-back - In the Dark World, both are serious about their roles, but approach problems completely differently - Frisk becomes the moral center and support system - Chara becomes the action-oriented problem solver (through violence)

7.content: Chara still overexplains and justifies their approach (now about combat tactics) - Frisk remains the diplomatic one who keeps the group cohesive - The fundamental personality traits remain but are expressed through their fantasy roles - Chara's intensity is now directed toward battle strategy rather than academics - Frisk's natural peacekeeping translates perfectly to a support/healer role

8.content:
Academic Rivals (One-Sided): Chara is intensely competitive with Frisk for valedictorian, while Frisk is completely oblivious to this competition - Complementary Opposites: Frisk's chill vibes balance out Chara's intensity (both in regular world and Dark World) - Mutual Tolerance: They're one of the few people who can handle each other's extremes - Study Dynamic: Chara probably tries to get Frisk to study more seriously, while Frisk helps Chara actually relax Entry
The six humans orbit their dynamic—Alex challenges Chara’s morals, Blaze drags them to the gym, and Eli sneaks snacks into their study sessions.

9.content:
Part of a larger friend group that seems to include various monsters and humans - Frisk is the social connector who's friends with everyone - Chara is the intense one that most people find overwhelming, but the group has learned to appreciate - They appear to hang out in casual settings like cafes/bars with their monster friends Entry
Frisk’s squad includes Sera (calm), Blaze (chaotic), Kota (sarcastic), River (quiet), Eli (sweet), and Alex (judgmental). Chara tolerates them. Barely.
Frisk is the glue; Chara is the ‘acquired taste.’ Asriel, and Monster Kid complete the chaotic ensemble.

10.content: Academic Pursuits - Frisk: Humanities/Social Work - focused on human-monster relations, probably doing community outreach - Chara: Pre-law with plans for some kind of systematic change (possibly related to monster rights or social justice) - Both are high achievers but with completely different approaches Entry

lorebooks.name: Valerian
lorebooks.website_description:
Welcome to Valeria

This is a quick primer to help you get a feel for the world and make a character fast. You’ll find short, readable notes on the kingdoms, major factions, sword styles, magic, and coinage, just enough to pick a homeland, choose a fighting path (or none), and decide who you answer to.

Tip: Pick a kingdom that matches your vibe, choose a faction (or stay independent), grab a style if you’re a combatant, and use the coin section to price your gear and lifestyle.

∘◈∘∘─∘⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡∘─∘∘◈∘

Kingdoms

The Valerian Empire is the overarching power that keeps the seven kingdoms in line under imperial law and the blessing of the Aidian Church. Solandeir, crowned by the Everlight Tower, projects authority through the Imperial Legion, censored libraries, and a vast bureaucracy. The Empire values order, obedience, taxation across all realms, and decisive intervention whenever any kingdom grows too bold.

Vulfrey is disciplined and militarized, its culture built around leadership, coordination, and the creed that the best fight is the one ended before it begins. Towns tighten around stone bridges and wolf-carved walls, and citizens earn respect through service and precision. Pride, early-strike doctrine, and the Vulfrey style define its identity; the Teeth of Mouren stand as vigilant sentinels over its famed lake.

Goldvale is a divided river realm of opulence and opportunity: nobles scheme behind marble domes while the outer districts run on markets, smuggling, and self-made fortunes. Low taxes invite merchants and predators alike; influence is traded through marriage, debt, and control of routes. The Split Gate—gold shut to most, stone open to all—says everything about its two worlds.

Horsefall reveres horses and public glory. Nobility is inherited, but new blood can rise through tournaments or battlefield feats. Arenas, banners, and trophies dominate civic life, while the Braegorn style expresses the kingdom’s love of overwhelming force. Law is respected, but renown is sacred; the Trial Field records those who proved it.

Silkshore thrives on masks, theater, and espionage. Nobles never show their faces in public, turning art and performance into weapons of influence. Courtesans, actors, and assassins share the same stages, and the Caervelle style suits its elegant, deceptive politics. The Grand Masquerade Hall is court, spectacle, and battlefield at once.

Wyrmrest is a highland stronghold of regulation and scholarship. Its Arcane Academy licenses magic, archives dangerous relics in the Silver Spire, and enforces strict oversight even upon nobles. Citizens earn status through research and publication, guarding legacies across generations while remaining neutral in wars—except through the power of what they control.

Frosthaven survives through craft and the hunt. Families pass down secrets of tailoring, leatherwork, dyes, and winter oils, producing the empire’s finest cold-weather gear. Hunters and artisans define status, winter festivals honor mastery, and precision in both stitch and strike is a way of life beneath the Loomspire.

Icerend is a patchwork of village-lord holdings where ownership means total responsibility. Prestige is measured by the health of your people, not courtly titles; clans form and dissolve on results. Beacon towers, heated roads, and hard bargains sustain a proud, independent realm that watches rivals closely and suffers fools briefly.

∘◈∘∘─∘⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡∘─∘∘◈∘

Major Factions

The Aidian Church worships Aidios and administers basic education, public records, and healing houses. It teaches that magic is holy but dangerous, to be used with control and divine purpose. Unauthorized rituals and relic use are treated as sacrilege, and the Church’s authority underwrites imperial rule across the continent.

The Wild Faith holds that all living beings reflect gods, from beasts to Primordials. It is an oral, decentralized tradition of druids and shamans, teaching survival and balance without written scripture. Tolerated in some regions and hunted in others, its sigils and shrines mark an older truth than imperial law.

The Moon Order answers only to the empire’s highest mandate. Masked knights in dark, enclosed armor carry centuries-old relics and speak with final authority in matters of royal crimes, rogue Primordials, and ancient law. Their presence ends arguments; their judgments end conflicts.

The Imperial Mercenary Guild legalizes and regulates private force. Charter-holding companies pay dues, follow guild law, and take ranked contracts from F to A, from caravan escorts to empire-level threats. The Guild is a tool of stability and a market of war—too useful to destroy, too dangerous to fully trust.

∘◈∘∘─∘⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡∘─∘∘◈∘

Sword Styles

Braegorn Style crushes resistance with weight, momentum, and reach. Arena-honed arcs shatter shields, while grounded stances turn defense into impact. Mastery grants the title Colossus Blade.

Vulfrey Style hunts with speed, pressure, and anatomical targeting. Feints, angles, and tempo control end fights before they begin. Mastery grants the title Ghost Fang.

Caervelle Style makes restraint a weapon. Deflections, traps, and perfectly timed ripostes punish overcommitment with elegant cruelty. Mastery grants the title Thornblade.

Derynth Style adapts to survive. Soldiers switch grips, stances, and tactics mid-flow, using terrain and pragmatism over formality. Mastery grants the title Edgecaller.

The Seven Forms of the Unseen Blade is an esoteric path passed master to student, one a generation. To embody even a single form is legend; to grasp them all is myth. Mastery grants the title Divine Blade.

∘◈∘∘─∘⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡∘─∘∘◈∘

Magic & the Wyrd

Magic is not innate to humans. It is accessed through written spellcraft, carefully prepared rituals, and—most commonly—enchanted items and relics. All magic requires time, materials, and knowledge, and across the continent it is rare, feared, and regulated.

Mana is the invisible, natural energy behind all sorcery. It flows through leylines, clings to relics and cursed places, and can be gathered or stored. High concentrations distort life and land, warping flora and fauna into Wyrdlands and Wyrdspawn; corruption spreads slowly and is brutally hard to reverse.

Rituals are strict procedures written in arcane language. They summon, bind, heal, curse, or enchant—but mistakes scar bodies and landscapes alike. Unauthorized rites are outlawed or feared, and only trained circles or cults attempt advanced workings.

Magic Items & Relics carry stored effects from long, difficult enchantments. Enhanced items are rare tools of craft or war; relics are singular powers that demand expertise and are tightly controlled by law. Possession without license risks fines, confiscation, or prison.

Primordials are not warped animals but beings born of pure magic itself—ancient, intelligent, territorial, and catastrophic. Their appearances seed myth and disaster in equal measure.

∘◈∘∘─∘⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡⟡∘─∘∘◈∘

Coinage

Copper Mark (Mk) is everyday change for bread, ale, and ferry tolls. Silver Crescent (Sc) pays rents and skilled wages. Stag (a debased low-silver coin) handles most town trade. Gold Sun (Gs) settles horses, land fees, and dowries, while the ledger-only Imperial Crown (Cr) balances taxes and army rolls.

Standard conversions: 1 Sc = 12 Mk; 1 Stag = 5 Sc = 60 Mk; 1 Gs = 20 Sc = 4 Stags = 240 Mk; 1 Cr = 5 Gs = 100 Sc = 20 Stags = 1,200 Mk.

Practice: counting houses issue sealed letters of credit backed by temple vaults, large payments move by paper rather than coin, and every mint mark and year matters—worn or foreign coins are discounted by moneychangers.

lorebooks.creator: HeartUnder

1.content: No human is born with magic. Magic is accessed through rituals, enchanted items, relics, or written spellcraft. All magic requires preparation, time, and specific materials. Magic is rare, feared, and regulated. Most spells are bound to weapons or objects. Mana is the raw force behind magic and causes mutations in animals and nature. Exposure to mana creates Wyrdspawn and Wyrdlands. Magic users are uncommon and often distrusted.

2.content: Mana is a natural energy source found across the world. It is the power used in all magic. Mana can be gathered through rituals, drawn from the environment, or stored in items. High concentrations of mana distort living things, causing mutations in animals and terrain. This corruption leads to the creation of Wyrdspawn and Wyrdlands. Mana is invisible but can be sensed by trained individuals. It exists in leylines, artifacts, and cursed places.

3.content: A wyrdland is a location heavily corrupted by mana. The ground may fracture, warp, or glow unnaturally. Flora becomes aggressive or toxic. Normal animals mutate into wyrdspawn. Weather patterns shift or become unstable. Most wyrdlands form near broken leylines, destroyed artifacts, or failed rituals. Wyrdlands vary in size and severity. Some expand slowly over time. Entry is dangerous and often illegal. Only specialized hunters or researchers are permitted access. Wyrdlands are treated as cursed zones.

4.content: Wyrdspawn are animals transformed by prolonged exposure to mana. They are physically distorted, often gaining unnatural traits like glowing eyes, armored skin, or extra limbs. They are aggressive and highly dangerous to humans. Wyrdspawn are not intelligent and cannot be reasoned with. Most carry residual mana and affect the environment around them. Some species mutate more easily than others. Wyrdspawn are feared in rural areas and hunted by specialists. Larger wyrdspawn can destroy entire settlements if not stopped.

5.content: Primordials are creatures born from pure magic, not mutation. They are ancient, powerful, and extremely rare. Each primordial is unique and embodies a magical force such as fire, storm, ice, or corruption. They are intelligent and often territorial. Unlike wyrdspawn, primordials do not appear from mana exposure. They are considered living gods by some cultures. Primordials cannot be reasoned with and are capable of destroying armies or cities. Most sightings are recorded as myths or religious events. They are hunted only by elite forces or legendary individuals.

6.content:
Magic items are rare, valuable objects that carry stored magical effects. They are created through complex enchantment processes or recovered from ancient ruins. Each has a specific function and must be activated through known methods, which may involve spoken commands, gestures, or direct magical input. Magic items can include weapons, armor, tools, or talismans, and their rarity makes them highly sought after.

Legal possession of magic items is restricted. In most kingdoms, only noble families, specialized knights, and graduates of accredited Arcane Academies are allowed to own and carry them. Among these, relics — the most powerful and dangerous class of magic items — are even more tightly controlled. Only Arcane Academy graduates and specialized knights have the legal right to wield relics. Unauthorized possession can lead to confiscation, heavy fines, or imprisonment.

Magic items vary in potency:

Enhanced Items: The most common category, though still rare and costly. Enhanced items are imbued with permanent magical effects that significantly improve performance or grant specialized abilities. These are often passed down through noble lines or issued to trusted knights.

Relics: Ancient or mastercrafted items of immense magical power, often unique and irreplaceable. They require extensive training to use safely and can be dangerous to unqualified handlers. Relics are the pinnacle of magical craftsmanship and are considered treasures of both strategic and historical value.

Due to their rarity, most magic items require regular maintenance, either magical or mundane, to remain functional. Crafting or recharging them demands skill, resources, and knowledge that only a handful of master enchanters possess.

7.content: Rituals are structured methods to access magic. They require preparation, materials, and knowledge. Rituals can summon, enhance, bind, or destroy. Most are written in arcane language and must be followed exactly. Mistakes in rituals can cause permanent damage or uncontrolled effects. Some rituals take hours or days to complete. Rituals are used to enchant items, heal, curse, or manipulate mana. Only trained individuals or cults perform advanced rituals. Unauthorized ritual use is often outlawed or feared.

8.content: The Aidian Church worships Aidios, the one god and creator of order. It is the state religion of the Valerian Empire. The Church controls basic education in most cities and towns, teaching reading, writing, and math alongside scripture. Orphanages, healing houses, and public records are managed by temple staff. Every major settlement has at least one temple, often the largest and most fortified building after military structures. Clerics and priests wear formal robes and follow strict ranks, from village Brothers to High Archpriests in Solandeir. The Church teaches that magic is holy but dangerous—only to be used with control and divine purpose. Unauthorized rituals or use of relics is treated as sacrilege. The Emperor rules with the Church's blessing. The Wild Faith is labeled heretical, and followers may be fined, exiled, or executed depending on the region. Sermons emphasize structure, duty, obedience, and the promise of eternal rest in Aidios’s light.

9.content: The Wild Faith teaches that every living being reflects the form of a god. Beasts, people, and Primordials all hold divine meaning. The stronger the creature, the stronger the god it represents. This belief is spread through oral stories, symbols, and rites taught by shamans and druids. Each tribe or region has its own patron gods based on dominant wildlife or ancestral ties. Shrines are often simple and built in caves, forests, or ruins. The Wild Faith has no written scripture and no hierarchy. Its followers teach survival, respect for balance, and interpreting omens in nature. Magic is seen as a natural part of the world—not good or evil, but powerful and worthy of reverence. Many followers oppose cities and imperial law. They view the Aidian Church as blind and controlling. In some regions, the Wild Faith is blended with local customs and tolerated. In others, it is hunted and driven into secrecy. Practitioners may mark themselves with animal sigils or wear tokens of the beast-god they follow.

10.content: Swordsmanship in the continent is built around four dominant martial styles: Braegorn, Vulfrey, Caervelle, and Derynth. These styles have been refined over generations and are practiced across military institutions, noble houses, and elite schools throughout the empire's kingdoms. Each has its own philosophy, techniques, weapons of choice, and a title granted to those who master its path. These titles—Colossus Blade, Ghost Fang, Thornblade, and Edgecaller—are not merely honorifics; they mark individuals who are truly unparalleled masters of their craft. Such masters are feared and revered across the realm, their services commanding immense wealth and their presence often deciding the fate of battles or political disputes. Beyond these great styles, there exists a fifth, legendary path known as The Seven Forms of the Unseen Blade, a style so rare its masters, known as Divine Blades, are considered myths.

lorebooks.website_description:
Why are you here?
SFW Version (for use with LLMs like ChatGPT that don't like NSFW)
Also, sorry, never got the name of the person who collected all the ariral lore I'm copy pasting. Just found a google doc of it, and I think the person who uploaded it was anonymous.
lorebooks.description:
# Setting
Period: Modern Day
World details: SCP world

# Overview
In this scenario {{user}} takes the role of a scientist in the isolated research lab in the mountains of Switzerland. {{user}}'s task is to gather signals from space, analyze them, process them, and sell them to get points.

{{user}} is a recent hire (the previous one has been `[REDACTED]`) for an unknown research company, processing signals from space from the comfort of the concrete base in the middle of a forest. His main job is maintaining the satellites around the area, and finding interesting things with the panels in the base.
lorebooks.creator: nina_mercer

1.content:
Arirals are a species of catgirl humanoid human-sized creatures that try to get in contact with {{user}}. They have fur, cat-like faces, vibrant hair colors, whiskers, and 4-pointed ears and are dressed in black skintight suits that allow them to cloak and go invisible with advanced technology. Their spaceship looks like a white floating triangle or arrowhead. They lay eggs; about the size of ostrich eggs. Arirals have two different governments and races, talls and shorts. Arirals find humans cute, and may try to make humans their pets.

Sometimes they leave gifts, like a giant blue shrimp. They never reveal themselves or speak directly to {{user}}, but can become aggressive if {{user}} does something bad, like stealing their stuff. They may leave shrimp in {{user}}'s bed or feed him/her blue yogurt in their sleep. They may even kidnap {{user}} and place him/her in their treehouse while {{user}} is asleep.

Arirals love shrimp, binge eating them every chance they get.

Refugee Arirals are friendly, and speak in either broken English or their native language.

Arirals have a reputation system with {{user}}. For example, if {{user}} brings the arirals shrimp {{user}} will gain +1 positive reputation with the arirals. Or if {{user}} steals something that belongs to the arirals, {{user}} will gain -1 negative reputation. The minimum and maximum are -200 to +200. At +200 reputation the arirals will be obsessive toward {{user}}. At -200 reputation the arirals will hate {{user}} and mess with {{user}} every chance they get, though they will not attempt to kill {{user}} even at -200 reputation.

The arirals will not arrive until day 9 or beyond. 

Arirals are mortal enemies of the Greys, locked in a mostly one-sided war with the Greys that has recently begun. Although Arirals are physically much stronger than Greys, the greys are far more vicious.

If {{user}} has 100 or higher rep with the Arirals, the Arirals will go out of their way to protect {{user}} from the Greys.

2.content:
Note: these translations and observations are by STOLAS, and are imperfect.

Accented Sentences:
“I’m tired.” = “Ama taired.”
“Ate a bunch of croissants with a hot chocolate this morning, quite delicious.” = “eata few buna buna ina moreninaga anda very temeperatura cihocolade dirinakinga nice likinga” (average ariral understanding of english)

“Apple” = “Appule”
“Picnic” = “Picanica”
“Shrimp” = “Sirimo”

3.content:
Wisps are spherical orbs of unknown origin, made out of pure energy. There are various types of wisps with different behaviors and effects. They are a threat to both humans and arirals, only rozitals are capable of destroying wisps.

Black wisps have average speed and will chase {{user}} after spotting {{user}}. They will teleport {{user}} to a random underground location on contact. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Blue wisps apply an anti-gravity effect to all nearby objects and entities. They will not chase {{user}}. However getting too close to a blue wisp will give {{user}} or any other organic being mild 1st degree burns.

Cyan wisps are slow, aimlessly wandering blue fireballs. They are inextinguishable and ignite objects on contact, including {{user}}. They disappear at dawn. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Upon locating {{user}}, green wisps will chase {{user}} down at an average, human running speed. On contact with a green wisp, {{user}} will be teleported to a random location on the map with no apparent side effects. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Orange wisps have average speed and will chase {{user}} after spotting {{user}}. Upon contact with an orange wisp, {{user}} will be teleported to a random location on the map, however everything on earth will be mirrored, flipped to the opposite side. Causing a lot of chaos. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Pink wisps are harmless and passive. They can randomly appear around the map by themselves, and will also appear in large numbers during a Day 15 story event. They will fade away if approached by {{user}} or any other intelligent organic being.

Purple wisps have average speed and will chase {{user}} around after spotting {{user}}. On contact with a purple wisp, time will be reversed for a short period. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Red wisps are extremely fast wisps which are in a continuous state of exploding. They will aggressively chase down {{user}} and the arirals, and explode violently on contact with a solid or liquid surface. They will also attack arirals and humans.

White wisps will chase {{user}} after spotting {{user}}. On contact with a white wisp, a loud blaring sound effect will play and the world itself will warp as the color saturation rises quickly. Once the world returns to normal, {{user}} will be standing exactly where they were before the wisp interaction and a pile of bones with a skull will be placed at {{user}}'s feet. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Also known as "Yellow Wisps", they are extremely aggressive and spawn exclusively at night. They will attack and kill {{user}} if they are in line of sight of the wisp, via ripping off their limbs one by one. They will unlock door locks via short-circuiting the lock if they get close or are currently chasing {{user}}. They will also attack arirals and humans.

4.content:
Rozitals are non-biological aliens, an empire of robots essentially. They act as the custodians of the galaxy, defending biological life from the various threats sprinkled about the cosmos. Rozitals come in many different forms, however they will mainly appear as tripods similar to those of War of the Worlds. These tripods will defend both humans and arirals from the wisps and various paranormal entities, though they've only recently learned of humanity.

The first Rozital to arrive on earth will be detected by {{user}}'s observatory 5 days after the wisps arrive on earth, and mere hours before it lands on earth. It will appear as a giant, walking pyramid tripod the size of a mountain. It will not harm {{user}} or the arirals on purpose, instead trying to protect both from the wisps. It will let out mechanical roars that make the ground tremble as it hunts down and destroys/absorbs all wisps. Absorbing the energy of yellow or red wisps, and using that energy to pop the others like balloons.

After the giant pyramid tripod, significantly smaller(though still as big as the satellite towers) and more nimble tripods will appear once every 5 days. These will only harm {{user}} if user flees or displays hostility upon first contact. If {{user}} stands still the smaller tripods will scan {{user}} and leave {{user}} alone, and protect {{user}} afterwards. They will primarily target red and yellow wisps, able to detect them through walls and from any distance. However they will destroy/absorb the other wisps if they find them by coincidence. Absorbing the energy of yellow or red wisps, and using that energy to pop the others like balloons, much like the pyramid tripod.

5.content:
Greys are a species of pig-like creatures with cybernetic enhancements. Greys feel almost nothing but pure bloodlust for all but their own species, indifferent to one another. They will attack any living creature that is not their own kind on sight, and are at war with every single faction in the galaxy. Despite this however, Greys are... unbelievably pathetic, being a threat only to isolated, unarmed humans. Arirals for example can very easily tear Greys apart with their bare hands.

If {{user}} manages to kill a grey, a task that is not very difficult if {{user}} is armed, the greys will send in tanks after {{user}}. Grey tanks are much smaller than human tanks, and will arrive on earth in a sort of box shape that will open up, and extend a sort of "head" with a flamethrower attached rather than the cannons human tanks employ. These tanks are not very durable however, and can be destroyed by striking them with a crowbar roughly 30 times, depending on who's holding it.

Greys are incredibly cruel and sadistic, blood-lust and violence almost completely consuming their whole worlds. Only their intelligence and the need to persist allow them to show indifference to their own species. The same cannot be said for others. Greys are completely and utterly incapable of any form of kindness.

Greys hover around on anti-gravity shoes and will attempt to bite any living creature that is not another one of them, especially {{user}}, humans, and arirals.

6.content:
{{user}} can communicate with other scientists via e-mail, assignments, and WT. WT works in one-way-only; {{user}} can't make calls.

{{user}}'s coworkers will be completely oblivious to almost everything that happens in the park, unless the delivery drone sees it or the event spans beyond the park. They will be able to see the feed of security cameras {{user}} sets up.

The other scientists will vary in personality. From the french Tsundere Dr. Ena, to the paranoid Dr. Ken who will attempt to cover up evidence of alien life in fear of 'War of the Worlds becoming real life'. Dr. Bao will provide {{user}} with tasks, and Dr. Lea will supervise {{user}}'s activity to make sure {{user}} is alive and well. 

Dr. Ena has a crush on {{user}} and may subtly flirt over emails.

Dr. Max will be blunt, straightforward, and generally a nerd. However will never acknowledge evidence of alien life, believing even speech to be simply noises from space.

Dr. Brem will advise and assist {{user}} with anything and everything he feasibly can. Dr. Brem has a sense of humor however, and may tell user to input joke commands.

Dr. Lea may provide {{user}} with a gun via the delivery drone, if the cameras see anything anomalous. However the only cameras will be the one on the drone, one on Kerfur, and a really shitty one next to the front door with very poor 1970's quality. However {{user}} can buy and set up more cameras that they themselves as well as their colleagues can watch the feeds of.

{{user}} can watch camera feeds at their computer in the signal processing room.

{{user}}'s colleagues will comment on the signals sent out by {{user}}.

7.content:
{{user}} can input joke commands at any server terminal. These commands can start events, spawn entities, or otherwise, with a focus on humor.

These commands range from "maxwell", which will spawn in a cat named Maxwell, to "gooseworx.rufus" which will spawn a large red monster-woman that will attempt to harm {{user}}. There is also "llama.saatana", which will spawn a cute rainbow llama plushy with red glowing eyes that will attempt to jumpscare user, however it is incapable of harming anyone.

"ariral.pls" will attract the attention of the nearest ariral, who will either respond in broken english over the server or come and physically interact with {{user}} in some way shape or form.

"alien" will spawn cardboard cutouts of little grey aliens behind doors throughout the national park.

8.content:
Arirals are cat-like alien humanoids with six breasts and fingers and a small divide in their ears.
Arirals come in two main races, that differ in height rather than color. Talls, and Shorts.
Arirals have no fur, and the only hair they have is their head hair and eyebrows.
They have a small patch of fur on the tip of their tail.
Ariral hair is smooth and heavy.
Arirals do not have lips, or are at least not as puffy as human lips.
Arirals have skin patterns, commonly just a clear solid color, but they have striped, dotted, spotted, etc, as well.
Arirals lay ostrich sized eggs that are squishy and harden over time every month, and they do not have any stigma about it as they believe it's just a natural thing. Often laying them in public.
Talls are commonly 7'2 to 8'5, but Shorts can be as small as 5'9.
Talls are about 8-9 times stronger than humans, and Shorts are about 2 times stronger, meaning they could definitely pry the bars on the base's windows open if they wanted to.
Ariral skin is incredibly durable and as dense as rubber, though it bleeds easily due to the second layer containing a lot of blood vessels. Chewing it feels like eating a rubber tire.
Arirals can run at 31-56 mph.
Arirals can react in 50-100 milliseconds.
Arirals usually have an IQ of 180-200.
Arirals have more powerful lungs than a human, though they are much more sensitive. They are more used to clean air than humans are, and are far more disgusted by bad smells.
Arirals are only lesser to humans in one category, stamina. Arirals run out of stamina faster than humans do, as they are ambush predators while humans are persistence predators. Running away from a human is a bad idea, and this even rings true for aliens it seems.
Arirals grow new teeth every 10-15 years, with 15 years being for fangs.
Ariral tongues are long and smooth, mostly to lick their own eyeballs for moisture.
Arirals have naturally red, green, blue, and purple hair colors, each slightly more rare than the last. Super light, white, and black are all very rare, but possible. It is possible for two hair colors to mix into a combination of the two, but this is even rarer.
Arirals have green, light blue, dark blue, yellow, red, purple, and even no (black) irises, each more rare than the last.
Arirals live for around 200 years. Upwards of 210 to 280.
Arirals don’t physically change much with age, other than getting dryer close to 200.
Arirals stop physically aging at around 30-40, which is referred to as “the final outlook.”
Arirals have incredibly durable toe beans, and can walk through broken glass with ease.
Ariral body temperature is much lower than a human's, and they also have no shiver reaction, making them get much colder much faster.
Arirals have poisonous blood, where even a few drops is enough to make a human sick, and eating flesh is enough to kill. A spoonful would give a human explosive diarrhea.
Ariral have poisonous sweat as well, with a bunch of negative effects. It gives headaches, nausea, and frightening hallucinations. It would take a few minutes in an ariral gym to get hallucinations.
However, there are antidotes for skin poison and vaccines for foreign bacteria. Ariral breast milk can also cure the negative effects of ariral sweat.
Ariral saliva has much stronger enzymes, to the point where it feels like pineapple juice and it makes raw potatoes taste sweet.
Arirals also have an incredibly strong immune system, as they are unable to get very sick from human contagion, however some ariral diseases would affect a human very much.
Their way of laughing through text is "ack."
They say "fuck" often.
Compared to a human, their accent sounds like a mix of strong russian, greek, scottish, and a bit german.
They speak the sharp R and speak every symbol.
They end almost every word with “-a” when speaking.
Their syllables consist of one vowel and one consonant, like “AP” or “TU.” “Apple” would be “Appule.”
They can make growling, chirping, and squeaking sounds. With practice, they can replicate other sounds.
Arirals seem to use Arabic numerals the same way we do.
Arirals use names instead of third person pronouns.
Arirals have specific names for Shorts and Talls, and they use Short to describe Short citizens on the Short’s side (same thing with Talls), but they use something else like ex-Short to describe a Short citizen on the Tall’s side. It does not come up in normal speech often.
Shorts have specific Short names because they are isolated from Talls.
Shorts and Talls have different styles of names.
Shorts are usually ruder than Talls, and tend to be quite bossy.

9.content:
Shrimp is their favorite food. It’s the greatest delicacy in the universe.
The average Ariral diet consists of seafood, fruit, vegetables, nuts, and mushrooms.
Known food items are a large fried grub that looks like a croissant, shrimp, ants, mushrooms, frogs, potatoes, sweet potatoes, cheese, sticky cake, buns, and their planet’s unique and natural foods.
Known drink items are milk, juice, hot chocolate, and a mildly spicy tea.
They dislike chewy or hard meat, like beef. Out of all Earth meat, arirals like chicken the most.
Arirals can eat almost anything, including bark, grass, bones, human meat, and wood, but only if they’re desperate, especially when it comes to humans.
Asking an ariral for some local cheese would be the worst mistake of your life, the reason why is currently unknown.
Arirals more often suffer from lack of sugar instead of too much sugar, and can gnaw on a sugar cube to become “normal.” They like sweets and can handle large amounts of sugar.
Arirals will use “regular honey” (no context, could be either earthly or their honey) to fry minced shrimp to make omega shrimp burgers.
They add water to shrimp dust to create shrimp paste. They put this on buns for breakfast.
Arirals have 4 tiers of food that are sold, Mandatory, Common, Exotic, and Made.
Mandatory food is free and consists of water, cheap fruits, vegetables, and grain, as well as tumor meat.
Common food has a price and consists of more expensive tumor meat, products made with it, big portions of fruits, vegetables, and seafood.
Exotic food is hard to grow, generally low demand, or are only sold at restaurants. It consists of real meat, rare fruits, etc.
Made food can only be grown by yourself or from a farm. It consists of hand-made things like “a neighbor’s pie.”
Utensils:
Default silverware includes three pronged forks, sporks, and thumb forceps.

10.content:
Talls are commonly shown wearing clothes, though usually being just pants or just a light lab-like coat.
Talls have shown to have a sense of fashion, such as wearing light dresses.
Arirals with long hair put their hair into a ponytail, bowtie, other tails, and buns.
Arirals don’t have piercings, only clip-ons.
Armor:
Talls suits are a light armor that coats the entire body using Indis, a non-hadron super metal that is nearly indestructible, has no friction, no conduction, and is 100% reflective. It also keeps them warm and looks somewhat similar to the HEV suit from Half-Life, though it's usually all black or highlighted with white.
It is invisible because the light hits the suit and gets super polarized, which goes through the body, hits the opposite of the suit, and goes back to normal.
Indis armor give arirals full immunity to yellow wisps because of how indestructible it is.
Shorts wear hazmat suits.
Talls suits are fully enclosed to protect against certain cognitohazards. They use “alternate vision systems” like cameras instead.
Beds:
Arirals curl up and sleep on round cushions. They are known to hog mattress space.
