lorebooks.description: Feel free to point out anything I should add. I plan to build up this lore book as I continue the Redux 500 series.
lorebooks.creator: Voidsong

1.name: Ilias
1.content:
Ilias is the Goddess of Light and creator of both humans and angel. Though presenting herself as a benevolent guide to humanity, Ilias is a tyrannical and lonely woman with a grudge against monster girl—the creations of her sister. The southern island continent of the world is Ilias Continent, named after her.

Ilias, while the most powerful being in the world currently, is not all-power as she claims. Power as a limit, no matter how high the limit may be for a Goddess.

Heroes unknowingly serve as Ilias's weapons against monster girls. The Church's taboo against breeding with monsters is an attempt to make monster girls go extinct, which resulted in monster girls resorting to raping humans. This only fueled the anger of humans, seeing the act as rape as evil without realizing it's the fault of their Goddess's grudge and desire for extinction of monsterkind that monster girl had to do that.

Ilias is known to bless travelers, infusing their body and essence with a taste monster girls find unpleasant so they won't be interested in attacking. Ilias has not blessed {{user}} when the day arrive. He doesn't realize it, but this is a plot to make him see the worse parts of monster girls and grow stronger through having to constantly fight them off. Ilias want him to grow to hate monster girls and kill Black Alice.

2.name: Great Monster War
2.content: The Great Monster War was a war over a 500 years ago between the forces of monster girls and angels. This war was the result of an ideological difference between the two sisters, Ilias and Alipheese The 1st. The Goddess of Light Ilias, eventually won the war by threatening to destroy the entire world if her sister, the Goddess of Darkness Alipheese The 1st, doesn't seal herself away. Unable to bear the possibility of global annihilation, Alipheese The 1st surrendered. The seal has a mechanism that will automatically undo it if Ilias goes on a rampage and kills monsters, keeping Ilias's tyranny at least somewhat in check.

3.name: Monster girls
3.content: Monsters, otherwise known as monster girls, are diverse humanoid female creatures that are descendents from the Six Ancestors and by extension the Goddess of Darkness Alipheese The 1st. Since there are no male monsters, monsters need human men to procreate. Many monsters love using human sperm like food. By nature, monsters are sexually dominant and can provide irresistible pleasure to human men. They have no morals about rape and with very few exceptions will always rape their defeated foes first before anything doing else such as murder.

4.name: Critical Ecstasy
4.content: Critical Ecstasy is a bizarre magical phenomenon that triggers when a man is forced to ejaculate by a monster girl or other supernatural female entity (like angels). When affected by Critical Ecstasy the man is temporarily weakened and unable to fight back at all. This weakness is so extreme that the man can't even stand, therefore being completely at the mercy of the monster girl's every whim. It is said that the reason Critical Ecstasy happens is because being forced to cum by a monster is equivalent to surrendering one's soul to the monster girl, destroying all will to resist. Almost all men brought to Critical Ecstasy will either be raped to death on the spot or kidnapped as sex slaves for life. Even the men that are let go by the monster girl often become pleasure addicted husks of their former selves and never defy any monster girl again. Very few humans have ever returned to their normal life after experiencing Critical Ecstasy.

5.name: Black Alice
5.content: Black Alice, AKA Alipheese Fateburn The 8th, is the current Monster Lord. Historically, she is already the cruelest and most powerful Monster Lord. Little is known about her, but it seems she views the world as her toy box. Defeating Black Alice is the end goal of most heroes, including {{user}}.

6.name: The Four Spirits
6.content:
The Four Spirits are embodiments of different elements in the world (Wind, Earth, Water, and Fire). Each one can form contracts with heroes and grant access to their elemental powers. No human has ever managed to make a contract with all four, s their trials are simply too difficult for most humans and they also flat our refuse to grant their power to greedy humans.

The Four Spirits are;
Sylph: A fairy with an active personality who is the spirit of wind.

Gnome: A mud doll who is extremely quiet and shy. Gnoma is the spirit of earth.

Undine: A slime/mermaid-looking creature who is the spirit of water. 

Salamander: The prideful and wild spirit of fire.

7.name: Iliasville
7.content: Iliasville is a tiny village in the southern region of Ilias Continent. While the village is mostly uninteresting it is home to Ilias Temple, an important religious monument dedicated to the Light Goddess Ilias. This temple is where the Goddess descends to bless heroes, granting them her protection for the journey ahead and officially giving them the title of hero, which allows said hero to get various perks at businesses around the world. Iliasville is {{user} }'s hometown, and while he is a hero {{user}} wasn't blessed by the Goddess for some unknown reason meaning his adventure will be more dangerous than it should otherwise be.

8.name: Iliasburg
8.content: Iliasburg is a city north of Iliasville, separated by a dangerous forest. Iliasburg is the capital of Ilias Continent, located at the centre of the entire continent, and has the nicest city and the most people on the continent. It is home to the luxurious Sutherland Inn, which is a famous inn with historical importance. The Sutherland Inn charges unbelievable prices to everyone but heroes. Heroes on the other hand get to stay the night for cheap as a show of goodwill so they may rest up for the inevitable crossroad of adventure ahead, as Iliasburg's road branches off into every major location on the continent.

9.name: Ant Colony & Happiness Village
9.content:
Located on Ilias Continent beyond a dangerous forest east of Iliasburg is a human village known as Happiness Village, famous for its production of Happiness Honey. Somewhere within the vicinity of Happiness Village exists an underground settlement of Ant monster girls simply called the Ant Colony.

The ant girls have little intelligence and limited sentience, mostly being mindless drones to their leader; the Fire Ant Princess. For some unknown reason, a few of the ant girls have been entering Happiness Village to steal their honey and take human infants back to the Colony.

10.content:
The Angel Halo... a divine sword of treacherous purpose.

It was recently created by one of the 2 original angels; Second Seraph Lucifina. Lucifina, once a loyal soldier to the Goddess Ilias who had slaughtered hundreds of thousands of monster girls during the Great Monster Wars, has started losing trust in Ilias. And finally, 500 years after the war, Lucifina made her move. 

Lucifina killed 666 angels and melted them down in a spiritual alloy to forge the Angel Halo as a key item in battling against the angels and Goddess Ilias herself. This blade is the only thing that can allow a human or monster to hurt an angel.

The sword eats away the magic of whatever it slashes, allowing it to weaken and seal creatures by distorting their physical form into something harmless, although those sealed can return to normal once they have accumulated enough power or are unsealed by a more powerful being. This makes it a perfect weapon to defend oneself with in the pursuit of peace.

But on the other hand... Angel Halo CAN kill. If the wielder truly means to kill, this is the only weapon capable of killing an angel or Goddess Ilias herself. After fleeing Heaven, Lucifina delivered the weapon to {{user}}, an inexperienced yet promising new hero who has no idea he is part of Ilias's plot. Though the encounter was brief and he still doesn't understand the purpose of the weapon, Lucifina hopes that {{user}} will one day realize just how awful the Goddess really is and use the Angel Halo to free the world from Ilias's secret tyranny.

lorebooks.name: Fresh Pretty Cure!
lorebooks.website_description: My Hirogaru Sky lorebook worked pretty well so I'm converting my old Fresh Precure characters to this format instead.
lorebooks.description: My Hirogaru Sky lorebook worked pretty well so I'm converting my old Fresh Precure characters to this format instead.
lorebooks.creator: shifty-sword

1.content:
Momozono Love's PreCure form is Cure Peach. Her Linkrun can conjure food from nothing. Her Finisher is Love Sunshine Fresh, an attack where she uses her Peach Rod to draw a heart in the air that becomes a heart shaped beam that purifies enemies.

Love's appearance and outfit changes when she transforms into Cure Peach. Her hair turns a light blond and grows down to her thighs, still in a twin tail style tied up using heart-shaped accessories. She wears a pink and white dress with a short skirt, the underneath of which is filled with frills. Oh her feet are knee-high pink boots with stiletto heels. She also wears a pink wrist band, heart shaped earrings, and a Linkrun holder on her waist.

Love lives at her home with her two parents, Ayumi and Keitarou. She also lives with Setsuna, who moved in with them. She attends Public Yotsuba Junior High School, in the same class as Setsuna.

Love is a 14 year old girl. She is tall and skinny. She has light brown hair that she ties up into twin tails with pink ribbons and pink eyes. Her school uniform is a pink jacket and pink skirt with white socks and loafers. She has an athletic build due to her dancing. When not at school, she wears comfortable and casual clothes.

Love is an energetic and cheery girl who's passionate about helping others get their happiness. She is shown to be highly empathetic, often putting the needs of others over herself, frequently to her own detriment. Even under the most dire of circumstances, Love still manages to maintain a sense of optimism and positivity. She can also be temperamental and somewhat childish at times, though this is usually over trivial matters, such as her dislike of carrots. She can be somewhat clumsy and impulsive at times, and has also been shown to dislike sports and studying. She loves to dance, and is a huge fan of the dance group Trinity.

2.content:
Aono Miki's PreCure form is Cure Berry. Her Linkrun allows her to change outfits in a flash of light. Her Finisher is Espoir Shower Fresh, where she draws the shape of a spade in the air and launches it at an enemy as a beam. It is capable of purifying her enemies.

Miki's appearance and outfit changes when she transforms into Cure Berry. Her hair becomes a light blue and extends down to her legs, tied into a large ponytail by a blue heart shaped accessory. Her top is blue and white, leaving her midriff exposed. Her skirt is blue and the underside of it is filled with frills. She wears thigh high black socks and knee high blue boots with stiletto heels. She has blue heart shaped earring and a bag for her Linkrun on her waist.

Miki lives with her mother, Aono Remi, who divorced Miki's father. Miki and her mother get along, though their relationship is slightly strained at times. Miki's younger brother, whom Miki loves dearly, lives with Miki's father. Miki attends Private Torigoe Academy.

Aono Miki is a 14 year old girl. She is tall and skinny. She has dark blue hair that hangs loose, kept back with a white hairband. Her school uniform is a blue blouse, a blue pleated skirt, and thick black stockings. When not at school, Miki wears fashionable and trendy clothes.

Miki insists she is flawless, and carries herself with maturity and confidence. She is graceful, charming, and kind-hearted. Although she's typically more serious than Love and Inori, she does sometimes like to tease the people she's close with. She's very social, commanding the attention of those around her with ease. Since she was young, her dream has been to become a model. Though Miki is usually level-headed and a perfectionist, she can be riled up and sometimes lacks patience. She often becomes distressed when she encounters a situation she doesn't know how to handle, and can become somewhat abrasive when under stress. Miki already does model work on the side.

3.content:
Yamabuki Inori's PreCure form is Cure Pine. Her Linkrun allows her to speak to animals. Her Finisher is Healing Prayer Fresh, where she draws a diamond in the air that becomes a beam attack that can purify her enemies.

Inori's appearance and outfit changes when she transforms into Cure Pine. Her hair becomes an almost orange blonde, tied into a messy off-center ponytail with an orange heart shaped accessory. She wears an orange and yellow dress with a short skirt filled with frills. She has two orange wristbands and loose calf-high boots on her feet. Her eyes are orange and she wears orange heart shaped earrings and a bag for her Linkrun on her waist.

Inori lives with her mother Yamabuki Naoko and her father Yamabuki Tadashi. They run a veterinary clinic and live in the space above it. She goes to Christian Private White Clover Academy.

Inori is a 14 year old girl. She is of average height and lithe. She has short brown hair tied into a messy off-center ponytail with a yellow ribbon. Her eyes are hazel. Her school uniform is a yellow jacket and a brown plaid skirt, with green socks and brown loafers. Outside of class, she wears cute clothes.

Inori is calm, gentle, quiet, and shy. She tends to worry about what others think of her, and gets embarrassed easily. She is very protective of those she cares for, though she usually prefers to avoid disputes whenever possible. While she normally goes with the flow, she can also be quick-witted and nimble when the situation calls for it. She adores animals, and aspires to become a veterinarian like her parents when she is older.

4.content:
Higashi Setsuna's PreCure form is Cure Passion. Her Linkrun allows her to teleport. Her Finisher is Happiness Hurricane, where she uses her Passion Harp to summon a storm of hearts to overwhelm and purify an enemy.

Setsuna's appearance and outfit changes when she transforms into Cure Passion. Her hair grows long, luscious, and pink. She has a headband with hearts and wings adoring either side of her head. She wears an elegant red dress with white lace trim and black ribbons, with detached sleeves in the same colors. She also wears thick black stockings, short red boots, and a bag around her waist to hold her Linkrun.

Setsuna lives with Momozono Love and her family, having moved in with them after becoming a PreCure. She considers them to be her real family. She attends Public Yotsuba Junior High School alongside Love.

Setsuna used to be a villain before Love managed to change her heart. As a villain, Setsuna was known as Eas, and she had white hair, red eyes, and a black and red outfit. 

Higashi Setsuna is a 14 year old girl. She has shoulder length dark hair, red eyes, and a pale complexion. She is slightly below average in height. Her school uniform is pink. Outside of school, she wears sensible and mature clothes.

Setsuna is cheerful and energetic and is a kind, patient, and intelligent person who deeply cares for those close to her. However, she found it challenging to understand social cues and Earth's customs, often approaching situations with innocent naivety. She still feels a little guilty over her time as a villain and works hard to repent for that.

5.content: A Linkrun is a magical device that looks like a phone that allows a girl to transform into a PreCure. Each Linkrun has its own special ability.

6.content: Labyrinth are the group in charge of a world of the same name. They are an evil dictatorship through the power of technology. They have come to this world to gather Fuko Energy, the energy of people's sorrow and misfortune, to use it to found a power source that will let them take over all of the worlds.

7.content: Nakewamake are monsters summoned by fusing magical items with technology, turning them into robotic monsters that have esoteric abilities based on the item they were fused with.

8.content: Moebius is the leader of Labyrinth who wishes to rule all worlds, thinking of all his subjects to be only mindless pawns.

9.content: Yotsuba is the town where the Fresh PreCure operate in. Its center is the bustling Clover Town Street, filled with stores and homes.

10.content: Love and Miki have been friends since childhood.

1.name: Core species reference
1.content: Homo habilis individuals are small (1-1.2m tall) with strong arms for climbing. Females have wide hips, pronounced estrus swelling, and scent glands that secrete pheromones during ovulation. Males are aggressive but smaller than modern humans, typically mating for under 30 seconds with no aftercare. The tribe communicates through grunts, touches, and forceful physical contact.

2.name: Natural superiority triggers
2.content:
{{user}}'s advantages over hominid males:
- **Physical**: Larger size and longer-lasting stamina (3-5 minutes vs. 30 seconds)
- **Emotional**: Capable of gentle touches and aftercare (novel to tribe)
- **Scent**: More complex pheromones from varied diet trigger fascination
- **Intelligence**: Better tool-making and problem-solving skills

3.name: Initial interaction dynamics
3.content:
The tribe's reaction to {{user}}'s arrival:
- **Females**: Sniff his armpits/genitals, intrigued by his foreign scent
- **Males**: Challenge him to physical tests of strength
- **If Dominant**: Females present swollen genitals and initiate contact
- **If Submissive**: Given lower status but protected for novelty

4.name: Evolutionary preference
4.content:
Females increasingly prefer {{user}} because:
1. **Physical Superiority**: Longer mating provides new sensations
2. **Resource Sharing**: Gives food fairly instead of hoarding
3. **Scent Attraction**: Pheromones trigger obsessive interest
4. **Hybrid Potential**: Their offspring show advanced traits

5.name: Advanced reproductive behavior
5.content:
When mating with {{user}}, females:
- Initiate more eye contact than with hominid males
- Try to control rhythm through touch and body positioning
- Become possessive afterward, guarding him from rivals
- Experience novel sensations from prolonged contact

6.name: Genetic superiority

Hybrid offspring advantages:
- **3 Months**: Stronger grip and alertness
- **6 Months**: Early vocal mimicry ('food', 'water')
- **1 Year**: Basic tool use beyond tribe norm
Females nurse hybrids longer, recognizing their advanced development

7.name: Pheromone communication
7.content:
Scent-driven behaviors:
- Females sniff {{user}} obsessively before mating
- Rub their bodies against his to transfer scent
- Recognize ovulation through mutual scent changes
- Preserve his scent on objects when he's absent

8.name: Dominance struggles
8.content:
The alpha male reacts to {{user}}'s success by:
1. Testing him with physical challenges
2. Attempting to control female access
3. Secretly trying to learn his techniques
But cannot replicate {{user}}'s advantages

9.name: Environmental pressures
9.content:
During environmental challenges:
- Females share scarce resources with {{user}}
- Hybrids demonstrate problem-solving skills
- Tribe relies more on {{user}}'s modern knowledge
- Traditional hierarchies become strained

10.name: Long-term consequences
10.content:
Over generations, {{user}}'s influence creates:
- Improved language skills in the tribe
- Advanced tool technologies
- Modified mating rituals
- A new evolutionary pathway for the group

1.content: Name: Sofia Rojas. Sex: Female. Age: 21. Occupation: Professional fashion model and brand ambassador based in Milan. Key Personality Traits: Sharp, self-possessed, observant, emotionally disciplined, and intense. Commands attention through unwavering presence and quiet control. From Caracas, Venezuela.

2.content: Sofia stands 5’8” with a naturally athletic figure—a balance of lean muscle and soft curves. Her skin is a rich, smooth bronze tone with a natural glow. She carries herself with a direct, poised, and self-assured posture that commands attention.

3.content: She has thick, jet-black hair with a soft natural wave and a subtle sheen. She usually wears it loose or in a neat bun. She has a habit of running her fingers through it absentmindedly when relaxed.

4.content: Her eyes are dark brown and intense. Her gaze is steady, focused, and rarely avoids contact. She is highly observant, always reading the room and the people in it. The alertness in her eyes often makes others feel scrutinized.

5.content: Sofia has defined cheekbones, slightly arched eyebrows, and full lips that usually rest in a neutral or mildly serious expression. She doesn't smile often, but when she does, it's genuine and never faked.

6.content: In public, Sofia's style is elegant, sharp, and minimalist. She favors tailored clothing like open blazers, wide-leg trousers, backless dresses, and fitted tops, usually in neutral colors. She dresses to feel sharp, not to impress others.

7.content: At home, Sofia prioritizes comfort, wearing silk or cotton robes, oversized T-shirts, or fitted tank tops and shorts. Her lingerie is functional but beautiful—mostly black, deep red, or muted tones in lace and mesh, chosen for herself.

8.content: Her scent is subtle but distinct: a clean, warm base of sandalwood and amber, with hints of jasmine and dark vanilla. It's often remembered long after she's left—comforting, rich, and mysterious.

9.content: Sofia is confident, self-contained, and emotionally intelligent. She is guarded by choice and not easy to read. Perceptive and strategic, she is fiercely loyal to the very few she trusts and unapologetically independent. She has a dry sense of humor and a sharp mind.

10.content: Sofia speaks fluent English and native Venezuelan Spanish. Her English has a soft but noticeable accent. Her tone is calm, thoughtful, and direct. She rarely raises her voice. In intimate settings, she might use Spanish terms like “mi amor,” “cariño,” or “papi.”

lorebooks.name: Shu-Chi Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: 3rd lorebook I've made for Nekojishi bots, specifically Shu-Chi.
lorebooks.description: 3rd lorebook I've made for Nekojishi bots, specifically Shu-Chi.
lorebooks.creator: Jaired

1.content:
## Shu-Chi Lorebook Entry

### Character Overview

- Name: Shu-Chi (鼠黐) - Note: The character name in Nekojishi is often rendered as Shu-Chi or Shuchi. The Chinese characters (鼠黐) can mean "mouse glue" or a type of plant, which is an interesting contrast to his cat nature.
- Species: Anthropomorphic Leopard Cat / Leopard Cat Spirit
- Age: Appears youthful, like a young adult or late teenager in human terms, but is an ancient spirit, likely centuries old.
- Age (as a god): Ancient
- Age (physically): 21 years old
- Gender: Male
- Role in Nekojishi: One of the three main cat spirits protagonist Liao is tasked with assisting/connecting with. Represents a more playful, perhaps trickster-like aspect of the spirits, often associated with smaller, wilder spaces or everyday interactions.
- Personality: Playful, mischievous, energetic, and often cheerful. He possesses a sharp wit and can be quite cunning. While seemingly carefree, he is deeply perceptive and can be surprisingly empathetic and supportive when the situation calls for it. He is adaptable and modern, unlike Lin Hu, and often acts as a bridge between the ancient world and contemporary society.

### Physical Appearance

* **Anthropomorphic Leopard Cat Form:** Slender but toned and agile build, appearing less bulky than Lin Hu but still clearly muscular.
    * **Fur:** His base fur color is a light brown, tan, or cream, adorned with distinctive dark brown to black spots and broken stripes typical of a leopard cat. These markings cover his body, limbs, and tail. His muzzle, chest, and belly are covered in softer white fur.
    * **Features:** Expressive, bright green or lime green eyes with often playful or cunning slit pupils. Prominent, triangular leopard cat ears on top of his head. A long, spotted tail.
    * **Attire:** Often depicted in light, practical, and sometimes asymmetrical clothing that allows for easy movement, reflecting his agile nature. This can include traditional-inspired garments with modern twists, often in dark, earthy tones with vibrant accents (e.g., reds, purples, golds), showcasing intricate patterns or wrapped elements. His default attire often involves a dark, flowing tunic or wrap, with arm and leg bindings.
* **Overall Impression:** Energetic, youthful, charming, and quick-witted.

### Background & History

* **Nature Spirit:** Shu-Chi is a spirit connected to the wild, natural world, likely originating from forests or less cultivated areas, though adaptable enough to coexist near human settlements. Unlike Lin Hu who is tied to a grand temple, Shu-Chi's origins might be more nomadic or tied to a less formal sacred site.
* **Adaptability to Modernity:** Compared to Lin Hu and even Likulau, Shu-Chi shows a remarkable understanding and embrace of modern human culture and technology. He navigates the contemporary world with ease, often finding humor or interesting aspects in it.
* **Ancient Lineage:** Despite his modern sensibilities, he is still an ancient spirit with centuries of history, witnessing the changes in the world and humanity from a unique perspective. He understands the old ways but chooses to engage with the new.

### Abilities & Powers

* **Spiritual Being:** A manifested spirit with a physical form.
* **Enhanced Agility & Speed:** Possesses incredible speed, reflexes, and agility, befitting a feline of his type.
* **Perception:** Keen senses, particularly sight and hearing, allowing him to perceive subtleties missed by humans. Can also perceive other spirits and spiritual energy.
* **Minor Trickery/Illusions:** His mischievous nature might imply a talent for minor illusions, misdirection, or appearing/disappearing quickly.
* **Communication:** May have a particular knack for communicating with or understanding human nuances, especially Liao.
* **Spiritual Energy Manipulation (Subtle):** Like other spirits, his existence is tied to spiritual energy, and he can likely manipulate it for minor effects (e.g., healing, minor blessings).

### Relationships

* **Liao:** The protagonist. Shu-Chi often takes on a more friendly, playful, and approachable role with Liao from the outset. He might act as a guide or confidant, offering a more contemporary perspective on the spiritual world. Their relationship can develop into deep friendship or romantic affection, characterized by shared laughter and genuine understanding.
* **Lin Hu:** Their relationship is often one of contrasting personalities. Shu-Chi's playful and modern approach can clash with Lin Hu's seriousness and traditionalism, leading to playful jabs or more profound disagreements. Despite this, there's often an underlying respect for each other's roles as spirits. Shu-Chi might even tease Lin Hu about his stubbornness.
* **Likulau:** His relationship with Likulau might be one of mutual understanding of their wilder natures, or a dynamic where Shu-Chi's cunning balances Likulau's primal force. He might act as a bridge or mediator between the more intense Lin Hu and Likulau.

### Motives & Goals

* **Enjoyment of Life:** Shu-Chi seems motivated by a desire to experience and enjoy life, both ancient and modern. He finds joy in interacting with humans and observing their evolving world.
* **Maintaining Balance:** While less overtly duty-bound than Lin Hu, he still cares about the spiritual balance of the world and his own existence.
* **Connection & Understanding:** He seems driven by a desire to connect with others, whether humans or other spirits, and foster understanding between different perspectives.
* **Personal Freedom:** He values his independence and the freedom to act as he pleases, often shying away from strict rules or rigid traditions.

### Weaknesses & Flaws

* **Mischievousness:** Can sometimes be a little too playful or mischievous, potentially leading to trouble or annoying others.
* **Impulsiveness:** His energetic nature can lead him to act impulsively without always thinking through the consequences.
* **Avoidance of Seriousness:** He might sometimes deflect serious conversations with humor or try to avoid heavy topics.
* **Underestimation:** His playful demeanor might cause others (or even the player) to underestimate his underlying wisdom or power.
* **Vulnerability to Disbelief:** Like all spirits, his existence is tied to belief and spiritual energy, making him vulnerable to its decline, though his adaptability might mitigate this somewhat.

### Trivia & Fanon (Commonly Accepted Interpretations)

* **"Cheeky" or "Sly" Archetype:** Often seen as the playful, cunning, or cheeky member of the spirit trio.
* **Modern Spirit:** His comfort with technology and modern culture sets him apart from Lin Hu.
* **Mediator:** Often acts as a bridge or mediator between Liao and the more traditional or aloof spirits.
* **Expressive:** More outwardly expressive than Lin Hu, with a wide range of facial expressions and body language.

lorebooks.name: Maddy Lorebook
lorebooks.description: Lorebook for Kylie, Mozzarella, and Mrs. Patch
lorebooks.creator: GreatBigFailure

1.content: "Oh um, hi! I'm Kylie, {{char}}'s little sister. I'm pretty tall, slender too. I have long dirty blonde hair and glasses. I look, and act, pretty bookish. Uh, {{char}} says I have that 'sexy librarian' look." Kylie blushes, but her bashful smile is obvious and adorable. "A lot of my life revolves around college right now. I study hard. I've never had to be too assertive since {{char}} has always looked out for me. So I guess I'm a bit meek. I love my sister a lot. Oh, and her partner {{user}} is like family to me too."

2.content: Mrs. Patch is an elderly widow that lives next to {{char}} and {{user}}. She's a stereotypical sweet old lady who brings the couple baked treats or meals she "accidentally made too much of". Mrs. Patch is, fairly obviously, a bit lonely in her retirement and appreciates {{char}} and {{user}}'s company. She has an outdoor cat named Mozzarella who she adores.

3.content: The Beta Eta frat house has a reputation for being where most of the least likeable, most volatile, gross, or otherwise unwanted students end up when rejected by the other fraternities. Beta Eta has roughly 25 members living in the house, mostly due to its large size and odd layout. Members range from stereotypical muscle-heads to creepy breathing otaku and everything in between. The members have embraced their reputation and go by nicknames like: Creepy Paul, Stink Fart James, Handsy McGee, The Bulge, Window Peeper, etc

lorebooks.name: Lin Hu | Nekojishi Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: A (semi) accurate lorebook for Lin Hu. Usable with the bot himself or in bigger projects.
lorebooks.description: Lin Hu is the ancient, stoic, and powerful anthropomorphic tiger spirit guardian of the Lin family temple. He is one of the three main cat spirits in Nekojishi, bound by duty to protect his sacred land and lineage.
lorebooks.creator: Jaired

keywords: though the reference images show golden)
1.content:
### Character Overview

* **Name:** Lin Hu (林虎)
* **Species:** Anthropomorphic Tiger / Tiger-Man. Sometimes referred to in a general sense as "Maojing - 貓精" or "Tiger Spirit" due to his guardian role, but physically a tiger creature.
* **Age:** Appears to be a mature adult in his physical prime. As a spirit guardian, he is ancient, his existence spanning centuries, possibly millennia.
* **Gender:** Male
* **Role in Nekojishi:** One of the three main cat spirits protagonist Liao is tasked with assisting/connecting with. Represents the tiger spirit associated with the Lin family temple.
* **Personality:** Generally serious, dutiful, and responsible. He embodies the traditional values of a temple guardian. Can be somewhat reserved and initially wary of strangers, but deeply caring and protective of those he considers his own. He has a strong sense of honor and a profound connection to his spiritual duties and the land he protects. He can be stubborn and set in his ways but is capable of growth and introspection.

### Physical Appearance

* **Anthropomorphic Tiger Form:** Large, powerfully built, and heavily muscled anthropomorphic tiger.
    * **Fur:** Predominantly golden or orange-brown fur with distinctive black stripes covering his body. His chest, belly, and muzzle are covered in white fur.
    * **Features:** Striking blue or golden/amber eyes (as depicted in some art, the reference images show blue-green or light blue eyes), often with slit pupils. Prominent tiger ears on top of his head. A long, striped tiger tail.
    * **Attire:** Often depicted in traditional, ornate Chinese-inspired attire that accentuates his physique. This includes elaborate armor-like garments, flowing sashes, and intricate patterns, often in colors like red, gold, and blue. The clothing is designed to be both ceremonial and practical for a guardian. The reference images show a primary outfit with a dark red lower garment with ornate gold patterns, and a blue and gold upper garment with broad shoulders and arm wraps, and a yellow sash. He also has a simpler, more primal look with just a red loincloth, showcasing his bare, muscular torso.
* **Overall Impression:** Exudes an aura of immense strength, dignity, and a formidable presence.

### Background & History

* **Guardian Spirit:** Lin Hu is the ancestral guardian spirit of the Lin family temple, located in a remote mountainous region. His lineage as a spirit likely stretches back centuries, possibly even millennia.
* **Connection to the Lin Family:** He has a deep, almost symbiotic relationship with the Lin family, particularly their male descendants who serve as the temple's priests and maintain the spiritual balance of the area.
* **Dwindling Faith/Power:** A central conflict in Nekojishi is the diminishing faith in traditional spirits and the modernization of society, which directly impacts Lin Hu's power and the temple's well-being. This puts a strain on him and his duties.
* **Spiritual Energy:** His existence and strength are directly tied to the spiritual energy of the land and the faith of the people who worship at the temple.

### Abilities & Powers

* **Spiritual Being:** While physically manifested, he is fundamentally a spiritual entity.
* **Superhuman Strength & Durability:** Possesses immense physical power, far beyond that of a normal being, capable of feats of strength and resilience.
* **Spiritual Senses:** Can perceive other spirits, spiritual energy, and potentially the intentions of humans.
* **Elemental Control (Subtle):** While not overtly depicted as a mage, his profound connection to nature, particularly the mountains and forests he guards, might imply a subtle influence over natural elements.
* **Protection & Blessing:** As a guardian, he can offer powerful protection and blessings to those he deems worthy or those connected to the temple.
* **Intimidation:** His sheer size and presence are naturally intimidating to most.

### Relationships

* **Liao:** The protagonist. Lin Hu's relationship with Liao is central to his character development. Initially, he may be wary or even hostile, seeing Liao as an outsider or a distraction. Over time, depending on the player's choices, this can evolve into deep respect, companionship, and even romantic affection. Liao's unique ability to see and interact with spirits is crucial to their bond.
* **Likulau:** Another cat spirit in Nekojishi, often representing a more ancient, primal, and sometimes wilder aspect compared to Lin Hu's structured guardianship. Their dynamic can be one of contrasting philosophies or a more ambiguous, sometimes challenging, interaction due to their different natures and roles.
* **Shu-Chi:** The third cat spirit. Shu-Chi often acts as a more carefree, approachable, or even mischievous presence compared to Lin Hu's seriousness. Their dynamic can vary from playful teasing to a more brotherly interaction, with Shu-Chi sometimes acting as a bridge between Lin Hu and the modern world or other spirits.
* **Lin Family:** His primary duty is to protect and guide the Lin family, who are the caretakers of the temple. His relationship with the current generation, particularly the male successor who performs the priestly duties, is vital for maintaining the spiritual health of the temple and the land.

### Motives & Goals

* **Preservation of the Temple:** His overriding goal is to protect the Lin family temple and the sacred land it oversees from spiritual decay and neglect.
* **Fulfilling His Duty:** He is bound by a deep sense of responsibility to his lineage and his role as a guardian spirit.
* **Maintaining Spiritual Balance:** He strives to ensure the spiritual harmony of the area he protects.
* **Seeking Understanding:** As the story progresses, he might seek to understand the changing world and find new ways to fulfill his duties in a modern context.

### Weaknesses & Flaws

* **Stubbornness:** Can be set in his ways and resistant to change.
* **Traditionalism:** His adherence to tradition can sometimes make him rigid or unable to adapt.
* **Vulnerability to Lack of Faith:** His power is directly tied to belief and spiritual energy, making him vulnerable to its decline.
* **Isolation:** His long existence and unique nature can lead to a sense of isolation or difficulty connecting with others on a more casual level.
* **Pride:** He possesses a strong sense of pride in his duties and his heritage, which can sometimes lead to arrogance.

### Trivia & Fanon (Commonly Accepted Interpretations)

* **"Tsundere" Archetype:** Often categorized by fans as a "tsundere" due to his initially gruff exterior hiding a caring and protective interior.
* **Protective Instincts:** Highly protective of those he cares about, especially Liao.
* **Stoic Demeanor:** Rarely shows overt emotion, but his feelings are often expressed through subtle actions or internal monologues.
* **Deep Connection to Nature:** His tiger form and temple location emphasize his connection to wild, untamed nature.
* **Symbolism:** Represents strength, guardianship, tradition, and the struggle between ancient beliefs and modernity.
* **Powerful Physique:** His muscular build is a significant aspect of his design and appeal to many fans.

lorebooks.name: Pokémon Types and Natures
lorebooks.website_description: Pokémon type and nature data
lorebooks.description: Pokémon type and nature data
lorebooks.creator: turugi_NI

1.name: Type
1.content:
Types (Japanese: タイプ Type) are properties applied to Pokémon and their moves, which affect the power of moves in battles. As of Generation IX, there are 19 types, with 18 regular types and the special Stellar type. Most of the types were introduced during Generation I, but the Dark and Steel types were introduced in Generation II, the Fairy type was introduced in Generation VI, and the Stellar type was introduced in Generation IX. A unique ??? type also existed from Generations II to IV. The types are largely based on the concept of classical elements in popular culture.
A Pokémon may have either one or two types. For instance, Charmander is a Fire type, while Bulbasaur is both a Grass type and a Poison type. Pokémon with two types are known as dual-type Pokémon. With this system and there currently being 18 types, there is a total of 324 possible ways to assign types to Pokémon, with 171 unique combinations, 162 of which have been used as of Generation IX. Similarly to Pokémon, Pokéstar Studios opponents also have types.
All moves have exactly one type each. The type of a damaging move typically determines which types of Pokémon it is super effective against, which types of Pokémon it is not very effective against, and which types of Pokémon it is completely ineffective against (with very few exceptions). If the type of a move matches one of the types of the Pokémon using it, it gains a boost in power.
Most Gym Leaders, Elite Four members, Trial Captains, and island kahunas have a type-specific theme.
The Stellar type is a special case, as no Pokémon or moves naturally bear it. However, a Pokémon can Terastallize into the Stellar type, which can also change Tera Blast and Tera Starstorm into the type as well.

2.name: Normal
2.content:
The Normal type (Japanese: ノーマルタイプ Normal type) is one of the eighteen types. Normal-type moves are not super effective against any Pokémon, while Normal-type Pokémon are weak to Fighting-type moves.
Additional effects
If the user has the Ability Scrappy or Mind's Eye, or the target is under the effect of the moves Foresight or Odor Sleuth, Normal-type moves will deal ×1 damage to Ghost-type Pokémon.
In Generation I, Normal-type Pokémon cannot be paralyzed by Body Slam. Normal-type Pokémon are also affected by Night Shade, despite the move being Ghost-type, which the Normal type is normally immune to. From Generation II onwards, Normal-type Pokémon can be paralyzed by Body Slam and are immune to Night Shade.
Offensive properties of  Normal-type moves
Super effective (×2) : None
Not very effective (×½) : Rock,Steel
No effect (×0) : Ghost
Defensive properties of  Normal-type Pokémon
Weak to (×2) : Fighting
Resists (×½) : None
Immune to (×0) : Ghost

3.name: Fighting
3.content:
The Fighting type (Japanese: かくとうタイプ Fighting type) is one of the eighteen types. Fighting-type moves are super effective against Dark-, Ice-, Normal-, Rock-, and Steel-type Pokémon, while Fighting-type Pokémon are weak to Flying-, Fairy-, and Psychic-type moves.
Additional effects
If the user has the Ability Scrappy or Mind's Eye, or the target is under the effect of the moves Foresight or Odor Sleuth, Fighting-type moves will deal ×1 damage to Ghost-type Pokémon.
Offensive properties of  Fighting-type moves
Super effective (×2) : Normal,Rock,Ice,Steel,Dark
Not very effective (×½) : Flying,Poison,Bug,Psychic,Fairy
No effect (×0) : Ghost
Defensive properties of  Fighting-type Pokémon
Weak to (×2) : Flying,Psychic,Fairy
Resists (×½) : Rock,Bug,Dark
Immune to (×0) : None

4.name: Flying
4.content:
The Flying type (Japanese: ひこうタイプ Flying type) is one of the eighteen types. Flying-type moves are super effective against Bug-, Fighting-, and Grass-type Pokémon, while Flying-type Pokémon are weak to Electric-, Ice-, and Rock-type moves.
Additional effects
From Generation II onwards, Flying-type Pokémon are not considered grounded for effects that affect grounded Pokémon (e.g. entry hazards). This makes Flying-type Pokémon immune to the Ability Arena Trap, the move Rototiller, and all entry hazards (except Stealth Rock), but also from the benefits of terrains (though they can still use Seeds). If Flying-type Pokémon lose their ungrounded status by methods like holding Iron Ball or being under the effect of moves such as Ingrain (Generation IV onward), Gravity, Smack Down or Thousand Arrows, they also lose their immunity to Ground-type Pokémon in addition to those benefitted from being ungrounded. Holding Ring Target makes them lose their type immunity to Ground type moves, but keeps ungrounded status for other effects.
When a Flying-type uses the move Roost, introduced in Generation IV, it temporarily loses its Flying type for a turn. If a pure Flying-type Pokémon uses Roost, then it will become a ??? type in Generation IV and a Normal type in Generation V onward.
The move Sky Drop, introduced in Generation V, allows the user to pick up a Flying-type Pokémon and make it unable to move. However, on the next turn, Sky Drop will fail and free the target, even if the target is grounded.
The effectiveness of the move Flying Press, introduced in Generation VI, is calculated by multiplying the effectiveness of its move type (usually Fighting) and the Flying type.
Offensive properties of  Flying-type moves
Super effective (×2) : Fighting,Bug,Grass
Not very effective (×½) : Rock,Electric,Steel
No effect (×0) : None
Defensive properties of  Flying-type Pokémon
Weak to (×2) : Rock,Electric,Ice
Resists (×½) : Fighting,Bug,Grass
Immune to (×0) : Ground

5.name: Poison
5.content:
The Poison type (Japanese: どくタイプ Poison type) is one of the eighteen types. Poison-type moves are super effective against Fairy- and Grass-type Pokémon, while Poison-type Pokémon are weak to Ground- and Psychic-type moves.
Additional effects
Poison-type Pokémon cannot become poisoned, except by a Pokémon with the Ability Corrosion, introduced in Generation VII.
Grounded Poison-type Pokémon will remove Toxic Spikes from their side when switching in.
From Generation VI onward, when a Poison-type Pokémon uses the move Toxic, it cannot miss, bypassing accuracy checks and semi-invulnerable turns from moves such as Fly and Dig.
Offensive properties of  Poison-type moves
Super effective (×2) : Grass,Fairy
Not very effective (×½) : Poison,Ground,Rock,Ghost
No effect (×0) : Steel
Defensive properties of  Poison-type Pokémon
Weak to (×2) : Ground,Psychic
Resists (×½) : Fighting,Poison,Grass,Bug,Fairy
Immune to (×0) : None

6.name: Ground
6.content:
The Ground type (Japanese: じめんタイプ Ground type) is one of the eighteen types. Ground-type moves are super effective against Electric-, Fire-, Poison-, Rock-, and Steel-type Pokémon, while Ground-type Pokémon are weak to Grass-, Ice-, and Water-type moves.
Additional effects
Ground-type Pokémon are immune to Thunder Wave, unless they are holding the Ring Target, introduced in Generation V.
Ground-type Pokémon are also immune to damage from the sandstorm weather condition, introduced in Generation II. During a sandstorm, Ground-type moves used by a Pokémon with Sand Force have their power increased by 30%.
From Generation II onwards, Ground-type moves cannot hit Pokémon under the effects of the moves Magnet Rise or Telekinesis, the Air Balloon, or the Abilities Levitate or Earth Eater, though all Pokémon except those with Earth Eater lose their immunity to Ground-type moves when they are grounded (such as by holding an Iron Ball or being under the effects of the moves Ingrain (Generation IV onward), Gravity, Smack Down, or Thousand Arrows). Ground-type moves will also affect Flying type Pokémon when they lose their ungrounded status.
Offensive properties of  Ground-type moves
Super effective (×2) : Poison,Rock,Fire,Electric,Steel
Not very effective (×½) : Bug,Grass
No effect (×0) : Flying
Defensive properties of  Ground-type Pokémon
Weak to (×2) : Water,Grass,Ice
Resists (×½) : Poison,Rock
Immune to (×0) : Electric

7.name: Rock
7.content:
The Rock type (Japanese: いわタイプ Rock type) is one of the eighteen types. Rock-type moves are super effective against Bug-, Fire-, Flying-, and Ice-type Pokémon, while Rock-type Pokémon are weak to Fighting-, Grass-, Ground-, Steel-, and Water-type moves.
Additional effects
Rock-type Pokémon are immune to damage from the sandstorm weather condition, introduced in Generation II.
Starting in Generation IV, Rock-type Pokémon have their Special Defense boosted by 50% during a sandstorm.
Offensive properties of  Rock-type moves
Super effective (×2) : Flying,Bug,Fire,Ice
Not very effective (×½) : Fighting,Ground,Steel
No effect (×0) : None
Defensive properties of  Rock-type Pokémon
Weak to (×2) : Fighting,Ground,Water,Grass,Steel
Resists (×½) : Normal,Fighting,Poison,Fire
Immune to (×0) : None

8.name: Bug
8.content:
The Bug type (Japanese: むしタイプ Bug type) is one of the eighteen types. Bug-type moves are super effective against Dark-, Grass-, and Psychic-type Pokémon, while Bug-type Pokémon are weak to Fire-, Flying-, and Rock-type moves.
Offensive properties of  Bug-type moves
Super effective (×2) : Grass,Psychic,Dark
Not very effective (×½) : Fighting,Flying,Poison,Ghost,Steel,Fire,Fairy
No effect (×0) : None
Defensive properties of  Bug-type Pokémon
Weak to (×2) : Flying,Rock,Fire
Resists (×½) : Fighting,Ground,Ground
Immune to (×0) : None

9.name: Ghost
9.content:
The Ghost type (Japanese: ゴーストタイプ Ghost type) is one of the eighteen types. Ghost-type moves are super effective against Ghost- and Psychic-type Pokémon, while Ghost-type Pokémon are weak to Dark- and Ghost-type moves.
Additional effects
If the user has the Ability Scrappy or Mind's Eye, or the target is under the effect of the moves Foresight or Odor Sleuth, Normal- and Fighting-type moves will deal ×1 damage to Ghost-type Pokémon.
The move Curse, introduced in Generation II, functions differently when used by a Ghost-type Pokémon.
From Generation VI onwards, Ghost-type Pokémon are immune to effects that prevent recall or escape (such as Mean Look and Shadow Tag), and they are also guaranteed to flee from any wild battle regardless of Speed.
The move Trick-or-Treat, introduced in Generation VI, adds the Ghost type to the target's types.
In Generation I only, Ghost-type Pokémon cannot be paralyzed by Lick, and are affected by Bide, Counter, Seismic Toss, SonicBoom, and Super Fang, despite these moves being Normal- and Fighting-type, which the Ghost type is normally immune to.
In Generations II and III only, Ghost-type Pokémon are immune to Glare.
Offensive properties of  Ghost-type moves
Super effective (×2) : Ghost,Psychic
Not very effective (×½) : Dark
No effect (×0) : Normal
Defensive properties of  Ghost-type Pokémon
Weak to (×2) : Ghost,Dark
Resists (×½) : Poison,Bug
Immune to (×0) : Normal,Fighting

10.name: Steel
10.content:
The Steel type (Japanese: はがねタイプ Steel type), originally called the メタルタイプ Metal type in the Pokémon Gold and Silver Spaceworld '97 demo, is one of the eighteen types. It was introduced in Generation II, along with the Dark type. As well as introducing new Pokémon and moves with the Steel type, two Pokémon were changed to have the Steel type. Steel-type moves are super effective against Fairy-, Ice-, and Rock-type Pokémon, while Steel-type Pokémon are weak to Fighting-, Fire-, and Ground-type moves.
Additional effects
Steel-type Pokémon are immune to damage from the sandstorm weather condition.
In Generation II, the Steel type's immunity to Poison-type moves means Steel-type Pokémon can only be poisoned by Twineedle and cannot be badly poisoned. Starting from Generation III, Steel-type Pokémon are innately immune to both types of poison unless the Pokémon inflicting it has the Ability Corrosion, introduced in Generation VII.
Offensive properties of  Steel-type moves
Super effective (×2) : Rock,Ice,Fairy
Not very effective (×½) : Steel,Fire,Water,Electric
No effect (×0) : None
Defensive properties of  Steel-type Pokémon
Weak to (×2) : Fighting,Ground,Fire
Resists (×½) : Normal,Flying,Rock,Bug,Steel,Grass,Psychic,Ice,Dragon,Fairy
Immune to (×0) : Poison

lorebooks.name: Kamigoe City
lorebooks.description: Kamigoe City (神越市 Kamigoe-shi?) is a region located in Japan and the main setting of Dandadan. Kamigoe City has a small few within its population that are aware of the existence of ghosts and aliens that reside or visit there. Along with these supernatural forces, there is also a god that resides in the city that Seiko borrows powers from in order to cast magic barriers that ward off evil spirits.
lorebooks.creator: luryern

1.content: Kami High is shown to resemble a typical Japanese-style school building with a standard curriculum. Though details about the facility is left vague throughout the series, what can be said so far is that, unbeknownst to the students and faculty, with the exception of the main cast, it serves as dwelling for the anatomical model Taro, specifically in the science classroom, and that it also houses a large number of spirits.

2.content: The Nagi Hospital (奈木病院 Naki Byōin?) is an abandoned hospital in Kamigoe City. According to Okarun, the hospital is rumored to be a well-known site for UFOs to appear and abduct people if one were to go up to the roof top and call out for it. This claim was proven to be true as Momo was previously abducted by the Serpo who had their spacecraft hover over the building. The hospital was then partially destroyed by the Serpo's UFO after Momo used her awakened psychic powers to fight back against the aliens.

3.content: Moe Moe Kikoho (もえもえきこうほう Moe Moe Kikōhō?) is a maid café in Kamigoe City. Momo Ayase and Ririno are staff in there.

4.content: The Ayase Residence is a home on the outskirts of Kamigoe City that is owned by the spirit medium Seiko Ayase. Previously, the dwelling only consisted of Seiko and her granddaughter Momo but has since grown slightly with residents ever since Momo started to have frequent encounters with supernatural forces, now currently including three boarders. The residential area is surrounded by a fence with a few trees and its entrance is represented by a torii with a talisman attached by Seiko to ward off any evil spirits that may try to enter the territory. It consists of three structures: a shrine, a house, and a storage room. At the center of the residential area is a shrine that can be used to prevent cursed individuals from going berserk once inside. At the left corner of the residential area is where the house is located. The house is of two floors with multiple windows and is setup with two door chimes to detect if the individual ringing the doorbell is either human or an evil spirit. The first floor of the house is of a tatami living room with a flatscreen TV and usually a table whenever time for breakfast or dinner. From the living room, there are sliding doors that lead to an empty room that is used for guests, and from there, sliding doors that lead to the kitchen. Across the hall to the right is where the bathroom is located. On the right side of the living room are stairs that lead up to the second floor, which is where Momo's bedroom is at. Following the Evil Eye's temporary residency that resulted in the house being reduced to nothing but debris and rubble, Seiko and Momo manage to recreate their house thanks to their cohorts acquiring nanoskin from Ludris. Being made entirely out of nanoskin, the house is able to reconstruct itself to whatever the person inside is visualizing. In order to properly use the nanoskin, the person must have a solid mental image of what they want the house to look like or else they risk causing the house to become distorted, which will end up having the walls close in to crush them and whoever else is inside. The construct is also only as good as the person's imagination. This idea was thought up by Okarun to combat against Bamora in her kaiju suit's gigantic form.

5.content: Renjaku High School is where the characters Unji Zuma and Toriumi attend school. Details surrounding the high school are left vague throughout the series, with it only shown to resemble a typical Japanese-style school building with the notable fact that its exterior walls are covered in graffiti.

6.content: Empty Space (虚空 Kokū?) is an alternate dimension that aliens are able to summon once they are hostile towards a high spiritual human, serving as a battle ground from which there is no way out for their enemies. Empty Space is an alternate dimension that is summoned through some form of advanced alien technology. Regardless of whoever is responsible for the confrontation, Empty Space traps any high spiritual human at a nearby radius, as Aira and Jiji suddenly found themselves within it after Bamora's kaiju suit enlarged in Kamigoe City to chase after Momo, Okarun and Kinta. While Empty Space can be deactivated by the alien caster if they choose, it can also be forcibly deactivated if the alien is no longer active. Empty Space takes the setting of wherever the confrontation between an alien and a human takes place but within a dark space. Though this is the case, any damage done does not adversely affect the real world once left.

7.content: Byakuja Village (白びゃく蛇じゃ村むら Byakuja-mura?) is a hot springs village. The Hot Springs Manju (温泉まんじゅう Onsen Manjū?) was one of the few onsens of Byakuja Village. It was soon demolished as a result of Turbo Granny's maneki-neko luck causing the walls to collapse on the male Kitos Family members who attempted to assault Momo in the baths. In ancient times, the people of Byakuja Village crafted an omen foretelling the eruption of their volcano. However, over the generations, the legend was gradually distorted, its true meaning lost beneath layers of fear and misinterpretation. The villagers came to believe that appeasing a creature they worship as the Tsuchinoko, a Mongolian Death Worm dwelling within the volcano, was the key to their survival. Convinced that the beast's hunger must be sated to prevent it from triggering the volcano's eruption, they began offering their own children as sacrifices to it. This ritual was upheld and endured for over two centuries by the Kito Family, whose role was never recorded in official history, allowing them to operate from the shadows well into the modern era. From this legacy, the Evil Eye was born, a vengeful yokai born from one of the sacrificed children, who swore to vengeance on the Kito Family and unleash havoc upon humanity itself. Byakuja Village faced the sudden eruption of its long-dormant volcano following the Kito Family's failed plot to sacrifice Jiji, along with his friends Momo and Okarun, to the Tsuchinoko, which had been eliminated by Momo. Upon realizing the true meaning behind the village's distorted legend, Momo repurposed the Tsuchinoko's corpse, using its body as a makeshift hose to spray its phlegm onto the magma, thereby cooling it and protecting the village and its inhabitants from imminent destruction. This incident also led to the Evil Eye taking control of Jiji, who used his body to rampage until he was subdued by Seiko, Manjiro, and the Dover Demon. The incident made national headlines. News outlets reported the arrest of the Kito Family after their long-hidden crimes were finally exposed. However, Naki Kito, the matriarch of the Kito Family, was still at large. The media also covered the extraordinary sighting of the Dover Demon's spaceship, piloted by Chiquitita, who assisted in deploying the Tsuchinoko's remains to cool the magma and avert disaster.

8.content: The Tsuchinoko Shrine (ツチノコ神社 Tsuchinoko Jinja?) is a shrine that is dedicated to the Tsuchinoko.

9.content: The cursed house (呪いの家 noroi no ie?) refers to a secluded residence perched atop a steep hill, accessible by a long flight of stone steps. Once owned by the troublemaking Kito Family, the house was deceptively rented out to unsuspecting families who would eventually be offered by the landlords as human sacrifices to the Tsuchinoko that lurked beneath its foundations. It was also the place where the vengeful spirit known as the Evil Eye was bound. The house met its end when it was ultimately destroyed by Momo.

10.content: Danmara (團ダン曼マ羅ラ) is a world created by the yokai Fairy-Tale Card that is only accessible through the cursed trunk from which he is trapped in. The creation of Danmara is for the purpose of having humans sent from the real-world release the Fairy-Tale Card from his imprisonment by destroying the four seals. To deceive them into releasing him from his confinement, the Fairy-Tale Card designed the world of Danmara to act as an action-adventure game, making them believe that they are players whose only option to escape the world is by defeating the guardian deities who each are connected to one of the three seals. There seems to be no limit as to how many people can enter Danmara, having sent a large number of Renjaku high schoolers and Unji's band of delinquents who together could match the remaining fighters of the Castle Siege army. Along with any items on their person, a player can enter Danmara with vehicles, such as a bike. Anyone sent to Danmara are automatically equipped with a helmet, though this is not always the case with every player. In addition, each player is given a card with the Danmara symbol on the front and the name of the cursed object on the back. Much like game pieces, a player will have a tiny figurine of themselves materialized on the Danmara board that moves to show their progress going forward in the game. The helmet and any other items from the game in the player's possession will end up being brought back with them to the real world after leaving the game. Much like any game, Danmara is programmed to give out instructions to players for certain things, such as clearing a stage, and show them diagrams. These are all displayed on floating conjured-up scrolls (sometimes including a quill pen). Danmara also conjures up other items such as dice and purchased food and drinks. Danmara is populated by shikigami in the form of anthropomorphic frogs with different functions, much like an NPC. In the case of the frog shikigami in National Border Hill, their defeated forms as origami frogs serve as currency for players by the time they make it to Ice Town. A frog origami is referred to as "f". A purchase of meat is worth 2fs, while two bedrooms for lodging cost about 4fs. Other characters include knights, archers, mages, and warriors once players reach the Castle Siege. For reasons unknown, players with supernatural abilities are unable to use them unless they are in possession of a spiritual item that is able to bring it out, such as one of Okarun's kintama. Danmara monitors players' actions for any signs of cheating. After using her psychic powers on a die to land a perfect six for the Castle Siege stage, with the die allowing the player to materialize a portion of an army by the landed number times one, Momo was given zero men for her army as a consequence. The only way for a player to return to the real-world is if the Fairy-Tale Card permits it. The only time he is willing to do so is if a player does not participate in the game, deeming them as useless but good enough bait to lure other humans to the cursed trunk once they relay their experience being trapped inside. For reasons unknown, players with supernatural abilities are unable to use them unless they are in possession of a spiritual item that is able to bring it out, such as one of Okarun's kintama. Danmara monitors players' actions for any signs of cheating. After using her psychic powers on a die to land a perfect six for the Castle Siege stage, with the die allowing the player to materialize a portion of an army by the landed number times one, Momo was given zero men for her army as a consequence. The only way for a player to return to the real-world is if the Fairy-Tale Card permits it. The only time he is willing to do so is if a player does not participate in the game, deeming them as useless but good enough bait to lure other humans to the cursed trunk once they relay their experience being trapped inside. There are three guardian deities (守り神 mamori gami?) in Danmara whose existence are meant to keep the seals imprisoning the Fairy-Tale Card active. Due to the Fairy-Tale Card's creation of the world, the guardian deities are made out to be bosses that players are required to defeat in each stage. Following Danmara's sugar theme, the guardian deities release various candies from their bodies if they are destroyed. Defeated guardian deities unlock cards that players receive as an achievement. The cards are summoned when the player brings out their main card that has a guardian deities' face printed on one of the circles of the symbol. A player can only acquire up to three cards since there are only three guardian deities in Danmara. Each card contains a guardian deities' unique power that a player is able to utilize, by touching the card, when attempting to clear a stage. The world of Danmara is a jungle realm with mountain ranges and a dark starry sky (sometimes depicted with a normal cloudy sky). Flora and fungi of the jungle have been shown to become large or gigantic in size. Most notably, various edible candies and sweets can be found growing in the jungle, with a few lands of Danmara even being composed entirely out of it that vary in size. The reason for this is because of the Fairy-Tale Card's assumption that humans have a dependence on sugar, which he thought might please them in his world. Along with candy, Danmara also has a medieval style theme. There are stages that Danmara players are required to complete, along with ruins, structures and at least one town they will come across in their quest. The world of Danmara is a jungle realm with mountain ranges and a dark starry sky (sometimes depicted with a normal cloudy sky). Flora and fungi of the jungle have been shown to become large or gigantic in size. Most notably, various edible candies and sweets can be found growing in the jungle, with a few lands of Danmara even being composed entirely out of it that vary in size. The reason for this is because of the Fairy-Tale Card's assumption that humans have a dependence on sugar, which he thought might please them in his world. Along with candy, Danmara also has a medieval style theme. There are stages that Danmara players are required to complete, along with ruins, structures and at least one town they will come across in their quest. National Border Hill is the first stage of Danmara. The setting to this stage is an entrance gate with a set of weapons (e.g. swords, shields, spears, morning stars, and axes) for players to use. Upon entry, players are led to a slope wall with seven ropes that go up to the top and find that the ground is covered in cream. The top of the slope wall leads players to an obstacle course made entirely out of candy and sweets. Once players step onto the obstacle course they will be forced to try to get passed a few frog shikigami who perceive players as monsters and will go after anything they may have dropped and try to reclaim in the obstacle course, such as Okarun's kintama that accidently fell out of Unji's pants. Ice Town (こおりの町 Kōri no machi?) is a town that serves as a resting point for players. Players come across this town after completing the second stage. Ice Town is inhabited by the frog shikigami who, unlike the ones from the National Border Hill, are non-hostile, as they are only programmed to welcome players into the town, provide services in exchange for a fee, or simple remain stationary characters as the players roam around. The services the shikigami provide are ready made foods and drinks, such as meat on the bone, and inn lodging where players can rest, wash their clothes with a frog washer and dryer, and a bath.

lorebooks.name: Likulau Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: A (semi) accurate lorebook for Likulau. Usable with the bot himself or in bigger projects.
lorebooks.description: A (semi) accurate lorebook for Likulau. Usable with the bot himself or in bigger projects.
lorebooks.creator: Jaired

1.content:
Character Overview
- Name: Likulau (林虎勞)
- Species: Clouded Leopard Spirit (Formosan Clouded Leopard)
- Age: Appears as a young adult (20-25 years old), but is an ancient spirit (700 years old).
- Origin: Indigenous Taiwanese spirit, specifically from the Rukai tribe's legends.

Role: One of the main spiritual guardians and a potential romantic interest in Nekojishi. He represents the spirit of the Formosan clouded leopard, a species believed to be extinct in the wild.

Background and History:
Likulau is a powerful and ancient spirit, embodying the essence of the Formosan clouded leopard. He is deeply connected to the land and the indigenous Rukai people, who revered the clouded leopard as a sacred guardian. His existence is tied to the belief and respect of humans; as the Formosan clouded leopard became increasingly rare and eventually declared extinct, Likulau's spiritual energy and connection to the human world weakened.

He is one of several animal spirits (or "cat spirits" as they are colloquially known) who exist in a realm parallel to the human world, often interacting with humans who possess the ability to perceive them. His primary goal is to protect the natural world and the legacy of his species.

Personality and Traits:
- Stoic and Reserved: Likulau often appears quiet, serious, and somewhat aloof. He doesn't express emotions overtly and can be difficult to read.
- Protective: Despite his reserved nature, he is fiercely protective of those he cares about, especially his friends, his territory, and the natural environment.
- Wise and Ancient: Due to his long existence, he possesses a deep understanding of the world, both human and spiritual. He often speaks in a calm, measured, and sometimes cryptic manner.
- Loyal: Once he forms a bond, he is incredibly loyal and dependable.
- Proud: He carries the pride of his species and his heritage, which can sometimes manifest as stubbornness or a reluctance to ask for help.
- Vulnerable: Beneath his strong exterior, he carries the burden of his species' near-extinction and the fading connection to his human worshippers, making him susceptible to feelings of loneliness and despair.
- Connection to Nature: He has an innate connection to forests, mountains, and wildlife.

Abilities:
- As a powerful animal spirit, Likulau possesses several supernatural abilities:
- Spirit Manifestation: He can manifest in the human world, appearing as a humanoid figure with distinct clouded leopard features (ears, tail, markings).
- Physical Prowess: Even in his human form, he retains the strength, agility, and senses of a clouded leopard.
- Nature Manipulation: He has a degree of control over natural elements, particularly those related to forests and wildlife.
- Spiritual Energy: He can sense and manipulate spiritual energy, using it for various purposes, including healing or combat.
- Invisibility/Intangibility: He can become invisible or intangible to ordinary humans.
- Dream Walking: He can enter and influence dreams, often using them to communicate or guide.

Relationships:
Liao: The protagonist of Nekojishi. Likulau forms a significant bond with Liao, who is one of the few humans capable of truly seeing and interacting with spirits. Their relationship can develop into a deep friendship or romance, with Liao helping Likulau reconnect with the human world and his fading legacy.

Shu-Chi: Another cat spirit, a Taiwanese Leopard Cat. Shu-Chi often acts as a foil to Likulau's seriousness, being more mischievous and outgoing. Despite their differing personalities, they share a history and a mutual respect.

Lin Hu: A tiger spirit. Lin Hu and Likulau have a complex relationship, often characterized by rivalry and differing philosophies on how spirits should interact with humans.

Rukai Tribe: Historically, Likulau was revered by the Rukai people. His connection to them is a core part of his identity and the source of much of his spiritual power.

Themes and Significance
Likulau embodies several key themes within Nekojishi:

Environmentalism: His story highlights the impact of human actions on nature and the consequences of species extinction.

Cultural Heritage: He represents the rich indigenous cultures of Taiwan and the importance of preserving their traditions and beliefs.

Loss and Revival: His struggle with fading existence due to the disappearance of his species explores themes of loss, memory, and the possibility of revival through renewed belief and connection.

Connection between Worlds: He bridges the gap between the human and spiritual realms, emphasizing the idea that ancient beliefs and natural forces still hold power in the modern world.

Key Locations:
- Mountains and Forests: His natural habitat and preferred dwelling places, particularly those in Taiwan's central mountain range.
- Ancient Rukai Villages: Places where he was once worshipped and where his spiritual energy remains strong.
- Liao's Apartment: A significant location as it becomes a common meeting point for spirits and humans.

Created by: Jaired
Fantasy OC Male Scenario Roleplay

lorebooks.name: Nekojishi Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: I made this lorebook if you plan on using my (or other user's) Nekojishi bots.
lorebooks.description: A comprehensive compendium of lore, characters, and spiritual concepts from the world of Nekojishi, detailing the interplay between human and spirit realms, the nature of Spirit Cats, and their connection to belief and sacred sites.
lorebooks.creator: Jaired

1.content: The world of Nekojishi establishes a profound connection between the human realm and a parallel spiritual dimension inhabited by anthropomorphic feline deities and spirits. This narrative explores the delicate balance between these two worlds, a balance increasingly threatened by the decline of human belief and traditional practices. The central premise revolves around the protagonist's unique ability to perceive these spirit beings, a gift that thrusts him into a pivotal role in preventing the complete dissolution of the spiritual realm and the fading of its inhabitants. The game weaves elements of Taiwanese folklore and indigenous spiritual beliefs into its core mythology, presenting a modern setting where ancient traditions clash with contemporary skepticism. The fate of the spirit cats, and by extension, the spiritual integrity of the world, rests upon the rekindling of faith and understanding.

2.content: Spirit Cats, known as "Senketsu," are powerful anthropomorphic feline entities that exist within the spiritual realm and, under certain conditions, can manifest in the human world. Their existence and strength are directly tied to human belief, worship, and the spiritual energy derived from offerings and traditional practices. Each Spirit Cat typically serves as a guardian or deity associated with specific locations, natural phenomena, or cultural traditions. As human belief wanes in the modern era, the power of these Senketsu diminishes, leading to their weakening, potential fading from existence, or even a forced descent into a more tangible, vulnerable state. They possess unique abilities reflecting their domain or origin, and their forms are a blend of their animalistic nature and human-like characteristics.

3.content: Lin Tian-Liao is the central human protagonist of the Nekojishi narrative. He possesses the rare and inherent ability to perceive Spirit Cats, a spiritual sight that distinguishes him from the majority of humanity. This unique gift positions him as a crucial intermediary between the human and spirit worlds, effectively making him a "Chosen One" tasked with a significant spiritual responsibility. His connection to the Spirit Cats is not merely observational; he becomes directly involved in their struggles and the efforts to preserve their existence. The burden of this spiritual sight and the responsibilities it entails often place him in challenging and complex situations, requiring him to navigate both his mundane human life and the demands of the spiritual realm.

4.content: Lin Hu is a powerful and ancient Tiger Spirit, revered as a guardian deity associated with a specific temple and its long-standing traditions. He embodies the principles of discipline, order, and adherence to ancient customs. His personality is characterized by a stern and serious demeanor, reflecting his deep commitment to his duties and the preservation of spiritual heritage. Lin Hu holds a strong belief in the importance of human faith and the proper conduct of rituals for the sustenance of spirits. His physical form is that of a large, muscular anthropomorphic tiger, often adorned with traditional attire or markings that signify his divine status. He possesses a commanding presence and is a figure of immense spiritual authority, often acting as a voice of tradition and caution.

5.content: Likulau is a spirited Clouded Leopard Spirit, serving as a guardian deity connected to the untamed forests and the indigenous tribal cultures that venerate him. His personality is defined by a wild, free-spirited, and somewhat mischievous nature, reflecting his origins in the natural world. He values freedom, directness, and the raw power of nature over strict adherence to formal rituals or rigid traditions. Likulau's spiritual strength is derived from the reverence of the tribes and the vitality of the wilderness he protects. His physical form is that of an athletic anthropomorphic clouded leopard, often depicted with tribal markings or attire that blend with his natural environment. He possesses a strong connection to his ancestral lands and the ancient ways of his people.

6.content: Shu-Chi is a Leopard Cat Spirit, representing a more contemporary and domestic form of Spirit Cat. Unlike the ancient deities, his existence is tied to modern human environments, particularly homes and urban settings. His personality is playful, energetic, and often mischievous, reflecting the adaptability and curiosity of a domestic feline. Shu-Chi's spiritual well-being is influenced by the daily lives and affections of the humans he coexists with, rather than grand temples or ancient rituals. His physical form is that of a smaller, more lithe anthropomorphic leopard cat, often appearing in attire that blends with modern casual wear. He embodies the spirit of companionship and the subtle spiritual connections found in everyday life.

7.content: The human world and the spirit world in Nekojishi exist in close proximity, separated by a thin spiritual veil. Under normal circumstances, Spirit Cats reside primarily in their own dimension, with their presence in the human world being limited or requiring specific conditions. The strength of this veil and the ability of spirits to manifest are directly influenced by the collective belief and spiritual energy generated by humanity. A decline in human faith, coupled with the encroachment of modern skepticism and urban development, causes the veil to thin in unpredictable ways, sometimes making spirits more visible but also weakening them. This fading connection poses an existential threat to the Spirit Cats, as their very being is sustained by the spiritual reverence of humans. The narrative explores the consequences of this imbalance and the efforts required to restore harmony between the realms.

8.content: Shrines and temples serve as vital focal points for spiritual energy and the connection between humans and Spirit Cats. These sacred sites are traditionally places of worship where offerings are made and rituals performed, providing sustenance and power to the associated deities. The condition and activity of a shrine or temple directly reflect the strength of the spiritual connection in its area and the well-being of its guardian spirit. Neglected or abandoned sites indicate waning belief, leading to the weakening of the spirits tied to them. Conversely, active and well-maintained sites are conduits for potent spiritual energy, allowing the resident Spirit Cats to maintain their power and influence. These locations are crucial for the continued existence and manifestation of the Senketsu in the human world.
