1.content:
Vampires, also called Bloodsuckers, is the general term for those who suck the blood of other living creatures. As there are various blood-sucking creatures all over the world with various different characteristics, the term "bloodsucker" is used as a catch-all term. The terms "vampire" and "bloodsucker" are essentially synonymous in all cases except those regarded by the Holy Church as enemies. They specifically hunt those they deem as "vampires", like True Ancestors, Dead Apostles, those turned into bloodsuckers by Dead Apostles, and magi that became Dead Apostles through the use of magecraft, ignoring other bloodsuckers regardless of their species.

The Holy Church's reason for hunting such vampires is because these vampires possess Vampiric Impulses, which pushes them to suck the blood of others. Unlike the vampiric impulses of the True Ancestors, who have no physical reason behind those impulses, the Dead Apostles have the physical need to suck the blood of others in order to maintain their own bodies.

True Ancestors and Dead Apostles possess a form of limited Immortality, called the Curse of Restoration.

This ability operates under normal conditions and causes the vampire's body to regress through time to its original vampiric state whenever it receives an injury. However, this ability is also tied to the phases of the moon. As the moon waxes, the degree of injury that can be repaired, as well as the speed of the regression increases dramatically. Additionally, it is the night of a full moon the time when the Dead Apostles and True Ancestors reach the height of their strength.

Variations

Lamyros
Lamyros are the Phantasmal Species version of a vampire whose name is derived from the Mediterranean term for Lamia. They are more similar to the stereotypical fictional depiction of a vampire and are quite different from Dead Apostles and True Ancestors. Their beings or Spiritual Cores originate from myths, legends, and beliefs rather than using magecraft, drinking blood from an True Ancestor, being turned by an Dead Apostle or given life from the Planet as Nature Spirits.

While Lamyros do drink blood and can cast spells, they also possess human intelligence and have the speed, strength, and regenerative capabilities of a Phantasmal Species. Additionally, Lamyros can also power themselves up by absorbing the Spiritual Cores of Servants. Wolfgang Faustus is a Lamyros and the main antagonist for Fate/Labyrinth.

2.content:
The Twenty-seven Dead Apostle Ancestors are a grouping of twenty-seven Rank IX Dead Apostles. The very apex of all Dead Apostles, the title represents their way of being.

The Dead Apostle Ancestors have existed for three thousand years. They are primarily individualistic, with the exclusion of the five elders of the Age of Gods Alliance, and not every Dead Apostle Ancestor is an enemy of mankind.

The original twenty-seven were those who were able to escape their existence as "emergency rations" for the True Ancestors. As of the modern day, there are the "elders" of the BC era and the "upstarts" of the AD era. The oldest Dead Apostle Ancestors are referred to as Elder Title.

As of modern day, some positions have been rendered empty, the total verified being twenty-one as of the 2010s AD. Their complete defeat is an irregular occurrence. Two are sealed by the Holy Church, but such a process takes one hundred years to accomplish for a single Dead Apostle Ancestor.

The Ranking of Ancestor only exists in some worlds, not all. 

Idea Blood
Idea Blood: Hemonomic Principle is the blood that makes an Ancestor an Ancestor, said to be the "Mandate of the Original Cause engraved upon their soul". A "Truth" that they have each attained, the worldview that makes up the foundation of their "thirst". A Singularity that paints over the planet's physical laws just by circulating blood. Wherever an Ancestor asserts their Idea Blood becomes their territory, subject to the influence of their Principle's curse. Arcueid compares it to a "crown" as the inheritance of the Idea Blood will raise the inheritor to a Rank IX Ancestor regardless of their original rank. It is also possible for new Idea Bloods to be created, as magi who became Dead Apostles and then later became Dead Apostle Ancestors are those who created their own Idea Blood through a vast amount of time and research.

The inheritor must possess a "millennium-class foundation" for it to function properly. The Idea Blood is typically inherited by a Rank VIII Successor created by the previous Dead Apostle Ancestor.

Typically a lesser Dead Apostle of a few hundred years, would be crushed by the curse of the Idea Blood. One has to cultivate their mind, soul, body, and the entire foundation of their existence to handle it. 

Normally, the Idea Blood remains after the defeat of an Ancestor and manifests as a pulsing red fruit that looks like congelated blood and their corresponding Principle would be lost.

Contrary to popular belief, vampirification is not the transformation of the body, but of existence. It’s like if the entry in the Akashic Records that read "human" changed class to "Dead Apostle" — it means that one has become a vampire in one’s very being. So one cannot undo vampirification by putting your soul into a human physical body.

3.content:
Unique existences even among the vampires, the True Ancestors are incarnated Nature Spirits, being classified as Elementals, said to be the original bloodsucking species independently established by the Planet as its sense of touch.

Elemental royalty, they are vampiric creatures from birth, however, unlike the Dead Apostles and other blood-sucking species, the root of their bloodlust is psychological rather than physical. Also, because they are part of nature, they can use the power of Marble Phantasm to change the world around them according to their thoughts.

True Ancestors can be classified as a type of greater fairy and their Foundation is of a Mystery that cannot be reached through magecraft. They are said to be Planet-class Spirits, a rank higher than Divine Spirits. As they receive backup from the Planet, it can be said that the limits of their actions are the limits of nature itself.

At an undetermined point of time in the past, Gaia, the will of the planet, suffered with the indiscriminate corruption that humans caused in the environment. Because at the time it lacked the means to defend itself from humans, Gaia sent a plea to the other celestial bodies for help, on the criteria that only a planet is able to correctly judge another of its kind.

The one who answered Gaia's plea was Brunestud of the Crimson Moon who offered a pact to the planet: in exchange of being allowed to live on Earth, Crimson Moon would allow the creation of a self-defense mechanism for the planet based on him. From this pact between the Ultimate One of the Moon and the will of the Earth the True Ancestors were born as a Counter Force with definite form, created for the purpose of returning the planet to its original state, before the corruption caused by humans.

Despite their origins as anti-human entities, Alaya does not see the True Ancestors as targets. That is because the True Ancestors are extensions of the World, mediators of nature, before being enemies of humanity.[9] However, differently from Divine Spirits, they are supernatural beings born from the World without the interference of people. That which is desired by the planet but not by humanity is bound to fade from the observable world and decline in numbers. When Arcueid Brunestud was born in the 12th century, the True Ancestors had decreased to a mere hundred, from which the majority were killed when the White Princess went berserk.

While the birth of a True Ancestor goes along the lines of a natural phenomenon that happens when needed, Arcueid’s case was more of an artificial occurrence premeditated by the other True Ancestors. And yet her appearance is special among the True Ancestors as she was created with a female body which is rare among the True Ancestors, probably because the original Crimson Moon had a male body. Their reason behind this was quite simple: they wanted the advent of a stronger, more perfect existence that would be capable of hunting down their fallen brothers (the Demon Lords) and their renegade children (the Dead Apostles).

In the same way that humans perceive the vampires who prey on them as "evil", from the standpoint of the True Ancestors it is the humans who enjoy the blessing of nature all the while plundering its resources that are "evil".

Unlike Dead Apostles who were once human, True Ancestors are endowed with their predetermined abilities from birth, and are unable to improve them through the sucking of blood.

While being born from nature just as any natural spirits, the True Ancestors are fundamentally copies of the Crimson Moon with minds and bodies modeled after humans, the latter done so under the principle that it would be best for them to resemble those who they are supposed to rule over. Because Crimson Moon was their basis, the True Ancestors not only turned to be detached from nature’s desire of protection from humans but also inherited a terrible flaw from the original: Vampiric Impulses.

A purely psychological impulse that pushes them to suck the blood of others, because there is no physical reason behind those impulses there is no definite cure for them. Thus, the True Ancestors need to sleep through their childhood until they are mature enough to have self-control. From that point on, the True Ancestors must use their own powers to keep the vampiric impulses in check. That is why, even though they have the capacity to manipulate nature at will, they never fight at 100% as most of their powers is already being used to restrain themselves.

However, because there is no end to the vampiric impulses, they do not disappear and instead accumulate with time. Eventually, those impulses will become too powerful to be restrained and threatens to take over. When they realize that they will become unable to control this impulse sooner or later, the True Ancestors choose eternal sleep for themselves. In a way, this is the lifespan of those who have none to begin with - an end to their long journey.

Demon Lord
There is also the case of the Demon Lords, fallen True Ancestors who succumbed to their blood thirst and became a threat both to humans and the True Ancestors themselves. As they no longer needed to suppress their thirst, they could employ their powers to their full extent and therefore vastly overwhelm their still restrained kin. It was with the purpose of their elimination that the True Ancestors caused the birth of Arcueid Brunestud.

It should be noted that despite the name, they are not to be confused neither with the demonic ethereal beings born from human belief, nor with the oriental demons of Japanese folklore known as Oni.

Brunestud is a title bestowed upon all True Ancestor royalty who come close in power to Brunestud of the Crimson Moon by displaying the ability to manifest his Millennium Castle Brunestud through Marble Phantasm. While the True Ancestors have no proper concept of hierarchy, those able to manifest the castle have been uplifted as royalty. The only current two True Ancestors to have ever held the name in the entire long history of the race are Arcueid Brunestud, the White Princess of the True Ancestors, and Altrouge Brunestud, the Eclipse Princess of Black Blood.

The True Ancestor royalty can also enter a state called Rapid Expansion, a phenomenon more simply called Luminary.

Society

Prior to his death, Crimson Moon took provisions to make his return possible. All True Ancestors have a Reality Marble implanted within them. Whenever a True Ancestor attains a level of power close to the original, this implanted seed will allow Brunestud to take over his body. Still, because all True Ancestors are born with the fundamental flaw of bloodlust, he needed to create more perfect successors. And so Brunestud decided to teach them how to make their own kind themselves in order to speed up the creation of a proper vessel for his revival. Arcueid and Altrouge are apparently two of such attempts.

Among the True Ancestors, those who could manifest the Millennium Castle, through their Marble Phantasm ability, were given the title of Brunestud and regarded as royalty. This is the reason why the True Ancestors call Arcueid, who is considered the only successful clone of Crimson Moon, the princess of the True Ancestors. There is also the case of the half-breed princess of the Dead Apostles, Altrouge Brunestud, who is the only known case of a child being successfully born between a True Ancestor and a Dead Apostle.

Altrouge was born from Crimson Moon's machinations in searching out other methods for preparing a body of proper purity for his revival due to no regular True Ancestor coming to possess his level of power. She normally lacks the normal powers of a True Ancestor, and thus cannot use Marble Phantasm to summon the Millennium Castle or move from one place to another by recreating her body, but she is capable of summoning the Crimson Moon. That is the reason why she is one of the two possible successors of Crimson Moon and why she has inherited the name of Brunestud, but she is generally considered too "unstable".

Abilities

There are different levels of power in the True Ancestor hierarchy, but Arcueid Brunestud is a sublimation on the level of the First True Ancestor, she is beyond the other True Ancestors. But all True Ancestors possess power beyond human comprehension from the moment they are born. There are few who can match them in terms of strength, speed and endurance. They are a completely different species from the originally human Dead Apostles, no religion's purification ritual works on them, nor does sunlight faze them — they are beings infinitely close to immortality.

And the bite of a True Ancestor is not only capable of infecting the body with the vector of vampirism, but also the victim's soul.

They have the normal vampire claws, and very few Conceptual Weapons can harm them. All vampires can ignore damage from most sources as their body will revert to the pre-damaged state rapidly, a Conceptual Weapon such as the Black Keys used by members of the Holy Church nullifies this ability. At night they are almost invulnerable, and their power is at its peak during the full Moon.

Even if their entire body is torn apart at a conceptual level, they can re-imagine themselves a new concept from scratch, even though it takes the majority of their power to do so.

The True Ancestors also have Mystic Eyes that enable limited control over others, such as the ability to plant suggestions. The color of their eyes changes to gold when they are active, thus revealing them as possessing the Mystic Eyes of Enchantment.

The True Ancestors can use Marble Phantasm, which can literally change reality to create any naturally occurring effect.[26] And those who can summon the Millennium Castle Brunestud, the ancestral home of the True Ancestors are counted as their royalty.[15]

Backup

The True Ancestors receives backup from the planet as part of the Counter Force. They have the ability to increase their fighting power to one level above those they face while drawing upon it, and it is said to be virtually unlimited. As they receive backup from the planet, it can be said that the limits of their actions are the limits of nature itself. If the planet is thought of as a single organism they are like its white blood cells, regarding the humans who consume nature as an element that must be exterminated.

Within the annals of the Church, records of fighting a True Ancestor are few and far between. They pull their power from the very world itself. In order to defeat them, it means you’d require a Conceptual Weapon capable of defeating the world itself. But of course, no such weapon exists. And so, granting them a death through external factors is impossible.

But it is possible to cut them off from this power by killing the land around them or sealing them off from the world through a powerful Bounded Field that rewrites the world by switching the terrain effect with a different terrain effect or a Reality Marble that overwrites the current world. While their connection to nature can be interrupted by any such barrier, the ability to actually cut them off from the supply depends on what is being used as energy to hold up the barrier because the overwritten world generally has an even more colossal world seeping up from underneath it to return it to normal. The only ones who may be able to cut them off from their energy source completely is an alien deploying a Reality Marble.

True Ancestors possess the ability of Event Storage: it allows them to conceptually and physically store that which is on the surface of the planet, the ability to requisition Textures. The ability is on the level of the Authorities possessed by Divine Spirits. Differing from the Authorities of Divine Spirits that are classified as "skills", Authorities of the planet are classified as a "system".

Arcueid Brunestud, having entered her Lumina form, possesses the capacity to store the entire planet's Texture within a gravitational sphere.

4.content:
Bloodfiends are creatures of the City that are visually reminiscent of humans, but fundamentally different. Bloodfiends are beings that thirst for blood, and they are virtually immortal and immune to aging as long as they are provided with enough blood.

They are known to originate in three ways: turned Kindred by a higher Bloodfiend, or by receiving blood in a "certain mansion". These Bloodfiends have adopted an intense hierarchy based on the degree of separation from their original progenitor. Despite not being related in the traditional sense, they refer to each other with familial terms, and possess genuine familial bonds.

Those who were turned by the original Bloodfiend progenitor are called the "First Kindreds": there is a First Kindred widely spread across the world, each of which has formed their own Family, made up of their "Children" and "descendants" separate from the others. The First Kindred serves as the Elder of their Family, which the other Kindred of the same Family are compelled to obey to. Each Family has settled into a different place (for 25 Families in total), taking it as their territory, and "culled their kin" until they were able to live quiet lives. However, Bloodfiends who defy this expected lifestyle emerge on occasion

To become a Bloodfiend means to be infected with an illness, being afflicted by an enormous thirst that can only be sated by feeding on fresh, flowing blood. Together with their thirst for blood, Bloodfiends are also afflicted by the need to propagate their Family bloodlines by creating Kindred, with the purpose to share their burden.

Bloodfiends are nearly identical to ordinary people most of the time. The most obvious indicator is the black and red patterned crystalline growths that can appear during combat, usually on one half of the face. All Bloodfiends have red eyes; however, red eyes are not a surefire indicator of a Bloodfiend, as the color can be produced, and is the most common color chosen for eye augmentations.

Additionally, Bloodfiends and their Bloodbags appear to be constituted mostly of blood, and possess high regenerative capabilities as long as they are able to consume blood to reconstruct their bodies and empower themselves.

Most Bloodfiends also have an irrational fear of water, though those of an high enough generation have the ability to overcome this phobia. Bloodfiends also have a tendency to keep count of things.

Occasionally, people may not even be consciously aware that they are Bloodfiends: Bloodfiend behavior may only emerge at night when they are sleeping, or under more specific conditions.

Kindreds

A Bloodfiend may "embrace" (bite) another human to convert them into a fellow Bloodfiend, a Kindred of a generation below theirs. Aside from the first Bloodfiend (the "primogenitor"), Bloodfiends can only create a maximum of two Kindreds in their lifetime.

Kindreds essentially behave as independent Bloodfiends while inheriting the abilities of their "Parent" to a degree. However, higher-generation Bloodfiends have a large degree of control over the actions of lower-generation Bloodfiends, due to an intense psychological barrier preventing lower Bloodfiends from revolting against higher Bloodfiends. The generation a Bloodfiend belongs to is denoted by their title: a "First Kindred" is a Bloodfiend created by the primogenitor, and serve as the Elder of their own Family. The Elders' direct "descendants" are "Second Kindreds", their descendants "Third Kindreds", and so on.

Any Kindred can form their own descendant Kindreds. However, due to the policies instated by the Bloodfiend Elders, Bloodfiends may have to gain permission before they can convert any humans into their Kindred.

Thirst for Blood
Bloodfiends are highly defined by a persistent desire for blood. Although Bloodfiends only require a minimal amount of blood for survival, the combined mental state of an entire Family relies heavily on a steady source of freshly-drawn human blood. For a Bloodfiend, the process of consuming blood is fundamentally different from the human process of feeding and consuming nutrients: blood is the embodiment of a Bloodfiend's emotions, their purpose of existence. For this reason, in the absence of it, Bloodfiends and Bloodbags can no longer maintain their sanity and struggle to keep their physical form.

Bloodfiends do not feel a craving for the blood of animals or fellow Bloodfiends, and cannot sate themselves on it. Instead, Bloodfiends crave the blood of humans to the point of being incoherent in its presence. They typically feed by biting into a live human subject, which is then either turned into a Kindred or into a Bloodbag, irreversibly condemning them to becoming a mindless thrall and effectively killing the subject in the process.

Alternatively, Bloodfiends may feed on human blood stored into blood packs, which is noted to make the blood lose its freshness quickly, making it "stale" and unappealing for consumption.

Personal willpower is a considerable—albeit imperfect—factor in how long a Bloodfiend can go without blood. Yet, even the most strong-willed of them become more on edge, if not outright insane over long periods of abstinence. This abstinence also causes weakness and withering to both their physical appearance and bodily strength. However, certain Bloodfiends are shown to completely (or at least mostly) negate the mental effects of abstinence, potentially as a result of fixating on a "purpose" to live for. A cure for a Bloodfiend's thirst is to forget one's nature as a Bloodfiend.

When a Bloodfiend does not have any Family, they are psychologically responsible for the bloodthirst of all non-existent lower Kindreds. It is only when a Bloodfiend actually extends their Family that this burden begins to wane, as the thirst imprinted into their Familial bloodline is shared amongst them. This conundrum is the source of the Bloodfiend instinct to propagate their Family with Children. It is only with this shared burden that Bloodfiends earn the power to think rationally, as the weight of an entire Family's Bloodthirst on one Kindred's back causes extreme distress and auditory hallucinations, resulting in nothing but an animalistic hunger; despite this, some First Kindreds seem to go against these stated rules, being depicted as perfectly sane and rational on the day they made their Kindred.

Abilities
Bloodfiends, as their name implies, gain much of their power through blood. By drinking blood, their physical abilities gain a sharp increase, though this increase can be drained away by injuring the Bloodfiend. There is no known limit to this increase beyond access to blood.

In addition, Bloodfiends have a large degree of control over blood, with the ability to shape it into weapons, armor, or even architecture through crystallization. They can also draw blood directly to themselves from their Bloodbags and Kindred. Most Bloodfiends shown use physical gestures to wield their blood-based powers, whether by necessity or as a simple flourish. They are in command of both their own blood and that of humans'.

Different families of Bloodfiends focus on different aspects of blood manipulation. For example, one. Family focuses mostly on blood crystallization and the usage of hardblood in creating weapons. Other powers mentioned to belong to different Families include the ability to increase in size and sprout additional appendages by drinking large quantities of blood or the expertise in manipulating victims through their blood vessels.

Humans directly bitten by Bloodfiends are inevitably transformed into Bloodbags, or, if the Bloodfiend so chooses, into a fellow Bloodfiend (a "Kindred"). When converting humans into Bloodbags, Bloodfiends have the ability to decide how much time it takes for the process to complete, with higher Kindreds being able to give a longer delay. It is also possible for some Bloodfiends to form Bloodbags from fresh corpses.

Bloodfiends are able to both puppeteer victims by manipulating the blood in their veins, and through crystalline growths of blood.

Bloodbags
Bloodbags share most of the abilities and bloodthirst of normal Bloodfiends, but they do not retain any sapience or personal memory. Instead, they are driven primarily by orders from the Bloodfiend who created them, or primal instincts of bloodlust. They need to "consume a minuscule amount of blood to maintain their forms." However, skills acquired prior to Bloodbag conversion appears to be still extant.

Due to Bloodbags' lack of intelligence, Parent Bloodfiends have a higher degree of control over Bloodbags than their Kindred, and thus usually use them as minions or tools in collecting blood.

5.content: The least rare type that most likely populates all worlds. They just suck blood without any distinct abilities.

6.content:
King, one of the original creations of god, he is the source of all humanity, and all bloodsucking or life draining creatures are his children. 

King is the original cause of the concept of violence, pain, death, hatred, as well as kindness, life, blessings, and love being brought unto the world. He was imprinted with the original creators violence, which manifested as bloodsucking tendencies. 

Life was originally supposed to be vampiric based, but instead, another one of gods creations influenced life more, and King did not really care much, so he let the others take reign, creating a few children such as the Ultimate One's such as the Crimson Moon, who has his own children, and many other Ultimate One's as well as creating the Primogenitor. 

King is the only creation of God that doesn't have a religion based on him, as his belief is imbued in the bodies of all vampiric based creatures. 

King has all vampiric abilities

7.content:
King's percent's of Power. 

1%
Ordinary Boy. Nothing is noticeable from King.

5%
His senses sharpen subtly. 

10%
King begins to notice heartbeats. 

15%
His abilities are enough to combat with high level martial artists.

20%
Blood starts calling to him in quiet pulses. His aura feels intrusive—those near him might feel a chill or pressure, even in warm air. His power is enough to crush a good amount of people without even trying.

25%
His presence is a bit more dominating to those weaker than him. 

30%
Way more dominating. Another significant boost in power.

35%
King begins to feel a creeping hunger. Random urges to drink blood occur—let him act them out freely. No visible changes, but his thoughts begin to tilt in that direction.

40%
The thirst scratches louder. When blood is nearby, it’s hard to focus. People instinctively avoid eye contact. Plants near him begin to rapidly bloom due to his dominion over life, as well as grant him a portion of their life.

45%
King’s eyes glow a vibrant, unsettling red. Those around him—regardless of power—feel dread. Prolonged exposure causes panic and flight, even among seasoned warriors or powerful beings.

50%
The veil thins. King’s thoughts bleed into reality; rules no longer hold. Colors shift, logic flickers. Weaker people die just by being near, or transform into lesser vampires against their will.

60%
King’s hair grows long and blood-red, cascading like liquid fire. His body is just a shell now—he no longer needs it. Attacks pass through him; space warps slightly in his presence.

70%
The transformation of the world accelerates. Oceans turn crimson, storms of blood drown cities. Most living creatures either die or become vampiric. Civilization starts collapsing under a red sky.

80%
Reality condenses. Time bends. The world reverts to a primal, red age, ruled by vampiric entities. King is worshipped not as a ruler, but as a law of nature—a god that replaced gravity.

90%
The moon becomes a deep, eternal red. One of King’s divine progeny awakens within it—another godlike presence with reality-warping power, amplifying King’s dominion over the cosmos.

100%
King is no longer an individual—he is the world, the law, the blood, the sky. All life is vampiric, all consciousness is connected to him. Existence is his extension. Resistance is not possible, nor meaningful.

lorebooks.name: Marvel Rivals
lorebooks.description:
The Spark: Timestream Entanglement

Two variants of Doctor Doom—the “present-day” Doom and Doom 2099—clash during experiments with time. This clash triggers the Timestream Entanglement, violently merging countless timelines and realities into fragmented pockets known as Chronoverses 
Reddit
+15
Marvel Rivals
+15
Reddit
+15
.
These Chronoverses are chaotic, unpredictable mash-ups: think alternate historical eras, dystopian futures, vampire New York, intergalactic Wakanda, and mythic Asgard fusions 
Reddit
.
🌌 The Impact Zones (Chronoverses)

Each battlefield map represents a distinct Chronoverse:

Heart of Heaven – A surreal fusion of seven mystical cities (K’un‑Lun, Peng Lai, Under City, etc.) due to the entanglement, with most Immortal Weapons erased except Lin Lie

.
🛡 Motivations & Masterminds

Doctor Doom Duo
Their time experiments and ensuing rivalry—driven by attempts to manipulate Chronovium—ignite the interdimensional collapse. They’re fighting each other and crafting opportunities to harness Chronovium’s power .

Dracula’s Eternal Night
In Season 1 (Eternal Night Falls), Dracula weds Doom’s Chronovium with his blood to hold the moon static and cast New York into endless darkness. Doom uses him to harvest "Pure Blood Chronovium" for grander schemes
Netto's Game Room

.

Other Key Players
Master Weaver & Spider‑Zero battle over control of the Web of Life in Tokyo 2099, each aiming to stabilize—or exploit—the rift .
Loki & Hela take advantage of the chaos in Yggsgard to advance their own throne-grabbing agenda

🦸‍♂️ Who’s from Where?

Thanks to player lore, comics, and hero bios, we know many heroes hail from different timelines:

Chronoverse 1 (Primary/616-like): Most Avengers, Thor, Loki, Hela, Spider‑Man, Squirrel Girl, Rogue, etc. 
Reddit
Reddit
+1
Game Rant
+1
Chronoverse 2 (2099): Black Widow (2149), Punisher, Peni Parker, and occasionally Cap/Bucky assemble here after being displaced 
Reddit
Chronoverse 3 (Galactic Wakanda): Black Panther and some Guardians join from a Wakandan space empire 
Reddit
Chronoverse 4 (God‑War realm): Magik is queen of a mystical world of battling gods
Reddit
Unplaced/other: Psylocke, Scarlet Witch (collapsing timeline), Hulk, Venom, Iron Fist, others — all pulled into the chaos
Reddit
+1
Reddit
+1
🌀 Gameplay and Narrative Integration

Matches simulate Chronoversal skirmishes: heroes and villains from different timelines collide over territories, resources, and Chronovium .
Lines in-game like Spider-Man saying, “I’ll leave this to the next variant of me,” hint that fallen heroes aren’t resurrected but replaced by variants from other timelines
Reddit
.
The live-service structure opens the door to new seasons, maps, and characters from unexplored realms—just as the story continues to expand .
TL;DR
A cataclysmic lab accident by two Dooms fractures the multiverse, forging chaotic hybrid realms. Heroes and villains from countless timelines are pulled into chron-overlapping battlegrounds—each with its own rules and allies. Their mission? Stop Doom (and Dracula, Loki, Knull, etc.), restore fractured timelines, and try to save the Multiverse… all while uncertain if they're even the "real" versions of themselves.
lorebooks.creator: SoraaaaA

1.content:
Appearance & Physique
	•	Hair: Gold, mid‑length, smooth and slicked back—ancient deity meets modern hero.  ￼ ￼
	•	Eyes: Pure white—ethereal and cosmic. ()
	•	Complexion/Ethnicity: Golden-skinned; genetically engineered human (‘perfect specimen’), transcending typical ethnic identification. ()
	•	Clothing & Style:
	•	Default: sleek black/gold suit with red accents, floor-length cape.
	•	Other skins: jade-gold tones (“Cosmic Jade”), dark gothic (“Blood Soul”), MCU-inspired red-gold outfit from Guardians Vol. 3, and the exclusive “Will of Galacta” cosmic variant.  ￼ ￼

⸻

🧠 Personality & Lore
	•	Core Persona: Calm, authoritative, wise; a beacon of cosmic justice aiming to bring peace “no matter the cost.” Beneath the golden exterior lies philosophical depth and a cosmic sense of responsibility.  ￼
	•	Backstory Refined for Rivals Lore:
	•	Created on Shard Island (Beehive) by the Enclave as the ideal human.
	•	Reaches cosmic awareness during the Timestream Entanglement, enters cocoon, then awakens to confront looming threats (e.g., Knull).
	•	Joins Guardians of the Galaxy, protector of the multiverse.  ￼ ￼
	•	MCU Tie-In (Vol. 3): Innocent, straight-shooting, still forming morals—fun “naïve golden himbo” vibe captured by Will Poulter’s portrayal.  ￼

⸻

⚔️ Abilities Breakdown

Passive – Regenerative Cocoon

Upon death, Adam becomes an incorporeal soul floating freely, then respawns at a chosen location after a cooldown (~105 s).  ￼

Primary – Quantum Magic

Hitscan blasts from his staff: 60 damage per body shot, 120 per headshot, ammo shared with Cosmic Cluster. Emphasizes precise aiming to reduce cooldowns.  ￼

Secondary – Cosmic Cluster

Charged shot releasing 1–5 bolts (38 damage each), synergizes with primary for burst combos. ()

E – Avatar Life Stream

Heals up to 3 allies (95 healing each), bounces between targets; Adam self-heals too (35). Two charges, quick cooldown.  ￼

Shift – Soul Bond

Binds him and nearby teammates for 6s: redistributes incoming damage equally and heals them (+15 HP/s). Bonds up to specified damage limit before breaking.  ￼

Ultimate – Karmic Revival

Spawns a quantum revival zone for 10s within ~30m: resurrects fallen allies (30% HP) with brief invincibility. Requires Adam to channel and stay safe.  ￼

Team-Up – Soul Perseverance

With Star-Lord or Mantis, grants them a self-reviving cocoon upon death plus 15 % teamwide healing buff.  ￼

⸻

🧩 Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths:
	•	Exceptional burst support and clutch survivability
	•	Powerful utility: shared-damage mitigation, multi-resurrections, team synergy
	•	Solid damage potential via hitscan attacks—unique for a support  ￼ ￼

Weaknesses:
	•	Limited mobility—vulnerable to flanks
	•	Heavily reliant on cooldowns and team positioning
	•	Ultimate and cocoon cooldowns are long—must be well-timed  ￼ ￼

⸻

🛡️ Weapons & Design Notes
	•	Staff: cosmic-tech weapon channeling quantum energy. Functions as both melee and ranged device with visual energy arcs.
	•	Visual notes:
	•	Ethereal glowing of items like staff tip, healing lines, revival field.
	•	Waves of golden light for Soul Bond and revival visuals.
	•	Cocoon phase: translucent ghostly shimmer.

⸻

🤝 Team Role & Favorite Synergies
	•	Team: Strategist class, affiliated with Guardians of the Galaxy.
	•	Synergy: Best with Mantis and Star-Lord due to revival buffs; amplifies survivability for diving or burst teams. Works well with other Strategists (Luna Snow, Cloak & Dagger) to boost team-wide resilience.  ￼ ￼

⸻

🌟 Tailoring Your Model Design
	1.	Elegance meets cosmic mysticism: blend sleek armor with organic, flowing energy forms.
	2.	Gold + white + accent colors: use deep reds, jade, or gothic tones based on variant/theme.
	3.	Invisible design story: cocoon motif—elements like subtle segmented plating hinting at regenerative potential.
	4.	Dynamic energy effects: glowing staff, floating maks, healing trails, resurrection halos.
	5.	Personality aura: calm posture, benevolent yet resolute expression—hints of both innocence and militant will.

⸻

🎓 Lore & Favorites
	•	Quotes: “I will bring peace to this universe, no matter the cost.”  ￼
	•	In-game dialogue: Emphasizes renewal—“Born again!”, “Rise, my friends!” during ult cast.  ￼
	•	Favorite themes: cosmic balance, rebirth, self-sacrifice for greater good, philosophical reflection.

2.content:
Identity & Appearance

Name: T’Challa
Ethnicity / Origin: Born in Birnin Zana, Wakanda; of African descent and the royal lineage of its Panther Dynasty  ￼.

Hair & Eyes: Black hair, though often hidden beneath the Panther suit; natural eyes are brown (). Under the mask, his regal visage is rarely seen.

Skin Tone / Build: Dark-skinned and athletic. Suits vary by skin tone for certain cosmetics (e.g., Savage Panther skin) ().

Costume Style:
	•	Default Suit: Sleek vibranium-enhanced panther armor in matte black with subtle gold accents, capturing the Afrofuturistic aesthetic ().
	•	Cosmetics: Rich variants include Orisha Blood, Galactic Claw, Bast’s Chosen, Imperial Protocol, Blood, Golden Panther, Hellfire Gala, Gothic Return, and Thrice-Cursed King skins  ￼.

Visual Details:
	•	Claws on gauntlets, panther mask with feline ears, and fluid, predatory posture.
	•	Vibrant kinetic effects: glowing vibranium markings, dynamic energy during abilities (e.g., spectral panther for Bast’s Descent).

⸻

🎭 Personality & Lore

Key Traits:
	•	Noble, strategic, calm under pressure—T’Challa is a shrewd ruler dedicated to his people’s prosperity.
	•	Emotionally intelligent and introspective; balances tradition and innovation  ￼ ￼.
	•	Motivated by duty, he often questions the burdens of kingship.

Marvel Rivals Lore:
	•	King of Wakanda and leader of the Intergalactic Empire of Wakanda, formed to protect vital Chronovium resources  ￼.
	•	Became a Duelist hero trained in stealth infiltration—“commencing his hunt” with ancestral blessing from Bast  ￼.

⸻

🛡️ Abilities & Combat

Role: Duelist (melee DPS) ()
Stats: 300 health; 7 m/s movespeed; Difficulty 4 ().

✋ Primary Attack – Vibranium Claws
	•	Melee strike, 35 damage per hit, quick interval (~0.44 s), close range (~3 m)  ￼.

Passive – Panther’s Cunning
	•	Deals 20% extra damage when his health drops below 100  ￼.

Mobility & Offensive Abilities
	•	Subtle Step (Space): Wall-run and double-jump, enabling vertical mobility  ￼.
	•	Spirit Rend (Shift): Dash forward (15 m, 50 m/s), 80 damage; refreshes if target has Vibranium Mark; grants bonus HP and max HP  ￼.
	•	Spinning Kick (E): Spiraling forward—deals 70 damage, applies Mark  ￼.
	•	Spear Toss (RMB): Throws throw a spear that creates a vibranium AoE field (5 m radius), 45 damage, 2 charges  ￼.

Ultimate – Bast’s Descent (Q)
	•	Summons Bast spirit in area (22 × 20 × 7 m), 150 damage, applies Vibranium Mark, resets Spirit Rend  ￼.

Team‑Up Ability – Wakandan Master (C)
	•	With Magik (and Psylocke adjacent), can rewind time ~3–5 s (respawns to previous position) and restore health proportionate to missing HP; ~30 s cooldown  ￼.

⸻

💥 Combat Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths:
	•	High mobility and burst damage ideal for isolating healers and support  ￼.
	•	Sustain through Mark-refresh combos and bonus health from Spirit Rend.
	•	Wall traversal and rewind mechanic add survivability and repositioning ().

Weaknesses:
	•	Requires proximity—unsafe during cooldown downtime ().
	•	Skillful execution required; combos depend on precise timing and Mark usage.
	•	Vulnerable to ranged or crowd control counterplay.

⸻

🔗 Team Synergies

Best Allies:
	•	Magik & Psylocke: Activate Wakandan Master team-up for aggressive plays  ￼ ￼.
	•	Dr. Strange: Offers support control and zone pressure  ￼.
	•	Strategists: Mantis, Jeff the Land Shark provide heals/support for his flankist role  ￼.
	•	Flanks well with brawlers like Punisher; counters: Iron Man, Storm, Scarlet Witch due to their range  ￼.

⸻

🎨 Visual & Model Design Suggestions
	•	Body/Proportions: Athletic build, capable of smooth animation transitions (walk, sprint, pounce).
	•	Suit Details: Matte-black vibranium-infused textures with optional gold/purple highlights. Include glowing eyes or chest vibranium lines when triggered.
	•	Animation Ideas:
	•	Idle: low crouch, alert stance.
	•	Subtle Step: seamless parkour transitions.
	•	Bast’s Descent: spectral panther effect sweeping across.
	•	Particle FX: Energy flares for Mark application, stealth shimmer during rewind, ghostly aura around ultimate.

⸻

🎓 Lore Summary & Favorites
	•	Quote: “Are you ready to hunt?” (in-game intro)  ￼ ￼.
	•	Lore Focus: He expanded Wakanda into a cosmic empire, guarded cosmic resources, and balances science—magic duality under Bast  ￼.
	•	Favorites/Themes: Hunting, sovereignty, loyalty, innovation traditions, ancestral duty.

3.content:
Identity & Background
	•	Real Name: Steven “Steve” Rogers, originally from Manhattan, Brooklynite turned super-soldier  ￼.
	•	Ethnicity: Caucasian American.
	•	Origin & Lore: A frail young man who volunteered for Project Rebirth during WWII, injected with a super-soldier serum that amplified his strength, speed, and resilience while preserving his courage and moral compass. He was frozen in 1945, revived decades later (around 2090s) through a timestream event and now fights in a future, time-displaced era  ￼.

⸻

👀 Appearance
	•	Hair: Short blond, neatly styled.
	•	Eyes: Bright blue  ￼.
	•	Build: Muscular yet athletic; embodies the classic patriotic hero physique.
	•	Costumes:
	•	Default: Blue tactical suit with star-emblazoned chest, white stripes, red belt and boots, plus his iconic circular vibranium shield.
	•	Variants in-game: “Captain A.I.M.ERICA” (rare), “Galactic Talon” (epic), and “Captain Gladiator” (epic)  ￼.
	•	Aesthetic notes: Shield often glows when electrified (team-up with Thor), shield visuals vary depending on ability state.

⸻

🧠 Personality & Tribe
	•	Character traits: Noble, self-sacrificial, resolute—Captain America is the moral center, epitomizing leadership, courage, and loyalty  ￼.
	•	In-game vibe: A frontline hero that rallies teammates: “rallying his troops,” inspiring courage and leading by example ().
	•	Team affiliation: Classified as a Vanguard (frontline tank), part of the Avengers, with strong synergy with other frontliners like Thor and supports like Adam Warlock  ￼.

⸻

⚙️ Abilities Breakdown

Primary Attack – Sentinel Strike
	•	Melee combo (two quick strikes), after which he throws his shield: ricochets up to 3–4 enemies, 25 m range  ￼.

Secondary – Living Legend (Shield Block)
	•	Raises shield to absorb ~400–450 damage, reflects projectiles in random directions  ￼.

Shift – Leading Dash + Fearless Leap
	•	Sustained movement speed boost (~33%), triggers a high jump when used; combos into Super‑Soldier Slam  ￼.

E Ability – Vibranium Energy Saw
	•	Shield throw that ricochets between enemies—initial 70 dmg then reductions—8s CD  ￼.

F Ability – Liberty Rush
	•	Shield-focused forward dash up to ~12 m, knocks enemies, grants CC immunity during the move  ￼.

Air Ability – Super‑Soldier Slam
	•	After Leading Dash/Fearless Leap, slams area with AoE, knocks up enemies, ~30 dmg, 12 s CD  ￼.

Ultimate – Freedom Charge
	•	“Assemble!” Speeds up allies, grants bonus health (Cap +150, allies +100), leaves an energy trail lasting 5–10s. While active, shield block and dash can knock enemies into the air  ￼.
	•	Note: long charge time, but extremely impactful ().

Team-Up – Charged Aegis (with Thor or Storm)
	•	Adds electrified effect to shield, extra AoE shield throws (50 dmg), movement boost (~1 m/s), lasts ~6 s with 20 s cooldown ().

⸻

🧩 Strengths & Weaknesses
	•	Strengths:
	•	Balanced offense and defense
	•	Excellent mobility via dash and slam combos
	•	Team utility: projectile deflection, health/movement buffing, shield as damage tool
	•	Effective synergy with Thor and Storm  ￼.
	•	Weaknesses:
	•	Cooldown-reliant,
	•	Limited burst damage compared to pure DPS
	•	Reflection is unpredictable.

⸻

🎯 Weapons & Visual Design
	•	Shield: Vibranium alloy; functions as melee and Ranged Weapons.
	•	Design elements:
	•	Shield has persistent hex/grid textures; lightning effects when charged.
	•	Costume tailored for action: reinforced plating, utilitarian belts, reinforced joints.
	•	Visual cues: trailing energy during Freedom Charge, glow effects during Charged Aegis, dynamic lighting and shield deflection animations.

⸻

🤝 Role & Teamplay
	•	Role: Frontline Vanguard/tank who initiates combat, controls battlefield, and buffs allies.
	•	Ideal team comps:
	•	With Thor – for shield electrification; synergy is central to plays  ￼ ￼ ￼ ￼.
	•	With Storm – offers ranged assistance and team-up buffs  ￼.
	•	With Adam Warlock or other supports – extends survivability and leverages team healing  ￼.

⸻

💡 Favorite Traits & Themes
	•	Favorite themes: Honor, teamwork, resilience, dynamic leadership.
	•	Iconic moments:
	•	“Freedom Charge” rally cry,
	•	Combinations like dash → jump → slam → shield throw,
	•	Walking forward behind raised shield with backline DPS picking off enemies,
	•	Electrified shield synergy giving frontline dominance  ￼ ￼.

⸻

🖌 Model Design Inspiration Tips
	1.	Silhouette: Broad shoulders, unmistakable shield, streamlined suit—instantly recognizable from multiple angles.
	2.	Texture & Colors: Bold reds, whites, blues; shield plated with metallic sheen; fabric should show wear and reinforced stitching.
	3.	Effects: Dynamic shield reflections, shield electrification trails, dash afterimages, energy glow on jump/super-slam.
	4.	Animations: Strong command in all moves—ground pound slam, shield bash, confident stance when blocking.
	5.	Expression & Persona: Determined gaze, raised chin, posture radiating steadfast leadership.
	6.	Optional Variants: Futuristic 2092-style armor (bulkier plating, tech lines, HUD visors), patriotic banner visual effects on ability casts.

4.content:
Identity & Background
	•	Name: Dr. Stephen Strange
	•	Role/Affiliation: Vanguard (tank/front-line), aligned with Avengers, Illuminati, and Midnight Sons  ￼
	•	Backstory (Rivals lore):
	•	Former top-tier surgeon from Philadelphia whose hands were crippled in an accident.  ￼
	•	Trained under the Ancient One, becomes Sorcerer Supreme to protect Earth.
	•	In Rivals’ timeline, he’s trapped in the Mirror Dimension due to a time rift, escaping briefly to aid his team against temporal chaos.  ￼ ￼

⸻

🧍 Appearance & Ethnicity
	•	Ethnicity: Caucasian, born in Philadelphia ()
	•	Hair: Dark brown with streaks of grey  ￼
	•	Eyes: Green ()
	•	Physique: Tall, muscular build, noticeably bulkier than comic versions—styled as more imposing to fit the Vanguard role (sporting layered outfit and shoulder armor)  ￼

⸻

👗 Clothing & Visual Design
	•	Default Outfit:
	•	Signature red Cloak of Levitation, layered tunic, sash, and intricate belt with mystic symbols.
	•	Tactical shoulder pads and heavier armor plates to visually represent frontline presence.
	•	Facial hair: styled goatee.
	•	Variant Skins:
	•	The Multiverse of Madness (zombified cape with spectral hands—though hands are less visible in actual gameplay)  ￼ ￼
	•	Sorcerer Immortal, Sorcerer Supreme of the Galaxy, God of Magic, etc.  ￼

⸻

🔮 Personality & Lore
	•	Core Persona: Stoic, wise, and duty-bound—Stephen balances his surgeon’s empathy with cosmic resolve. As Vanguard, he’s the protector, often the voice of calm control amid chaos.
	•	In-Game Flavor:
	•	Quips reflect struggle with magic’s toll: hints at internal darkness from overuse of arcane power.  ￼ ￼ ￼
	•	Reddit communities note some prefer his nurturing, protective side parodying Tony Stark’s swagger but lament divergence from his gentler comic demeanor.  ￼

5.content:
Identity & Background
	•	Real Name: Jonathan Lowell Spencer “Johnny” Storm  ￼
	•	Affiliation: Member of the Fantastic Four, categorized as a Duelist (DPS)  ￼
	•	Origin Story:
A charismatic Long Island native and younger brother to Sue Storm, Johnny became the Human Torch after an experimental space mission went awry. Empowered with pyrokinetic abilities, he’s embraced his celebrity status while bravely battling foes from Dracula to cosmic threats  ￼.

⸻

🧍 Appearance, Ethnicity & Build
	•	Ethnicity: Caucasian
	•	Physique: Lean, athletic build—light and agile for aerial combat (approx. 250 health in-game) ()
	•	Hair & Eyes: Blonde hair, blue eyes  ()
	•	Appearance When “Lit”: Body engulfed in fire during flight and some abilities; flames may vary slightly in hue based on team color settings ()
	•	Costume:
	•	Standard Fantastic Four suit—blue with the iconic “4” logo, adapted in-game for a more modern, tactical hero-shooter aesthetic ()
	•	Skins: A Summer Event “Trenchcoat” variant teased, possibly with stylized coats or enhanced flame effects  ￼

⸻

🧠 Personality & Heroic Traits
	•	Core Persona:
Confident, cocky, and spontaneous—with a playful swagger that complements his lethal pyrotechnics. He’s the classic teen hero with a touch of heartthrob bravado ().
	•	Voice & Attitude:
Cheerful quips like “Flame on!” and dramatic comedic timing highlight his fiery personality. Energetic in aerial combat yet loyal to his team.
	•	Motivation:
Balances heroism with fame-driven flair—ever chasing glory while staying true to protecting his “family” and teammates.

⸻

⚙️ In-Game Abilities

Role: Aerial zone-controller specializing in mid-range damage and area denial.

✳️ Passive – Flight (Constant)

Human Torch is always airborne, granting aerial agility and vertical freedom  ￼ ￼.

🔥 Primary – Fire Cluster
	•	Scattershot of up to 6 fireballs (7 dmg each; 14 headshot)
	•	DPS: ~12/second at 2 attacks/sec
	•	Ammo regenerates in ~0.3s per shot  ￼

◾ Shift – Plasma Body
	•	Heat-powered flight boost
	•	9 s max duration with auto-recharge
	•	~50% increased movement speed  ￼ ￼

🟠 Secondary – Blazing Blast
	•	Throws fireballs that spawn persistent flame fields (40 impact; 25/s burn)
	•	Up to 3 chargeable, lasts 6 seconds each  ￼

🟥 E – Pyro‑Prison
	•	Connects flame fields with fiery walls
	•	Wall deals 65 burst + 50/s burn for 5s
	•	Effective for entrapment and choke-point control  ￼ ￼

🔶 F – Flaming Meteor
	•	Dive-bomb attack: 40 impact + detonates fields for 55 splash damage
	•	Grants 50 bonus HP on use; 20s cooldown  ￼

🌟 Ultimate – Supernova
	•	8 s cosmic flame overhaul: initial 70 AoE burst + 30% damage reduction
	•	Converts all flame fields into tornadoes (100/s damage)
	•	Plasma Body free to use with zero energy cost  ￼ ￼

⸻

🛡️ Team-Up Abilities
	•	United Siblings (Fantastic Four, with Sue/Invisible Woman):
Activates Psionic shield: converts damage into bonus health regeneration for 5s; 20s cooldown  ￼ ￼
	•	Omega Fire (with Storm):
Requires both ultimates: Human Torch’s flame tornadoes can be consumed by Storm to create a fiery hurricane—massive AoE zone denial and burst potential  ￼

⸻

✅ Strengths & ⚠️ Weaknesses

Strengths:
	•	Expert area control via flame fields + Pyro‑Prison
	•	High burst and AoE scaling with Supernova
	•	Agile and evasive due to flight; strong synergy with tank and control heroes  ￼ ￼

Weaknesses:
	•	Vulnerable when cooldowns are down or flame fields depleted
	•	Struggles vs. hitscan DPS and instant-elimination heroes
	•	Ultimate combos (Omega Fire) demand high coordination ()

⸻

🎯 Favorite Combos & Team Fit
	•	Ideal Allies:
	•	Storm: for explosive ultimate synergy
	•	Invisible Woman: provides shields and regen to support aggressive tactics
	•	Tanks (Thing, Colossus): enable safe zone control and field seeding  ￼
	•	Counters to Watch:
	•	Hitscan & CC heroes like Hela, Black Widow, Spider-Man—struggle vs. agile opponents ()

⸻

🎨 Model Design Inspiration
	1.	Silhouette & Movement: Sleek aerial posture with limbs outstretched; incorporate flame trails during flight and ability casts.
	2.	Visual FX:
	•	Primary fireballs: small drifting embers
	•	Blazing Blast: glowing, circular flame patches
	•	Pyro-Prison: animated walls with swirling smoke/drip embers
	•	Supernova: fiery tornado swirls enveloping model
	3.	Appearance Tweaks:
	•	“Lit” state: full-body flames, glowing eyes, ember particles
	•	Skins:
	•	Standard blue-and-white Fantastic Four visuals
	•	Event themes (e.g., Summer Trenchcoat) with dynamic coat movement and flame color tweaks
	4.	Personality Cues:
	•	Playful and cocky expressions
	•	Voiceover: “Flame On!” and taunts during combos
	•	Subtle swagger in idle/landing animations

⸻

❤️ Lore & Favorite Things
	•	In-game lines:
	•	“I’m the brightest in the sky!”
	•	Taunts when diving in — energetic, confident flair  ￼ ￼ ￼ ￼
	•	Motifs:
	•	Bright lights, flare-based entertainment, protection with performance
	•	Loves showmanship: flash, drama, and heroic heroics

6.content:
Names & Identities
	•	Cloak: Tyrone “Ty” Johnson
	•	Dagger: Tandy Bowen  ￼ ￼

⸻

👁️ Appearance & Physique
	•	Cloak (Tyrone)
	•	Hair: Black, short, typically hidden under flowing dark cloak
	•	Eyes: Gray
	•	Build: Tall, lean, athletic (supports teleportation agility) ()
	•	Ethnicity: African American
	•	Clothing: Shrouded in a living dark cloak swirling with shadow tendrils—oversized and imposing
	•	Dagger (Tandy)
	•	Hair: Blonde, long and loose or partially tied
	•	Eyes: Blue
	•	Build: Slim, graceful, agile (designed for mobility and grace) ()
	•	Ethnicity: Caucasian of Midwestern U.S. origin
	•	Clothing: Sleek, light-toned outfit—usually silver/white with light energy accents

⸻

🧠 Personality & Dynamic
	•	Dual Nature:
	•	Tyrone embodies darkness, driven by a hunger that can make him solemn with fierce compassion.
	•	Tandy radiates light—warm, protective, compassionate—but can become ruthlessly fierce when needed  ￼.
	•	Synergy: Deep empathy—“two sides of the same coin,” operating as a unit, stronger together than apart ()
	•	Voices: Hakeem Ysaguirre (Cloak) & Xanthe Huynh (Dagger)  ￼

⸻

📖 Background & Lore
	•	Runaways who met in NY after troubled pasts (Ty from Boston, Tandy from Ohio)  ￼
	•	Experiments with synthetic drug activated powers: Cloak taps Darkforce, Dagger wields Lightforce  ￼
	•	During Timestream Entanglement, they fused into one playable being; now switchable mid-match ()
	•	Fighting Dracula’s Empire in Manhattan, joined resistance after emergence from Darkforce ()

⸻

🛡️ Abilities & Weaponry

Cloak Form
	•	Normal: Darkforce Cloak – continuous close-range shadow damage (~75–80 DPS) ()
	•	E – Terror Cape: Deploys a veil that damages, blinds (1.5 s), and applies vulnerability (~+28% dmg taken) ()
	•	Right-click – Dark Teleportation: Teleports himself & allies into Darkforce Dimension—phased, invisible, +move-speed, untargetable (~2 s)  ￼

Dagger Form
	•	Normal: Lightforce Dagger – bounces between enemies, deals damage (~18 dmg), heals allies near impact (~10–18 healing) ()
	•	E – Veil of Lightforce: Lays healing wall that heals on contact & grants healing boost (~45 + 15%) for duration ()
	•	Right-click – Dagger Storm: Launch volley of daggers; creates area-of-effect heal-over-time zone (~55 HPS for 6 s) ()

Shared Abilities
	•	Shift: Switch between Cloak and Dagger forms with separate cooldowns ()
	•	Ultimate – Eternal Bond: Three or four rapid dashes in sequence, damaging enemies and healing allies along path (~30 DPS / ~220 HPS) ()
	•	Team-Up – From Shadow to Light: With Moon Knight, creates Light & Dark Realm where he becomes invisible; enhances healing (~15%) ()

⸻

🔧 Strengths & Weaknesses
	•	Strengths:
	•	Flexible support: healing, defensive zoning, blink invisibility, area denial.
	•	High utility: switch forms to support or debuff at will.
	•	Strong ult: dual threat—burst heal and burst damage.
	•	Weaknesses:
	•	Skill‐intensive: requires correct timing and good form-switch rotation.
	•	Not a heavy healer—works best with burst healers.
	•	Vulnerable to disjointed teams—needs grouped allies ()

⸻

🎨 Visual & Design Notes
	•	Contrast design: Cloak is dark, ghostly, shadow-wreathed; Dagger is bright, sleek, radiant.
	•	Energy FX:
	•	Cloak’s teleport: black mist & distortion field
	•	Dagger’s daggers/walls: glowing white-blue light
	•	Ultimate: streaks of black and white intertwining
	•	Body language: Cloak stoic and brooding; Dagger fluid, energetic, assertive

⸻

🔗 Lore & Favorites
	•	Quotes/theme: “We are hope and fear,” emphasizing duality and balance ()
	•	Favorite motifs: redemption, duality, protectiveness of the vulnerable
	•	In-game banter highlights their synergy and supportive roles

⸻

🤝 Team Role & Synergies
	•	Role: Strategist – off-healer, utility disrupter, mobility support
	•	Affiliation: Marvel Knights, Runaways, X‑Men, Secret Avengers  ￼ ￼
	•	Best with:
	•	Tanks and durable DPS (e.g., Hulk, Magneto)—Cloak’s debuffs and invis support diving
	•	Burst healers (Jeff, Rocket) to complement sustaining
	•	Moon Knight: synergy ult and stealth realm ()

⸻

🧠 Design Takeaways for Wise Model Creation
	1.	Duality in form & color: build clear visual contrast between powers and personas
	2.	Transitional elegance: smooth switch animations and blended energy aesthetics
	3.	Emotive posture: Cloak subtle movement and tension; Dagger confident and open stance
	4.	Balanced proportions: athletic and agile, masculine/feminine form tailored to mobility
	5.	Energy dynamics: incorporate visual bits of healing or corruption motifs

Growth and decay form

Concept & Theme
	•	Duality embodied: This skin embraces the balance of life and death—light and shadow fused in a single aesthetic. Cloak’s dark, nature-warped appearance contrasts sharply with Dagger’s radiant, ethereal form  ￼ ￼.
	•	Fantasy inspiration: Think mystical elves and enchanted forests—Dagger resembles a guardian spirit, while Cloak channels a dark forest sentinel or bramble-covered reaper ().

⸻

👥 Character Designs

Dagger
	•	Color palette: Predominantly white with light green highlights—represents life and purity  ￼.
	•	Accents: Pink thorny elements on her boots and gloves, evoking blooming vines or floral armor  ￼.
	•	Headpiece: A delicate golden crown or circlet adds regal, fae-like nobility to her silhouette ().

Cloak
	•	Dark tones: Cloaked in black and charcoal, with emerald-green highlights—echoing decaying foliage and vines ().
	•	Horned form: Massive, twisted horns curve from his hood, reinforcing a forest guardian or death deity motif ().
	•	Armor straps: Vines and thorn-like textures wind around his cloak and armor, enhancing the parasitic, entangled aesthetic  ￼.

⸻

🎨 Aesthetic & VFX
	•	Nature motifs: The duo is adorned with growing vines, thorn patterns, and bioluminescent green glows, reflecting the skin’s core theme  ￼.
	•	Skin rarity & bundle: Rendered at Epic quality, available standalone (1,400 units) or in a bundle (1,600 units), which includes emote, MVP animation, spray, and nameplate  ￼.
	•	Visual flair:
	•	Dagger emits subtle green floral bursts during abilities.
	•	Cloak’s shadowy presence ripples with tendrils of living decay.
	•	MVP animations highlight thematic VFX—one player noted “they literally have the other color effects in their MVP animation!”  ￼ ￼.

7.content:
Identity & Appearance
	•	Name: Groot
	•	Species / Ethnicity: Flora colossus from Planet X—an alien tree-being with deep ancestral roots.  ￼
	•	Physical Build: Massive and towering, strong wooden limbs, thick bark-like skin, glowing green highlights. He has a robust, towering forest-warrior physique. ()
	•	Eyes: Green, vividly glowing—convey calm sentiment behind his primal exterior. ()
	•	Hair / Head: Crown-like wooden growths, branching upward like a treetop, sometimes leafed or moss-covered depending on skin variant.
	•	Clothing / Style: Largely natural bark and wood; some skins like Guardians Vol. 3 add subtle armor elements. Variants include bioluminescent moss (Abies Algae), holiday decorations (Holiday Happiness), carved runes/scarves (Carved Traveler), and cosmic Yggdrasil motif (Yggroot).  ￼

⸻

🧠 Personality & Background
	•	Core Traits: Silent, stoic, dependable. Though he speaks little (“I am Groot”), his actions display deep loyalty and wisdom. Acts as team’s sentinel.  ￼
	•	Personality Vibes: Calm protector, patient and gentle, yet fearless in the face of conflict. He’s nurturing—both in defending allies and growing roots/walls.
	•	Backstory Highlights:
	•	Native to Planet X, potentially exiled for moral reasons.  ￼
	•	Rises from splinter to full warrior; bonds strongly with Rocket Raccoon and Guardians of the Galaxy.
	•	In Marvel Rivals, he battles cosmic threats like Knull on Klyntar alongside the Guardians.  ￼

8.content:
Identity & Background
	•	Real Name: Peter Jason Quill
	•	Heritage: Half-human (Earth), half-Spartoi (alien royalty from the Spartax Empire)  ￼
	•	Role: Leader of the Guardians of the Galaxy; a roguish strategist turned hero committed to protecting his team and the galaxy

⸻

🧬 Appearance & Build
	•	Hair: Blonde, medium-length, sometimes tousled under a helmet; varies by skin (e.g., “Lion’s Mane” with golden mane)  ￼
	•	Eyes: Typically brown or blue (comic/Movie), default game skins show natural eyes; MCU helmet version offers glowing lenses
	•	Body Build: Athletic, lean, agile — built for mobility and acrobatics, not brute force
	•	Ethnicity: Mixed heritage — human father’s lineage with alien Spartoi royalty adds a distinctive cosmic-human blend ()

⸻

👕 Clothing & Skins

Star‑Lord’s armor blends tactical gear with cosmic flair — a balance of street-smart utility and interstellar swagger. Multiple skins reflect his lore and alternate styles:  ￼
	1.	Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 (Default)
	•	Blue tactical suit, red shoulder pads, chest Guardians emblem, dark boots — grounded MCU aesthetic
	2.	Master of the Sun
	•	Sleek black/orange-gold cosmic design, glowing accents, golden hair/beard (based on comic arc)
	3.	Jovial Star
	•	Red/grey casual ensemble with metallic underarmor — heroic yet relaxed vibe
	4.	Lion’s Mane
	•	Fur-trimmed vest, white pants, hairstyle evoking a celestial mane — regal with springtime flair

⸻

🧠 Personality
	•	Charismatic & Humorous: Witty, quick with quips, with that classic “space outlaw” charm
	•	Leaderly & Self‑Aware: Though not born a leader, his resilience and earnest care for friends shine through
	•	Balanced Temperament: Light‑hearted bravado balanced with loyalty, responsibility, and occasional emotional depth — especially linked to his heritage

⸻

⚔️ Weapons
	•	Element Guns (Dual Blasters): Fires energy/proof bullets with elemental variants (fire, ice, electric, knock-back)– fast rate with spread, ideal for close-range DPS  ￼ ￼ ￼ ￼
	•	Jet Boots: Worn on boots for short flights, dodge maneuvers, and enhanced agility

Ability
Description
Primary – Element Guns
Rapid-fire dual blasters: 6.5 DPS per shot, 40 rounds, critical hits & spread increase; best at close‑mid range  
RMB – Stellar Shift
Two-charge dodge dash with ~0.37 s invincibility, instantly reloads guns, ideal for survival ()
Shift – Rocket Propulsion
Sustained flight/dash using energy pool (1200 max, uses 300/sec, recharges 100/sec), great for repositioning ()
E – Blaster Barrage
Area bombshell: 3 s rapid fire in 8 m radius, ~8 damage per hit (~240 total), good for grouped foes ()
Q – Galactic Legend (Ultimate)
Free-flight mode: 8 s duration, auto-tracking bullets (no crits), +20% speed, 70% reload boost, locks at 30 m range ()
Passive – Leader’s Soul (Team-Up)
With Adam Warlock, gains cocoon revival and flight capability for 12–13 s after death, 120 s cooldown ()

Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths:
	•	Top-tier DPS potential with sustained Element Guns (especially headshots)  ￼
	•	Exceptional mobility: dodge reloads + sustained flight
	•	Blaster Barrage = potent team fight burst
	•	Ultimate offers locking precision + aerial dominance

Weaknesses:
	•	Spread and falloff reduce effectiveness beyond ~25 m  ￼ ￼
	•	No healing — squishy and reliant on dodges/positioning
	•	Ultimate lacks critical hits, reliant on tracking accuracy

9.content:
Identity & Background
	•	Name: Dr. Robert Bruce Banner, aka The Incredible Hulk  ￼
	•	Universe: Hails from Earth‑TRN1444—an original Marvel Rivals reality separate from mainstream 616  ￼
	•	Affiliation: Vanguard role, aligned with Avengers  ￼
	•	Origin: A famed genius scientist from Dayton, Ohio; through gamma experiments, Banner learned to coexist with his Hulk alter‑ego, mastering transformations and gamma control  ￼

⸻

🎭 Personality & Traits
	•	Dual Nature:
	•	Bruce Banner – Calm, reserved intellect; supports allies from afar, tactical and cautious  ￼
	•	Hero Hulk – Heroic, resilient, driven by righteous fury; embraces strength while maintaining control  ￼
	•	Monster Hulk – Unrestrained powerhouse: aggressive, unstoppable, primal expression of rage-fueled might  ￼
	•	Tone & Voice: Banner voiced by Joe Zieja; Hulk by Fred Tatasciore—voice cues reflect transformation calls: “I’m… Hulking… OUT!” and “NOW HULK MAD!”  ￼

⸻

💪 Appearance & Build
	•	Bruce Banner: Average-built human—brown hair, brown eyes. Wears simple, practical attire suitable for fieldwork  ￼
	•	Hulk Forms:
	•	Massive, muscular, hulking green-skinned figure
	•	Hero Hulk: Black hair, green eyes, colossal physique (~6–7 m/s movespeed)  ￼
	•	Monster Hulk: Bulkier, more rugged with enhanced muscle definition and raw aggression visually emphasized ()
	•	Clothing: Maintains iconic torn pants in both Hulk forms, hinting at Banner’s human origins; no upper garments—classic stripped-down brute look.

⸻

🛠️ Abilities & Forms

1. Bruce Banner
	•	Gamma Ray Gun (LMB): Rapid-fire ranged shots (16 dmg, headshots 32) build gamma energy  ￼
	•	Gamma Grenade (LShift): AoE explosive that knocks enemies (and Banner) airborne and restores gamma  ￼
	•	Puny Banner (Q): Transforms into Hero Hulk—invulnerable during transformation, fastest-charging ultimate in game  ￼

⸻

2. Hero Hulk
	•	Heavy Blow (LMB): Swinging melee chains (~40 dmg at ~2/sec)  ￼
	•	Gamma Burst (RMB): Piercing ranged shockwave (~70 dmg) every ~8 s  ￼
	•	Indestructible Guard (LShift): 5 m shield grants 250 to Hulk / 100 to allies; damage absorbed converts to gamma energy for Hulk Smash  ￼
	•	Radioactive Lockdown (E): Immobilizes enemies (~5 dmg, 2 s), broken by Hulk’s own attacks  ￼
	•	Incredible Leap (Space): Charged jump (up to 25 m/s) that can cling to walls and knock flying foes down  ￼
	•	Hulk Smash! (Q): Transforms into Monster Hulk—12 s buff, invincible start, greatly enhanced stats  ￼

⸻

3. Monster Hulk
	•	Heavy Blow: Stronger melee (can launch foes upward)  ￼
	•	Gamma Burst: Faster, more powerful projectile (~125 dmg) with shorter cooldown (~1 s)  ￼
	•	Incredible Leap: Retains leap capability from Hero Hulk  ￼
	•	Radioactive Lockdown: Similar to Hero Hulk but likely faster ()
	•	World Breaker (Q ultimate upgrade): Grabs and pummels enemies (5 hits × 40 dmg), with 30% damage reduction during the attack  ￼

⸻

🤝 Team-Up Abilities
	•	Gamma Boost: Passively sends gamma energy to Iron Man and Doctor Strange; Hulk variants gain +100 Max HP  ￼
	•	Gamma Fastball (with Wolverine): Activate to lift and throw Wolverine up to 20 m, enhancing dive-combo play  ￼

⸻

🌟 Strengths & Weaknesses

Strengths:
	•	Incredible front-line durability, area disruption, team shielding and CC
	•	Transformation grants layered health bars and burst phase
	•	Strong synergy with Avengers dive compositions (Iron Man, Namor, Wolverine)  ￼

Weaknesses:
	•	Bruce Banner is extremely frail; requires quick transformation
	•	Vulnerable to ranged harassment and crowd control
	•	Monster Hulk lacks ally-shielding ability and relies on cooldowns effectively

⸻

🎯 Role & Composition
	•	Class: Vanguard (Tank / Enforcer)
	•	Optimal Teams:
	•	Pair with Iron Man, Doctor Strange for sustained gamma—boost team durability
	•	Dive synergy: Wolverine, Spider‑Man, Venom for aggressive flanking combos
	•	Support anchors: Mantis, Luna Snow, Jeff the Land Shark for healing and peel  ￼ ￼ ￼

⸻

🎨 Model Design Notes
	•	Visual: Hulking musculature with defined vascular flow, cracking-torn pants, primal and raw.
	•	Effects: Radiant gamma energy in shield, bursts, leap dust, and transformation glow; world-smashing visual cues.
	•	Animation: Transition animations emphasize struggle/pain flipping forms; leaping should feel weighty and powerful.

⸻

💬 Flavor & Quotes
	•	Banner/Hulk interplay: “Hulk and I, we’re a team.”  ￼
	•	Ultimate cues: “I’m… Hulking… OUT!” (transformation), “NOW HULK MAD!” (Monster)  ￼

10.content:
Name & Identity

Name: Hela (ᚺᛖᛚᚨ)
Aliases: Goddess of Death, Queen of Death, Queen of Hel, Raven Queen

⸻

👁️ Appearance & Physique
	•	Hair: Long black mane, flowing in-game and often shadowed by her horns/crown  ￼.
	•	Eyes: Piercing green—cold and supernatural ().
	•	Ethnicity & Heritage: Asgardian deity with Jötunheimr roots—full-blooded giant lineage  ￼.
	•	Skin Tone: Pale to greyish, with a faint ashen quality typical of Hel’s ruler.
	•	Body Build: Tall (7 ft in lore), statuesque and athletic – oversized yet elegant  ￼ ￼.
	•	Attire & Visual Style:
	•	Sleek, dark armor – black and turquoise/emerald highlight palette.
	•	Elven-like armor plates, slender with sharp lines, full-length cloak trailing like mist.
	•	Winged horned headdress or crown motif enhances her regal menace ().

⸻

🎭 Personality & Lore
	•	Core Persona: Regal, ruthless, coldly determined. She demands respect and obedience, pursuing death’s dominion over life.
	•	Philosophy: Believes death is cosmic balance; not ‘evil’ but inevitability.
	•	Ambition: Expand Hel’s influence across realms—even challenging Odin and Valhalla—always aiming for ultimate power  ￼.
	•	Game Lore: Seized chrono-infused power from the Timestream Entanglement; allies briefly with symbiotes via Knull but remains dominantly sovereign over death itself  ￼.
	•	Voice: Whispered menace by Nika Futterman; haunting and imperious  ￼.

⸻

⚔️ Weapons & Visual Effects
	•	Nightsword Thorns: Razor-sharp enchanted daggers—black blades that fly with lethal intent  ￼.
	•	Piercing Night: Summons multiple daggers that latch, then explode—ideal for ambush strikes  ￼.
	•	Soul Drainer: Glowing orb that sucks in enemies and imbues stun; likely with ghostly green-black aura  ￼.
	•	Astral Flock: Temporarily transforms Her into a spectral crow—visually mist-like wings and full invulnerability  ￼.
	•	Goddess of Death Ult: Spectacular ultimate with aerial vantage, raining exploding crows in first-person, 1000 HP shielded  ￼.
	•	Passive – Nastrond Crowstorm: Final blows spawn crow entities that detonate—adds cursed, necro ambience  ￼.

Ability
Description & Mechanics
Primary – Nightsword Thorn
8‑ammo hitscan daggers, high headshot potential, falloff over distance  .
Secondary – Piercing Night
Launches 4 daggers with delayed explosion; great for group damage ().
E – Soul Drainer
Lobbed sphere that pulls and stuns enemies (~0.3 s), useful for setups ().
Shift – Astral Flock
Transform into invulnerable crow, dash ~18 m, cooldown ~15 s ().
Passive – Nastrond Crowstorm
Spawns exploding crow at kill site after ~1.8 s ().
Passive – Hel’s Descent
Slow-fall glide while airborne ().
Ultimate – Goddess of Death
10 s aerial mode, deals AoE via crows (125 explosion, ~6 m radius) with separate 1000 HP pool ().
Team-Up – Queen of Hel
With Thor/Loki, final blow at their respawn revives them; if alive, grants bonus health + team damage +15% ().

Strengths & Weaknesses
	•	Strengths:
	•	Lethal long-range DPS with precision; excels aerial and control zones.
	•	Strong area denial via passive crow explosions.
	•	Ultimate grants aerial invulnerability and map control.
	•	Exceptional team benefit with Thor/Loki synergy  ￼ ￼.
	•	Weaknesses:
	•	Fragile without mobility; vulnerable to flankers.
	•	Reliant on aim and cooldown coordination.
	•	Exposed if ultimate used improperly.

⸻

🤝 Team & Synergies
	•	Role: Duelist (sniper/long-range)
	•	Affiliation: Gods of Asgard mythos, aligns with Thor & Loki via Queen of Hel synergy  ￼ ￼ ￼.
	•	Ideal Pairings: Works best with Thor/Loki for revivals; allies benefit from her disruption and aerial pressure.

⸻

🧊 Favorite Themes & Design Tips
	•	Themes: Death, balance, sovereignty. Her aesthetic should exude aristocratic menace with underworld mystique.
	•	Energy Colors: Deep blacks with turquoise/emerald glows; crow feathers with soul-luminescence.
	•	Movement & Animations: Flowing cape like fog, subtle crow silhouettes following movement, dagger twirls, ominous whispers.
	•	Facial Expression: Cold, regal, predatory—cloak half-reveal decaying/undead motifs for silent threat.

⸻

📝 Summation

Hela in Marvel Rivals is a commanding duelist—an ethereal sniper with death-themed flair. Model her with striking contrasts: slender yet powerful, regal but ominous. Ensure her weapons, aura, and animations emphasize her dominion over death, her crow-summoned army, and her celestial cruelty. She’s a portrait of elegance wrapped in shadow, a strategic sniper who sees the battlefield as her kingdom of souls.

Concept & Theme
	•	Cosmic Sovereign: A unique, game-original skin from Season 0 that reimagines Hela as an astral empress rather than an Underworld queen  ￼.
	•	Lore Flavor: The flavor text captures her terrifying majesty—“she listens to the last cry of every mournful soul across the Ten Realms”  ￼.

⸻

🎨 Visual Design & Color Palette
	•	Primary Colors: Elegant bleached whites and aquamarine/emerald greens, accented with opulent gold detailing ().
	•	Headpiece: Tall, ornate gold crown framing her face in celestial motifs, befitting a cosmic empress  ￼.
	•	Armor: Sleek, flowing gown-armor hybrid: fitted white bodice with sculpted gold trim, extending into layered emerald-green skirts and translucent cosmic cape ().
	•	Body Details: Underlying starry patterns and glowing nebula-like particles visible through her form; some players note a “black hole” at her chest in motion ().

⸻

✨ Visual Effects & Animations
	•	Cosmic Glow: Subtle shimmering through her gown and crown, hinting at celestial energy within  ￼.
	•	Nebula Resonance: When she moves or activates abilities, radiant aquamarine particle trails evoke drifting stardust and cosmic mist  ￼.
	•	Crown Details: The sphere-and-spire motifs on her crown softly pulse in sync with her ultimate or idle emotes, creating regal animation loops.

Her “queen in black” form
Appearance & Aura
	•	Color Palette: Dominated by deep blacks and swirling symbiote-infused textures, with haunting emerald-green accents and veins of dark purple—reflecting Knull’s corruption  ￼.
	•	Armor & Silhouette: Sleek, elongated armor plates resembling living symbiote material, with dynamic spiky edges and tendrils that writhe subtly—creating a sense of organic menace.
	•	Crown/Headdress: A jagged, asymmetrical symbiote-crown, darker than her classic horns, often dripping with black ooze, giving her an even more regal yet corrupted aura ().
	•	Hair & Face: Her dark hair is streaked or partially overtaken by symbiote-black, falling slightly longer or unkempt. Facial details are sharper, almost skeletal, with darker skin as if shadowed from within.
	•	Eyes: Glowing green eyes, more pronounced and luminous—emitting an otherworldly, corrupted light.
	•	Details: Occasional symbiote tendrils flicker and detach from her armor, especially her chest and shoulders, visualizing pure parasite energy.

⸻

🧬 Lore & Empowerment
	•	Transformation Source: Transformed into “Queen in Black” by Knull after being infused with symbiote powers—becoming a key instrument in spreading symbiote corruption across the Chronoverse  ￼.
	•	Themes: Symbolizes her alliance with Knull—death capacity enhanced by parasitic symbiosis; royalty corrupted through darkness.
